loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline is 36 years old. She is married with five children aged between 11 years and 1 month, and three of them go to school. She sells vegetables and has been running a business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more carrots and tomatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more carrots and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Derphin

texts.en:
Derphin is 44 years. He is married, with five children between 20 and 8 years old. All of them go to school. He sells shoes, and has been running a business for the past 10 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Marcy, age 21, opened a new business one month ago. She has been working hard to manage her boutique, where she sells secondhand clothing items. She lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda.

To help expand her business, Marcy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to offer for sale, and will help Marcy to generate greater profits, which will in turn allow her to better support herself and start to build savings. 

Marcy hopes that in the future she will be able to open up more branches of the same business. 

Marcy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Mariela Edelmira

texts.es:
Mariela de 36 años  de edad soltera residente de Suchitepéquez, se ha dedicado a una de las profesiones más solemnes que existen en toda sociedad como lo es la venta de ropa casual y la venta de zapatos.  Ella tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La  actividad que ella realiza es la venta  de ropa casual y la venta de zapatos, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante más de diez años, ella tubo esa iniciativa porque  en la comunidad  donde ella vive no existen estos negocios y es por ella que ella se decidió a realizarla y le ha dejado muy buena ganancia para el sostenimiento de su familia.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de mercadería de ropa y zapatos ya que para ella es de mucha importancia contar con mercadería para  atender a las personas con una surtida y variedad de prendas y zapatos y así ella puede tener un ingreso económico par el sostenimiento de su familia.

Una de las aspiraciones de Mariela es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en la vida y ampliar más el negocio con que ella cuenta.
texts.en:
Mariela is 36 years old. She is single and lives in Suchitepequez. She lives from sell cloths and shoes. She has four children; two of them already have their own families, and the other are students in the community school.

She has been selling garments and shoes for more than ten years. She had this initiative because there were not these kind of businesses in the area. Therefore,she decided to do it and she has have great success to maintain her family.

The motive behind this loan is to purchase different merchandise to be offered to her clients. The idea is to have economical income to maintain her family. 

Among her dreams, she wants to see her children growing, becoming professionals and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Cada mañana Luis alista con mucho orgullo su uniforme policial para iniciar su día laboral como investigador policial, trabajo que ha realizado por más de 16 años. Tiene 37 años, está acompañado y tiene seis hijos. Es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, estudió la carrera de Derecho con mención ambiental, carrera que desde joven quería estudiar para colaborar con la justicia y el orden social. Esta agradecido por el apoyo incondicional que le brinda su familia y sus superiores, puesto que lo motivan a cumplir sus metas e ideales.
Luis solicita un crédito para pagar el curso del diplomado, meta que está cumpliendo los días sábados. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que actualmente no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios y no quiere perder la oportunidad de obtener su diploma y reforzar sus conocimientos. Entre sus planes futuros está seguir profesionalizándose, de manera que pueda obtener mejores ofertas de trabajo, lo que le brindará la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida y así podrá ofrecerle a su familia salud y educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Every morning Luis proudly puts on his police uniform to begin his working day as a police investigator, his job for more than 16 years. He is 37 years old, has a partner and 6 children and is very hard-working and enterprising. He studied a degree in Law with a major in Environmental Law, which he wanted to study since he was a boy so he could work in the area of justice and social order. He is thankful for the unconditional support of his family and superiors, motivating him to meet his goals and achieve his dreams. 

Luis is applying for a loan to pay for his diploma course which he studies for every Saturday. He is counting on the funding because at the moment he doesn't have the necessary economic resources to pay for it himself but he doesn't want to lose the opportunity to obtain his diploma and reinforce his knowledge. Among his future plans are to continue developing himself professionally so that he can get better work offers, giving him the chance to improve his standard of life which will in turn enable him to pay for quality health and education services for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his diploma course.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en: Jonas is 39 years old. He is married and he has five children between 17 and 5 years old, and all of them go to school. He has a shop and he has been running a business for the past three years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, biscuits and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school for his children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, biscuits and salt for resale.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 29 years old. She is married. She has a shop and has been running her business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes, banana and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, beans and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: ABY est une femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Etant à son 4ème prêt, elle demande ce dernier pour acheter des tissus et diversifier ses marchandises. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. Comme toutes les femmes de son pays, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. ABY souhaite voyager en chine pour acheter des marchandises de qualité et augmenter ses revenus. De ce fait elle pourra épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Aby, a married mother, works as a fabric vendor, an area in which she has over 10 years of experience. This will be her fourth loan. With this loan, she would like to purchase fabrics and diversify her merchandise. She starts her day at 9 AM and finishes at 8 PM. Like all women in her country, she assists her husband with their family's daily expenses and their children's school fees. Aby wishes to travel to China in order to buy quality merchandise and increase her revenue. By doing this, she will be able to save some money and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to resell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small pigs to care for,raise and sell them.

loans.name: Rohit

texts.en:
Rohit is 37 years old, a differently-abled man who lives in a small village of Balangir district of Odisha, India with his parents, wife, and a child. 

He owns a grocery store in his house where he sells basic household items and makes a profit of 4,000 INR per month. 

He is a very responsible and hardworking man and he is the only one of the family members who earns some money. He wants to expand his business by adding new items in his grocery shop so that he can fulfill the demands of customers.

He has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase items in bulk such as biscuits, spices, edible oil, sugar, etc., for his grocery shop. He has a dream to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase items in bulk such as biscuits, spices, edible oil, sugar, etc., for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Ze Carlos

texts.es:
Ze Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, vive en el Caserio de Carrasquillo del Distrito de Buenos Aires, el cual es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos(agua y luz). Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Ze Carlos es la producción y venta de platano, actividad que realiza hace más de 02 años, contando con clientela fija. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en compra de una mototaxi, pues Ze Carlos tiene ahorrado S/. 2000.00 fruto de su cosecha y juento con el dinero que obtendrá por el préstamo comprará su mototaxi al contado. La compra le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos y a ampliar su negocio, ya que en dicha mototaxi podra entregar su producto(platanos) a tiempo a todos sus clientes. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que aumentado demanda por platano en la zona y además Ze Carlo piensa trabajar por las noches brindando el servicio de transporte urbano en su mototaxi por lo que generará ingresos adicionales futuros.
texts.en:
Ze Carlos is 32 years old and single.  He lives in the Carrasquillo settlement in the Buenos Aires district.  This is a place where the inhabitants work in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.  It has basic services (water and electricity).  This district is located in the Morropón province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Ze Carlos’s business activity is producing and selling bananas.  He has been doing this for over two years, and he does have fixed clientele.  

The loan will be used to buy a ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  Ze Carlos has saved 2,000 soles from his harvest.  Together with the money that he will get from the loan, he will buy his mototaxi for cash.

The purchase will help him to get better income and to expand his business.  With the mototaxi he will be able to deliver his products (bananas) on time to his customers.

The market presents good prospects because the demand for bananas in the area has increased.   In addition, Ze Carlos plans to work at night providing urban transportation service in his mototaxi.  This will generate additional income in the future.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Janet has been working hard to manage her small mobile meat business, which sells packed meat. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh meat to sell, and will help Janet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for the children and her house rent. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh meat to sell

loans.name: Alba Argentina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Caminos.
Aquí vive la señora Alba, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura pero solo por ciertas temporadas.
Doña Alba para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que él no trabaja en ocasiones  hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde tres días de la semana prepara y vende salchichas y el delicioso hornado de chancho, plato muy apetecido por sus clientes, ella en su local también vende agua en bidón, colas y varios productos más que le sirven para generar mejores ingresos, también prepara comidas y bocadillos para fiestas y compromisos sociales, lleva más de 20  años con este negocio con el cual se gana algo ya que su marido no gana mucho en su labor.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar salchichas, carne de chancho y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva más de 13 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every fortnight in the city of Santa Ana, which is known for its beautiful landscapes and lovely freshwater springs which are visited by many tourists, the members of the “Nuevos Caminos” [“New Paths”] communal bank meet.

It is there that Alba lives. She is 63 years old and married. She has three grown-up and independent children from this marriage. Her husband makes a living from agriculture, but only in certain seasons.

Since her husband doesn’t work sometimes, Alba began her own business several years ago in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a small stall in her house where, three days a week, she makes and sells salchichas [sausages] and the delicious hornado de chancho [slow-roasted pork] that her clients crave so much. She also sells water in large containers, fizzy drinks, and several other products in her stall, which helps her to generate greater revenue. She also prepares meals and bocadillos [could refer to either filled baguettes or fruit-filled pastries] for parties and social engagements. She has had this business for more than 20 years, and it helps her to earn something since her husband doesn’t earn a lot from his work.

She is going to use this loan to buy salchichas, pork and other supplies for making her food. She has been with the communal bank for more than 13 years and she likes it because of the help it gives her to get ahead in life. Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy salchichas (sausages), pork, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Meljun is 17 years old and is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. He is currently in the 1st year of this 4-year course.

Amelita, mother of Meljun and a member of NWTF needs a PHP 5,000 PHP loan to pay for Meljun's tuition fees of the first semester of school year 2014-2015.

When he graduates, Meljun plans to find a good job near his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is a farmer from Debet village in the Loriregion. She lives with her husband and two children (her 20-year-old son and 18-year-old daughter). Gohar's husband works in the auto repair service, and Gohar herself has been involved in a farming business. They are the main breadwinners of the family. Gohar is also engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, and hens, and in the cultivation of potatoes. Her family members help her in selling the agricultural products in the local market. As the family’s needs are increasing on a day-to-day basis, Gohar wants to expand her agribusiness to more effectively cover the family’s expenses. She needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase forage for the livestock (grass and barley). Gohar and her family members highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock (grass and barley)

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives in the village of Lor in the Syunik region with her husband and their two children. She is an agronomist with 17 years of experience. Her husband works in the village milk factory. He is the main breadwinner for the family. However, his salary is so low that they cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. Lilit herself is engaged in breeding cows, sheep, calves, and hens, and in the cultivation of wheat and potatoes. She sells her agricultural products in the local market, and this provides an important source of income for the family. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Lilit is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 2,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase forage for her livestock as well as to buy wheat seed and fuel for land cultivation. 

As this is Lilit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 

Lilit and her family rely heavily on the goodwill of their lenders. They appreciate their support in offering them this much-needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her livestock as well as to buy wheat seed and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Grupo Sector Vista Hermosa, Aldea Los Encuentros Group

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 42 años de edad residente en Sololá, soltera con cinco hijos el primero ya tiene vida independiente y los cuatro últimos se dedican a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia, (Dolores es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)

La actividad que realiza es la venta de ropa típica ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de frutas, siempre tratando la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a sus hijos el estudio que se merecen y que algún día lleguen a ser  profesionales en la vida.

El uso respectivo que dará al préstamo que  está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de ropa típica tales como hilos y telas para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Dolores y un grupo de mujeres más sueñan con llegar a superarse en la vida y ver por los demás que los necesitan para superarse.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de sus mercaderías y ver crecer a sus hijos en la escuela y lleguen a ser  profesionales en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Dolores a woman of 42-year-old female, entrepreneur who lives in Sololá. She is single and has five children. The oldest already has his own independent life, and the other four are studying at the local school. She has to make an enormous effort to sustain her family and try to improve their financial situation. In the photo, she is the first on the left.

Dolores' business activity is to sell traditional clothing. This is an important source of income for her family to improve their living conditions. She has a second business activity selling fruit. She always tries to obtain an extra financial income to give her children the education they deserves to become professionals in life.

Dolores will use this loan to buy merchandise to make traditional clothing, such as thread and fabric. She will then sell the products in her town and neighboring towns to earn a higher income for herself and her family.

Dolores and a women group dream to achieve their goals in life, which are success in life and look out for those who need them.

One of her goals for the future is to buy a business property in her community so that she can sell her merchandise, as well as to see her children grow in school and become professionals with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Mamina

texts.en:
Mamina hails from Maynaguri. She is 26 years old and a married woman. She is married to Bablu and she is the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter).  All are students. They live at Kathalbari, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district. She is illiterate and a housewife.

Mamina's husband is a cycle-van puller. He provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled vehicle which is used widely in rural West Bengal to carry people and goods from one place to another.  It is a very popular transport which is operated by a cycle . He has been pulling a cycle-van for many years to meet the family's expenses. Now the van requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.  He thought it would be better to purchase a new van rather repairing the old one. 

For this reason, Mamina has applied for a loan from BJS for her husband. He wants to buy new cycle-van with the loan. This will help him run his business more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Mamina hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and that it will bring positive changes to his business.

She wants to utilise the profit for better education for her children. She owes a lot to her lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati is a 29-year-old married woman from a rural village of the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal.  She studied till grade four.  She is married to Phagu, an electrician by profession. His income is inconsistent. This young couple is blessed with one son who is too young for school.  

To give financial support to her family, she runs her own dairy business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. Now she wants to expand her business. She decided to supply milk products like curd, cottage cheese, and ghee, along with milk, to her customers. The additional cow will grow her asset base and increase her income through milk production. The cow will also help in getting cow dung which she sells as fertilizer to the farmers.

With the aim to satisfy her customers’ demands, Bhagabati seeks to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a new cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Bhagabati wants to strengthen the family economy and help her child in education.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali is a 31-year -old, hardworking, married woman.  She hails from a remote village Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is uneducated and can sign her name only. She is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). All attend school. Shyamali's husband Prabhat is a blacksmith and his income is not enough to support his family's household expenses.

Before starting a milk production business, Shyamali’s family often lived in hand-to-mouth conditions. She decided to support her family for a better and secure future for her children. Her customers are satisfied and give her value due to her honesty in business. She has very good behavior so her customers are increasing gradually. Her business is doing well enough to give her a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children with good education, food and clothing. 

Shyamali is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a new cow for milking. She wants to increase milk production according to the customers' need and the increasing number of customers. She wants to use the profit from the business on her family needs and reinvest in her business. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing higher living standards and education to her children.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow in order to generate income.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino tiene 70 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos nietos de 13 años y 6 años de edad. Paulino se dedica a la compra y venta de de ganado desde hace 40 años, por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y reconocimiento en el mercado. Paulino desea construir una fosa séptica y un baño sanitario para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, etc. para dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Paulino is 70 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his two nephews, who are 13 and 6 years of age. For 40 years, Paulino has made a living by buying and selling livestock, so he has a lot of experience and is recognised in the market. Paulino wishes to build a septic tank and a bathroom, which is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest it in buying cement, sand, brick, gravel, and other things so that he can start building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and other things for building a septic tank and a bathroom.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda, age 48 and widowed, farms corn to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for over six years. With her farming income, she has also been able to start up a retail store selling general use goods in her village. She has six children. 
 
In order to have a greener farm, Leonarda requested a new loan in order to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm.  

Her goal is to improve the general living conditions of her  family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, such as manure, for her corn farm

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is 35 years old, unmarried and lives with her family. From last year, Maria has run a small pharmacy, selling over-the-counter medicine to her neighborhood to generate income for her family. She dreams to become financially stable and to expand her business by increasing sales and inventory. 

She aims to continue and improve her business and one day open a second branch. For this reason, Araceli would like a loan of MXN3,500 to increase her shelf space and expand her inventory.

This is Maria Guadalupe's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to build more shelves and expand her pharmacy's inventory

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
To make a living, Eddie provides transportation services in his village. He also has a farm as his main source of income. For more than three years, he has earned well from his services to cover his daily expenditures.  

Eddie needs repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle to improve the services to his customers. With the microfinance loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), his plan was realized. 

In the future, Eddie wants to acquire a new unit of motorcycle and use it for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture and livestock. Age 38 years; he is married and has four children. It is clear that Nelson works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to do their homeworks and improve the living conditions.
Nelson is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Ana Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Caminos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo  mayor de edad e independiente. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en un centro artesanal de la ciudad.
Doña Ana con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa,  trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que siempre le llevan sus trabajos, en temporadas elabora uniformes de colegios y escuelas del cantón, en estos días es cuando más trabajo tiene y mejores ganancias le deja. Lleva más de 40 años con esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a su hijo ella sola y aun le sirve para salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fortnight in the city of Santa Ana, which is known for its beautiful landscapes and lovely freshwater springs which are visited by many tourists, the members of the “Nuevos Caminos” [“New Paths”] communal bank meet.

Ana lives in this place. She is a 57-year-old single mother with a grown-up and independent son. She learnt how to cut and sew at an artisanal centre in the city several years ago.

With the goal of earning her own income and making the most of her knowledge in cutting and sewing, she set up a small sewing workshop in her house. She makes all kinds of clothes. She makes her clothes to order; there are particular people who always bring her work. In certain seasons she makes uniforms for high schools and schools in the canton. It is then that she has more work and has greater profits. She has been doing this work for more than 40 years. It is how she managed to provide for her son by herself and it still helps her to get ahead in life.

She is going to use this new loan to buy fabric and other materials for sewing. She has been with the communal bank since almost the beginning and she likes it because the loans are a lot of help to her. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials for sewing

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla and her husband are farmers. They harvest and sell bananas and vegetables to earn an income. Rosevilla sells the produce at market, and they are able to support themselves and their two children with this business.

To improve the farm, Rosevilla requested a loan from GDMPC. She will use her loan funds to purchase organic fertilizer for her farm. She is determined to provide an adequate living for her family.  

She hopes that someday the general living situation of her family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kititale, in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past two years, Sandra has been working hard to manage her photo studio, in which she takes and prints photos. 

To help expand her business, Sandra has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more color printers and papers and will help Sandra to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings and herself. 

Sandra hopes that, in the future, she will be able to improve on and expand the business. 

Sandra is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more color printers and papers for her business.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is a farmer from the village of Shaghat in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, who receives a retirement pension. To supplement this and to earn an income, Lyudmila is engaged in aviculture and in raising cows and pigs, as well as in cultivating wheat, barley, emmer wheat, and potatoes. She sells these agricultural products in the local market, providing an important source of their income. 

With the help of this 2,500 USD loan, Lyudmila's agribusiness will function more efficiently and productively. The loan funds will help her greatly by enabling her to purchase two calves, forage for her livestock, seeds, and fuel for land cultivation. 

Lyudmila relies highly on the goodwill of her lenders. She is very grateful to them for their help in offering her this much-needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase two calves, forage for her livestock, seeds, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Shaki community in the Syunik region with her husband and 26-year-old son. She is a farmer with 25 years of experience running her family farm. Gayane took a loan from Kiva three years ago and was able to invest in her farming business. She has now realized that her farm is sustainable enough to make it larger.

Gayane is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase forage for livestock. She is a responsible borrower who hopes for lender support once more.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her livestock

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.en:
Maria Jose is 27 years old and lives in a house with her family. For the past few years, she has been making traditional Mexican lunches in her small in-home diner to generate income for her family. She dreams to become financially stable and to expand her business into a formal setting to uplift the living status of her family. 

She aims to continue and improve her business and increase her sales but she has insufficient capital to do so. For this reason, Maria would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase more inventory in bulk, so she can serve more customers and have a better margin of sales.

This is Maria Jose's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk to sell more food at her cafe with a greater margin.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna is 44 years old and married with one son. She is a housewife and in her childhood she could not get enough opportunity for study. She is thankful to her parents who could support up to her secondary education. She is a private tutor who teaches the local children. They live in the small village Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district.

The main income for the family comes from agriculture. Aparna's husband, 56-year-old Anil, is engaged in agribusiness. He has been raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last few years, which he sells to his regular customers. He has good experience in agriculture but his monthly income from this business is too scant to cover the household costs. Agriculture is in high demand in Jalpaiguri because people use fresh fruits and vegetables for different tasty things and his products not only meet their demands but also increasing customers day by day. He now wants to cultivate bitter gourds on his farmland.  This vegetable has a good market in their region.

In order to yield good harvest, Aparna applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good bitter gourd fertilizers and seeds for her husband to start cultivation. She wants to increase her income and provide her family with a good life.

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and bitter gourd seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen sells milk to earn an income. She has successfully built her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. At this point, she has attained many customers and contributes a good amount of income toward sustaining her family's needs. 
 
Kiva has helped Perveen to expand her business, and now she is in her fourth loan cycle. She has applied for a loan in the amount of 45,000 PKR in order to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
Caroline's group is comprised of four hard-working women. Caroline is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, where she offers hairdressing services.

To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan in the amount of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers and braids, and will help Caroline to generate greater profits and help complete her parents' house. Caroline hopes that in the future she will be able to study beauty therapy. 

Caroline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers and braids for her salon

loans.name: Maa Bauti Shg Group

texts.en:
Joystna is the featured borrower for the Maa Bauti Shg. She got together with her other group members to take this loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Joystna is a 39-year-old married mother of one son. Her husband has a limited salary that is not enough to cover the expenses and needs of his family; thus, she decided two years ago to start working in selling fruits and vegetables from her house to help her husband. 

Today, she wants to open her own fruits and vegetable shop in an attempt to increase the income of her family and provide her son with suitable social and financial living conditions; that is why she acquired the current loan.

Joystna is the lady standing with her raised hand in the photo.The other members of this group are engaged in different activities such as grocery shop, milk selling, etc.

loans.use: to open her own fruits and vegetable shop

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 44-year-old married woman. For many years, she has run a milk-selling business with the help of her husband, who is also shown in this photo. The couple sells their milk in the area and earns well enough to pay for the family’s expenses. It’s Zubaida’s seventh year with Kashf Foundation. 

Zubaida is reuqesing a 55,000 PKR loan to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of her loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia lives in Totolapan, Morelos and sells produce from her house. Cecilia has worked very hard to start building what she calls her dream home. It is basically a small two story house. However, when she started to build she found that she wasted a lot of material and made the wrong calculations. She has a complete floor below but the second floor just has the first wall and no staircase. Cecilia recognizes that she needs a little technical orientation and has assisted to some of the workshops Ecoblock gives. She has  finally saved some money to finish what she started years ago and is ready to finish the upstairs room and build the staircase. Cecilia has an informal job and makes around $800 USD a month. Given this, she is not able to go to traditional banks for a credit. Cecilia is asking for a credit to buy the construction materials to start building. She will be trained and supervised by technicians and architects from Ecoblock. Cecilia wants to make sure that the first step she takes is one that will last forever.

loans.use: to build a new room and staircase in her house

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a 51-year-old married woman with four children. For many years, she has run a business purchasing and selling cattle with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. Zohra also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life with good health, food, and clothing. Zohra is in her sixth loan cycle.

Zohra is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sabari

texts.en:
Sabari, age 23 and married, runs a small boutique at home to help provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it into clothing, and then sells the clothing to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

In order to improve her business, Sabari has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR. With her loan funds, she will buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers and deliver them on time. Sabari has a good credit history and this is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors

loans.name: Maa Baishnabidebi Shg Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched house with her family members in a rural village of the Boudh district, Ballabhi is aged 52 years and has two children. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 4,000 INR per month. 

This is group loan for Ballabhi’s group of ten who all are female, and the Maa Baishnabidebi SHG is a first-cycled client with People's Forum. Now Ballabhi  is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ballabhi is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living .Ballabhi is very happy and grateful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en: Aurea finished the room for the two boys. They are excited and happy to have their own space apart from their teenage sister. Now that Aurea has had a very good experience and can see the huge benefits this program brings to her family and their quality of life, she is now asking for a new credit to install a proper floor in her bedroom. Today her floor is mainly earth except for the bathroom. With this loan Aurea and Jeronimo, her husband, will be able to buy the materials needed and work to have a proper floor in their room. Her son and husband will work on the construction and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure it meets the quality and safety standards. Aurea is really excited to continue to contribute toward the completion of a better home and grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy materials to install a proper floor in her bedroom

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a single mother of a teenage boy and together they live in Totolapan, Morelos. Adela has lived with her parents all her live.  Since  her son was born,  she has fought about moving out, but realized that she did not have enough money saved to do so. Since then, with a lot of effort, she started saving little by little. After 16 years she finally saved enough to buy the land in which she will start  the construction of the first room of her house. 

Adela has an informal job and makes around $800 USD a month. Given this, she is not able to go to traditional banks for a credit. Adela is asking for a credit to buy the construction materials to start building. She will be trained and supervised by technicians and architects from Ecoblock. Adela wants to make sure that the first step she takes is one that will last forever. 

Adela also wants to make things right so one day her son can continue living in this house with his future family. Adela has been working almost 16 years for this moment

loans.use: to buy the first room of her new house

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is a married woman who has been running a business, selling milk, for many years with the help of her husband. She has two buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has four children.  She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. This is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to reduce household spending and improve home lighting

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en: Sughra is a 47-year-old married woman. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in the business of selling cloth. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Sughra is in her third loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 46-year-old widow and a mother of one son. After her husband's death, she experienced many difficulties and hurdles in life. But in order to take care of her only son, she began the business of milk selling. She is an uneducated woman, so she had no other better option.  

She lives with her son at Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri.  She could not provide her son with education due to poverty and now he works as a mason. She has had considerable experience in dairy farming and she supplies milk to the local people for earning for the family.

Namita is known in her village for providing good quality milk. She has cows.  However, the income generated is not enough to bear her household expenses; therefore, she now wishes to improve her income by purchasing one more cow. Her belief in life is that changing one's livelihood for the better is an art that lies in the hands of the one who believes it can change.

Now she has requested a loan from BJS, who gives business loans to energetic and enterprising women, to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that the increase in milk production will help her in generating greater income. She wants to get ahead for the betterment of the family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase another milking cow for her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 41, is a married woman who has three children. After she married, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children by giving them an education. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections, and she has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good-quality clothes of different colors. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothes of different colors.

loans.name: Gogoni Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a businesswoman running a genge selling fruits, vegetables, and cooking oil, a business she has been inn for one year. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children, a boy and a girl. One is schooling and the other is still young. She works from 6 AM  to 10 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first credit to be apportioned among Gogoni, a five-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will invest her loan to change her business to a gengeduka. She will buy powdered and bar soap, cooking oil, and sweets. gengeduka. Sophia desires to grow her business to a gengeduka (general store) and be successful.

loans.use: to buy powdered and bar soap, cooking oil, and sweets.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: Munawar is a 44-year-old married woman. For many years, she has been running a business with her husband, selling cattle. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding it, while her husband sells it to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Munawar has requested  a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Roubina

texts.en:
Roubina is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past five years, has been running a cloth-selling business. Roubina buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es: rosa de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos de 19, 16 y 14 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 10 años, posee mucha clientela por las calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos como: lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, etc. y asi continaur con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 36 years old, lives in her own house with her three children, ages 19, 16, and 14, who are now in school. She has been selling products for personal use for 10 years. She has many customers because of the quality of the products and the good prices. She is applying for a loan to buy more products such as lotions, deodorants, perfumes, creams, etc., and thus continue with her sales in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, perfumes, creams, etc., to sell

loans.name: Camino Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Raul tiene 43 años de edad es solero y tiene 02 hijos , el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a brindar el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de gas, músico, laboratorio fotográfico, venta de heladería, empelados públicos.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of the same name.

Raul is 43 years old, single and has two children. He balances his daily activities with his work offering taxi services. He has been in this business for quite a while and things are going well for him thanks to the determination that he brings to his work each day. He is a responsible and persevering person, this being the manner in which he gets his family ahead.

Raul is requesting a loan to buy tires for his car. He feels grateful for the loan offered and promises to comply with the payment of his installments.

The other members work selling gas, in music, a photo lab, selling ice cream, and as public servants. The member that is in the adjoined photo asked permission to arrive late due to work commitments. The person with the face whited out does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es: Martha de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maiz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista asi como muestra en la fotografia la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos, la clienta esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Martha, who is 42 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. She works in agriculture, especially in raising corn. When her harvest is ready, as is shown in the photograph, she sells it in the areas surrounding the zone where she lives. With the earnings that she obtains, she manages to pay the expenses. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc., and thus she will be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Supriya

texts.en:
Supriya is a thriving, helpful, and hardworking woman. She hails from Maynaguri and has a primary education. She is 20 years old, married, and the mother of one son whom she has been raising with great effort and dedication. She lives with her husband and son at Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband Paritosh, aged 36 years, is a car driver by profession. His income is not quite satisfactory; thus, he is unable to meet all the demands of his family. So, to help her husband, Supriya, for the last few years, has learnt the craft of making women's clothing such as blouses, petticoats, salwar suits, and frocks. She is busy with the craft, observing and working alone all day to generate enough to support her husband with the economic burden of supplying household resources.


Supriya wants to continue working hard. She wants to expand her business and generate more income to ensure economic stability and give her family a better quality of life.

She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). With this loan, she intends to purchase a new sewing machine and more stitching material such as needles, spools of thread, etc. She intends to get ahead with the business.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: marta de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crianza de pollos, su granja la tiene ubicada en su lugar de residencia, comercializa los pollos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientela establecida, marta vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un prestamo para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para los pollos y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Marta, who is 44 years old, has been raising chickens for 3 years. Her farm is located at her residence. She sells the chickens in the various markets, and she already has an established clientele. Marta lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She is applying for a loan to purchase vitamins and feed concentrate for the chickens and thus be able to continue with her work, which generates good income for her.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed concentrate for chickens.

loans.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es: irma de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, irma esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como: cremas, desodorantes, lociones, shampoo, perfumes, etc. y poder recibir mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Irma is 44 years old and lives in her own house. She has worked selling personal use products for a number of years. She lives in her own house with her husband and her two children. Irma is requesting  a loan to buy more products wholesale like creams, deodorant, lotions, shampoo, perfume, etc. to be able to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy creams, deodorants, lotions, shampoo, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: ana de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz por quintales y cal, y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and three children. For the past three years she has been selling tortillas. Her business is located in her residence and she has a good clientele. With what she makes from her work she manages to help her husband get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime so she can have greater income.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Ganesh Group

texts.en:
Subhashree is the leader of a group and lives in Unit-6i, Bhubaneswar in the district of Khurdha, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 43 years. She has a small family comprised of four members: herself,  her husband, one son aged15, and one daughter of 18 years. The member standing first from left with raised hand is Subhashree. 

Like most families of her locality, she along with her husband is running a grocery shop selling all daily needs items like rice, dal, sugar, tea, grams, etc., and earning their livelihood.  Their monthly income is near about INR 7,000 per month which is not sufficient to meet their monthly house hold expenses.

One of her children, a daughter named Monalisha, is pursuing a degree in Intermediate in Arts in her second year in Kendriya Vidyalaya, Bhubaneswar. She is a good student and wants to complete and graduate, but due to lack of money she is not in a position to continue her study. 

For continuation of her daughter’s studies,  Subhashree wants a loan of INR 30, 000. Your help will enable Monalisha to continue her studies, since she has a desire to be a banker in the future.

The other three members of Subhashree's group are  Shantilata, Sumitra, and Manju .

loans.use: pay school costs.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Don Marcelino se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración de mil de abeja desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y tiendas, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Don Marcelino esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar madera y redes para reparar las colmenas que muestra en la fotografia y poder seguir con la produccion de mil y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Marcelino has been working for a number of years making honey. He sells his products in the various markets and stores. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his family group.

 Don Marcelino is applying for a loan to be able to buy wood and netting to repair the hives that are shown in the photograph and to be able to continue with the production of honey and have better income.

loans.use: to buy wood and netting to repair his bee hives

loans.name: Banita

texts.en:
Banita is a 45-year-old  widow who lives in the Dhenkanal district of Odisha, India. She has a son aged 17 years who goes to school. 

She is engaged in wheat flour-making and selling.  She has a machine called a flour-making machine. From this, she makes wheat flour and sells it in the market. 

She makes 4,000 INR per month which is not sufficient for her monthly family expenses as her son is studying and she also needs to bear her son's school fee. She wants to purchase an another flour-making machine and wheat in bulk for her business so that she can make more profit.

She has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase another flour-making machine and wheat in bulk for her business. She is thankful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to purchase another flour-making machine and wheat in bulk for her business

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado, a sus 20 años se casó y se dedicó solo al cultivo de maíz y maicillo. Él vive solo, su esposa falleció y sus hijos viven con sus propias familias.    
  

Miguel se ocupa de cultivar maíz, frijoles, maicillo, es lo que a hecho toda la vida y dice sentirse feliz porque le gusta. 


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar herbicidas y foliares para 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol que tiene sembradas; a pesar de sus años de trabajo, la misión es cosechar y obtener buenos frutos.  
  
El sueño más grande de Miguel, es que su cosecha sea buena, le pide a Dios que lo mantenga con salud por que no tiene quien le ayude, sus hijos ya no están con él
texts.en:
Migue is 64 years old. He studied until second grade and when he was 20 years old, he got married and began making his living growing corn and sorghum.

He lives alone since his wife died and his children live with their own families. Miguel occupies himself growing corn, beans, and sorghum, as he has done for his whole life and he says that he feels happy because he likes the work.

The loan that Miguel is requesting is to purchase herbicide and fertilizer for foliar feeding for 14,000 square meters of beans that are shaded. Because of his many years of work, his mission is to plan and harvest good crops. His biggest dream is that the harvest will be a good one. He asks God to keep him in good health because he no longer has anyone to help him as his children are no longer with him.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and foliar feeding fertilizer for his shaded bean crops

loans.name: Los Pinos De La Cascada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS DE CASCADA” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alejandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artículos de limpieza, taller de carpintería, librería, servicio de transcripciones, venta de productos medicinales naturales, venta de polleras, venta de ropa, costura de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alejandra es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de enaguas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al trabajar en taller de costura, pasados los años decide independizarse. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención  en salud que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The “LOS PINOS DE CASCADA” is starting their 31st cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office. It is composed of nine members and is lead by a board of directors with Alejandra as President. The businesses of the members are varied, amongst them are: the sales of cleaning products, a carpentry workshop, a bookstore, transcription services, selling natural medicines, selling polleras (traditional skirts), selling clothing and sewing petticoats.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs of which Alejandra is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer 10 years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At present she has a business making petticoats. She learned this business working in a sewing workshop. with the passing of the years she decided to work independently.

The loan that she is now getting is to augment her working capital (buying fabric wholesale) that she will acquire at the stores in the city of El Alto and later sell in her commercial space. Working in this way allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically as she is single and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the health services provided by personal at the institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Grace. She is 59 years old and blessed with five children.  

She practices maize, beans, and poultry farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013, and is grateful for the enterprise management training she went through. 

Grace is applying for a loan to purchase chicken feed for her chicken. She hopes this will help improve their productivity, hence meet the rising demand for eggs and chicken. This will improve her income, therefore she will be in a position to meet her family needs, such as food and education.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 40-year-old married woman.

She is a hardworking lady who, for the past five years, has been running a clothing business. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors, designs clothing for the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and earns a nice income through her business.

Rukhsana is requesting a loan in the amount of 55,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of fancy cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and to expand her inventory. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to expand her customer base and inventory by purchasing additional varieties, colors and designs of cloth

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 48-year-old, married woman and the mother of three children.

She has been running a clothing-sales business for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the city and then sells the clothes to people in her area. Her business has become popular in her town because of her great collection of clothes.

Sughran is requesting a loan in the amount of 55,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. The loan proceeds would allow her to purchase new varieties of ladies clothes in different sizes, colors, etc. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She aspires to save money for a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing a variety of ladies' clothes

loans.name: Mawenzi Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late 30's, is single with four kids who are still going to school.  She has been running a general store business for seven years now.  She works from  06 am to 09 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Mariam's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase the general store inventory.  She dreams of making her store big.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group, "MAWENZI", which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying the loan.

loans.use: to increase general store inventory.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Alice is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past two years, Alice has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers and braids, and will help Alice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings and herself. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to go back to school and complete her studies. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers and braids

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala south region of Uganda.

For the past two years, Olivia has been working hard to manage her retail shop. At her shop, she sells essential goods, such as sugar, salt and water.

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan in the amount of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase other items like sugar, rice and all types of flour. As a result of the loan, she expects to be able to generate an increase in profits and to pay for her family's medical bills. Olivia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Olivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., sugar, rice and flour)

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent deals in produce buying and selling, alongside farming since 2003 in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married, and age 50 years. 

Despite his hard work, he is challenged by the poor mode of transport, and desires to grow his business. For this reason, he is requesting credit to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans

loans.name: Visoi Dairy Commercialized Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Miriam, a member of Visoi Dairy Commercialized Self help group. She is 40 years old, and a single mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in June 2013.

She operates a kiosk, selling maize and beans, and also rears dairy goats to earn a living. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she is now able to manage her business well.

She is borrowing a loan to start a poultry business, and to help meet the high demand for eggs and chicken. She hopes her business will flourish, and therefore increase income. This will enable her support her children's education and the family's basic needs.

She is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To pay for poultry.

loans.name: Ebenezer Women Group

texts.en: The lady raising her hand in the photo is Emily, a member of Ebenezer Women Group. She is 43 years old and a mother of seven. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013. She does poultry and dairy farming. Emily is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the training she received on enterprise creation and management. She is borrowing a loan to start a cereals shop selling rice, millet, sorghum and wheat, which are in high demand in her locality. She hopes to earn more income to educate her children and to meet other family needs. Emily is happy with Kiva and its lenders for their support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase cereals such as rice, wheat, millet and sorghum to start a cereals shop

loans.name: Los Robles 1 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ROBLES 1” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ines es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de zapatería, venta de salchipapas, venta de comida, venta de artículos varios, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ines es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer, mismo que le ayudo a mejorar su negocio actual. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, papa y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención  en salud que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Robles 1" will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Ines is the president. The businesses that the members of the bank run are varied. Among them are: a shoemaking workshop, selling salchipapas [a typical street food made from sausages and potatoes], selling food, selling various articles, and selling cosmetics.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Ines is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, entering at the invitation of her friend who is a client of the institution. At this time she has a business of selling food. She lets it be known that she launched this business with the first loan that she obtained from Pro Mujer, the same [organization] that helped her to improve her present business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying rice, potatoes, and pasta wholesale. She will acquire these supplies in the stores of the city of El Alto, and then she will sell her products in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she has a partner and four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health care that the institution's staff offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, and pasta wholesale

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar es viudo, tiene una hija y vive con ella en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus suegros La vivienda se ha deteriorado por las lluvias, especialmente un ambiente que es usado como cocina y taller Cesar es costurero y quiere un credito para comprar materia prima como tela e hilo Cesar es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Cesar is a widower. He has a daughter and lives with her in La Paz in a house built of brick and cement which belongs to his in-laws. The house has deteriorated from the rains, especially the room that is used as the kitchen and workroom.

Cesar is a tailor and wants a loan to buy raw material like fabric and thread. Cesar is the only source of income for his household and is in good health. He needs your help.

loans.use: to buy raw material like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en Arajllanga en una casa que le pertenece a sus padres  y tiene todos los servicios basicos Gregorio es agricultor y quiere un credito para comprar ganado vacuno para poder vender mayor cantidad de leche Gregorio es el unico sustento en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Gregorio is married. He has two children and lives in Arajilanga in a house that belongs to his parents and has all the basic services. Gregorio is a farmer and wants a loan to buy cattle in order to be able to sell a greater quantity of milk. Gregorio is the only breadwinner in his household, and so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador es casado y tiene un hijo, Salvador vive en Arajllanga en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus padres, el cliente se gana la vida elaborando queso y quiere un credito para compra de ganado vacuno para producir mayor cantidad de leche Salvador es el unico que trae dinero al hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Salvador is married and has a son. Salvador lives in Arajllanga in a house made of adobe which belongs to his parents. He makes his living making cheese. He wants a loan to buy to buy cattle to produce a greater quantity of milk. Salvador is the only bread earner in the household so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Witethie Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is named Mary; a member of Witethie Self Help Group. She is 28 years old, married, and blessed with two children.

Mary raises maize and potatoes,\; she also does dairy farming. She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training modules on savings, enterprise, and financial management. Due to the rising demand for her produce in the market, she is applying for a loan to purchase farm inputs such as pesticide and animal feed. 

She hopes this will increase her income, hence enable her meet her goal of educating the children.
