Mary is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and pesticides.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is named Martha. She is 32 years old and blessed with two children.

Martha earns her living by raising potatoes, maize, and beans. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training she received which equipped her with skills to manage her business. The high demand in the market for her produce has made Martha apply for a loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and pesticide. This will boost her business by improving on her crop yield, hence an increase in her supply. 

She anticipates using the improved income in meeting her objective of educating the children.

Martha is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pestcide.

loans.name: Amazing Grace Group

texts.en:
Esther is a native of Sabina in Assin North in the central region of Ghana. She is 60 years old, and married with 6 children ages 32, 29, 26, 23, 20 and 17 years. 

Esther has been growing cocoa for the past 26 years.  She also sells cooking utensils to individuals within her community. Esther's main challenge now is to secure a loan to purchase a clean cooking stove.  Esther and her group have decided to use clean cooking stoves after community education about saving the forest and ways to reduce indoor/outdoor air pollution. A micro loan will help Esther to purchase an Elsa Clean Cook stove to protect her family from indoor air pollution and the stress from carrying firewood after a hard days work. 

Esther says thank you to all her micro lenders for their kind support

loans.use: To purchase a Clean Cook stove

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is from Araqsavan village in the Ararat region. She lives with her big family--her parents-in-law, brother-in-law, husband and three children. To help her family members earn a living, Sona is extensively engaged in agribusiness; she is involved in aviculture and the cultivation of tomatoes and different flowers in greenhouses. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market. The latter is an important source of income for them. 

To be able to cover the increasing expenses of her family, Sona wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse and for fertilizer, and to cover cultivation costs. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. The loan will help Sona and her family to sustain their agribusiness and develop it further. She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are grateful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her greenhouse and for fertilizer, and to cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Edis Nelson

texts.es: Edis de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, con las ventas que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejor su vivienda pero no tiene suficiente capital para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, duralitas, polines, arena y pago de mano de obra para poder cambiar el techo y repellar las paredes del lugar que muestra la fotografía, ya que el techo esta dañado por las lluvias y asi pueda vivir mas seguro con su familia.
texts.en: Edis is 43 years old. He lives in his own house with his life companion and their daughter. He raises and sells pigs. With his sales, he manages to pay for the household expenses. He wants to improve his house, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to be able to do it. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to buy cement, duralite [a fiber cement roofing material], poles, and sand and pay for labor to replace the roof and plaster the walls of the area shown in the photograph, since the roof was damaged by the rains. Thus he can live more securely with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, duralite, poles, and sand and pay for labor

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin, age 27, is married with a 4-year-old child who goes to school. He has been farming for nine years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to buy land for farming.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Magole 'b' Group

texts.en:
Lucas, in his 40s, is married and has three sons and a daughter who are in school. For eight years now, he has been a businessman selling fruits and vegetables. He sells from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. He really desires to make his food stall (genge) more classic.

This is his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Magole 'b' Group, which has two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With his previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Lucas bought stocks for his food stall: rice, vegetables, fruits, maize and baking flour. He earned extra income, which he used to cover school fees and food for the household. He will use this loan to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor Angelica

texts.es:
Flor Angélica tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposo e hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio; y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Flor Angélica se dedica a la actividad de venta de jugos y refrescos, desde hace más de 3 años de antigüedad, su negocio está ubicado en el exterior del mercado Parada Nueva de Cayaltí. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de una máquina de moler hielo, además de compra de soya y cebada por sacos, para preparar sus jugos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, y obtener más ingresos, mejores ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor Angélica is 35 years old and is in a relationship. She lives with her husband and children in their own house in a large community in the urban zone of Cayaltí. She has good work and personal references from her neighbors. The people in her community work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru.

Flor Angélica has been working in her business of selling juices and soft drinks for the past three years. Her business is located outside the Parada Nueva market in Cayaltí. She is requesting the loan to buy a machine to crush ice and to buy soya and barley by the sack to prepare her juices. By doing this she will expand her business, and receive greater revenue and profits and will be able to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a machine to crush ice and to buy soya and barley by the sack.

loans.name: Nkabom Group

texts.en:
Georgina is a group representative of Nkabom Group of Sabina in the Assin North district of the Central Region of Ghana. She is 54 years old and married with 5 children, ages 27, 23, 18, 13,and 9. Four of Georgina's children are currently attending school while one is on her own. Georgina is a cocoa farmer and also grows cassava, yams, and plantains for home consumption. Georgina produces palm oil, which she sells to individuals on market days. 

Georgina's main priority now is to secure a loan to purchase a clean cook stove. Georgina will use the by-product (virgin pellet) from her oil processing as fuel and will not incur any fuel costs when she starts to use the ELSA clean cook stove. She will be able to save some money for her household using the stove.  A microloan will help Georgina and her group members to purchase the improved stove to protect their families from indoor air pollution. Georgina and her group members are thankful to their microlenders for their generous support in saving their families from health hazards.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Willian Geovany

texts.es:
Willian de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato. Actualmente se encuentra acompañado y ha procreado dos hijos, una está estudiando preparatoria.  Su esposa se dedica al comercio de verduras. 

Willian se dedica a la albañilería, tiene 13 años de dedicarse a este oficio, lo aprendió por medio de un tío que le enseñó a trabajar la albañilería, viaja a pie a su trabajo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cucharas, carretilla, madera, pala, alicate, martillos, sierra, cinta, plomo, nivel, etc. para poder ejercer bien su oficio y así dar un mejor servicio. Él planea que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Willian is 33 years old. He completed secondary school. He is now married and has two children. One is in preparatory school. His wife's work is selling vegetables.

Willian works as a mason. He has been working in this trade for 13 years. He learned it through an uncle who taught him to work in masonry. He travels to his work on foot.

The loan that he is applying for from CrediCampo is to buy scoops, a wheelbarrow, wood, a shovel, pliers, hammers, a saw, a tape measure, a plumb bob, a level, etc., so that he can practice his trade well and thus give better service. 

He plans for his family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy scoops, a wheelbarrow, wood, a shovel, pliers, hammers, a saw, a tape measure, a plumb bob, a level, etc. in order to practice his trade well

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Xai-Xai Província de Gaza tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 4 filhos menores de idade todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha numa quinta como jardineira a mais de 4 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, pedra e outro que for necessário. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra, iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos.
texts.en: Albertina was born in Xai-Xai, in Gaza Province. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of four young children, all of whom attend school. She doesn't provide for anyone else besides her children. She has worked at a hotel as a gardener for more than four years. This job earns her a certain amount, which goes toward her household expenses. With the requested loan, she plans to continue with her home construction project by buying construction materials such as sand, cement, gravel, and other items as needed. This is her fourth loan through Hluvuku. In the future, she intends to finish her construction project, start a business selling daily needs items, and guarantee an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, gravel, and other materials as needed.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 37 years old. She is married with three children between 4 and 12 years old and all of them go to school. She has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 46 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, es natural de la zona; vive en casa propia, junto a su familia. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio. Dicha distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Carlos es al engorde y venta de ganado caprino, pavos y aves de corral; esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 7 años, contando con experiencia en el rubro; además por las tardes realiza actividades de corte de leña para panaderías y hornillas, ingresos adicionales que le permiten invertir en capital de trabajo.

Carlos cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona donde vive, siendo muy conocido por las labores de crianza de ganado. El destino del crédito será para la compra de animales (chivos, patos, pavos, entre otros) para engordarlos y después de unas semanas, llevarlos al mercado para venderlos a un buen precio; lo que en un corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 46 years old. His civil status is living with a partner. He lives in the district of Buenos Aires. He is a native of this zone. He lives in his own house along with his family. Life in the community is peaceful, and the people work principally in agriculture and livestock-raising, in addition to commerce. This district is located in the province of Morropón in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

The activity in which Carlos works is fattening and selling goats, turkeys, and barnyard fowl. He has been doing this work for more than 7 years and thus has experience in this field. In addition, he cuts firewood for bakeries and ovens in the afternoons to obtain additional income that allows him to invest in working capital.

Carlos has very good personal and work references in the zone where he lives, being well known for his work raising livestock. The purpose of the loan will be to buy animals (goats, turkeys, and ducks, among others) to fatten and after some weeks to take to the market to sell at a good price, which in the short term will generate more income for him and more earnings, and in the end will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals (goats, ducks, turkeys, etc.) to fatten and later sell at a good price.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés vive en la casa de sus Padres en la ciudad de El Alto.
Andrés se dedica a la confeccion de ropas de bebe y chalecos en su propio domicilio, y  necesita el crédito para compra de una maquina recta Andres no tiene a quien acudir por eso ha solicitado un credito en Kiva, el cliente tambien ha empezado a efectuar pintados de murales para ganar dinero
texts.en:
Andrés lives in his parents' house in the city of El Alto.

He sews baby clothes and vests in his own home, and he needs the loan to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine. Andrés has no one to turn to, so he has applied for a Kiva loan. He has also begun to paint murals to earn money.

loans.use: to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Meet Caroline, a resilient entrepreneur who is actively involved in many income-generating activities, the main one being agriculture. Caroline has a son with her 35-year-old hubby. They live together on a small plot of land in Riabai village. She started with next to nothing and nine years later, she is keeping poultry and growing bananas for commercial purposes. She also owns a small business that brings in some extra profit.
 
Caroline is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Banana farming is bringing her good income but the only problem is that it is a seasonal product. She is seeking to expand her poultry farming because the product is doing great in the market and the income is regular. Poultry farming sustains her family as she awaits for other produce to be ready for the market. 

With your funding, Caroline is going to use the income from your investment to repay the loan and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Roxana Moncerrate

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De  Crédito Nueva Integración. Este lugar muy rico en vegetación en la cual muchos habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y venta de sus productos.
En este lugar vive la señora Roxana, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su marido es operador eléctrico. Ella hace tiempo atrás aprendió belleza en un centro artesanal de la ciudad.
Doña Roxana es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo propio para así salir adelante junto a su marido, ella realiza trabajos de belleza como tinturados, arreglos y pintado de uñas, entre otras cosas,  sus clientes la visitan cuando requieren de sus servicios,  también se dedica a la venta de sabanas, edredones lo cual lo realiza puerta a puerta,  ella también realiza trabajos a domicilio y allí mismo aprovecha para vender su mercadería, trabaja casi todos los días ya sea vendiendo o realizando sus trabajos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar esmaltes de uñas y sabanas ya que tiene varios pedidos para entregar. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The members of Nueva Integración Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Los Rosales neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. This is a richly vegetated area where many residents earn a living in agriculture and selling their products.

This is where Roxana lives.  She's 21 years old and married, and she has a three-year-old child from that relationship.  Her husband is an electrician.  Years ago she learned cosmetology in a training center in the city.

Roxana's a person who likes to earn her own money, so she and her husband can make progress.  She does cosmetology jobs such as dyes, hairstyles, and nails, among other jobs.  Her customers visit her when they need her services.  She also earns a living selling sheets and quilts, which she does door-to-door.  She also does jobs in homes and makes the most of that to sell her merchandise.  She works almost every day, whether selling or working.  She has done this work for three years, earning something for her family's well-being.

This loan is to buy nail polish and sheets because she has several orders to fulfill.  She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because the loans help her.  Her dream is to have a beauty shop.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and sheets

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary deals in produce buying and selling, mainly beans. She is a hardworking Ugandan single woman aged 46 years. Rosemary desires to grow her business, but she is challenged by competition in the market. 

She is getting credit to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
J. Damascene is aged 35 years. He is married with three children aged between 4 and 11, and all of them go to school. 

He has been farming for 15 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to build a house as a store.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Umoja Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Zipporah, a member of Umoja Women Group. She is 40 years old, married and living with her five children. She earns her living by practicing vegetable farming.

Zipporah joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 and has benefited from training on saving, enterprise and financial management. 

She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and planting seeds. She hopes this will improve the crop yield and thus, more supply to the market. The anticipated increased income will enable her to meet the cost of educating her children.

Zipporah is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase Elsa Clean cookstoves for resale to the rural communities

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is a married woman aged 39 years living in a rural area with her family of five children; all of them are attending school from different areas. She is a businesswoman who sells new clothing for both men and women. She has an additional income from agriculture. She started this business 15 years back. 

She works six days and 12 hours per day so that she can maximize the profits. She is optimistic the loan will help her restock her boutique with new fashionable clothes that will attract customers. Her sales will increase and so will the income. She has hopes of expanding into a large business which can supply large quantities. She is trustworthy and hardworking and is grateful for the services.

loans.use: To buy women's and men's clothing to sell

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en:
Ernestine, 32 years old,  is married with one child who is eight years old and goes to school. She has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik lives in the village of Harij with her husband and daughter. Her husband is a builder and their only son is a migrant worker.

Arevik herself raises chickens, pigs, sheep and cows. The milk Arevik collects is used in cheese production, which she sells at local markets. By applying for this loan, Arevik is asking for financial support to be able to increase her cultivation. She plans to purchase potato seeds and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Arevik to increase her agricultural income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Confidence Group

texts.en: Sarah is a member of Confidence Group, local distributors of Elsa Clean cook stoves to the rural communities in the Twifo lower Denkyira District in the Central Region of Ghana. Sarah is the group leader. She is 48 years old and married with four children. Her children are 28, 25, 20 and 12 years old and are all in school. She earns additional income from the sale of bread to individuals. The stoves use virgin pellets (Palm Kennel Shells), which are easily available as waste materials within the communities where she operates. There is a high demand for her clean cook stoves, since the clean cook stove improves indoor air quality and the health of the users. Besides, the stove users save on their household expenditures for fuel and no longer walk miles in search of firewood. The benefits of the stove spread by word of mouth in advertising her clean cook stove. Sarah and her group members need this loan to buy more stoves to meet the increasing demand from their customers. Funding her loan will also reduce deforestation within the communities as the stove users will no longer cut the wood from the forest for firewood or to use as charcoal for fuel. Sarah and her group members thank all their micro lenders for their generosity and help in saving the forest within their business communities.

loans.use: To purchase Elsa Clean cook stoves for resale to rural communities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Gadafi

texts.en: Gadafi is a single happy farmer who is also enterprising. The previous loan helped to increase his sales and profits. He is so thankful. Gadafi is applying for a loan to buy general merchandise of cooking oil, soap and salt wholesale because it will be cheap and then he will be able to sell to the people at the border and increase his sales and make profits. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his retail shop.

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina is an experienced farmer from the village of Dimitron in the Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband, parents-in-law and seven-year-old son. Tehmina and her family earn a living through farming, which is the only source of income for them. They breed a livestock of cows, pigs and hens and own a greenhouse where they cultivate peppers and other vegetables. Tehmina's husband and father-in-law help her get the agricultural products to the local market. She now wants to start cultivating more fruits and vegetables but the greenhouse that she owns is very damaged. The family’s agribusiness needs some investments to function in a sustainable way. A loan of $3,000 USD will be very helpful by enabling them to purchase a cow and partially renovate the greenhouse. Tehmina and her family depend on the good will of the lenders and are very thankful to them for helping to sustain their agribusiness.

As this is Tehmina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and partially renovate her greenhouse

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine, 35, is a struggling lady farmer from Mukere village who is working extra hard to provide the best she can for her son and daughter. She runs a small mixed-farm that has poultry, tea, bananas and flowers. She has been doing farming for over a decade. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, bananas and profits from small time personal business.

Josphine is seeking a loan to purchase goats and poultry. She would really love to get into goat farming, which is doing quite well in the market as most meat consumers are going for goat ribs. The additional poultry she plans to buy with your loan investment will expand the existing operations and increase the quantity of eggs for sale.

Returns from this investment will go toward loan repayment and her children's education. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Josphine replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: to purchase goats and poultry

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush is a farmer from Haytagh village in the Armavir region. She lives with her 22-year-old son. Anush's husband works as a migrant worker in a neighboring country. However his salary is so low that he cannot meet the family's basic needs. Anush, with the help of her son, is engaged in cultivation of  haricot and greens. Farming is the most important source of the family's income. As their needs are increasing day by day, Anush needs to enlarge her agribusiness a little bit. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a big support to her and her family and will help them purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and fertilizer and hire workers for gathering the harvest. Anush and her family will be thankful to the lenders for supporting them to maintain and improve their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and fertilizer and to hire workers for gathering the harvest

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a farmer from the village of Pokr Vedi in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and 28-year-old son. Svetlana and her family has been engaged in the farming business for 15 years already. Farming is the only source of the family’s income. They keep hens and cultivate different vegetables and fruits (corn, tomato, and peach trees). 

Svetlana's husband and son help her sell the agricultural products in the local market. She currently needs a loan of $2,600 to purchase corn seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock. Svetlana and her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will and support, helping them collect the needed amount of loan for developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for corn seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a male Ugandan who is 42 years old and married. He is a businessman and he operates a retail shop in Kiryanjagi town in the Kibaale District but also, like most of the residents of the area, he also does agriculture.

He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to restock his business with items like sodas, sugar, fuel and salt.

His plans for the future include buying land and constructing a family house. However, he is challenged by the lack of enough capital.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sodas, sugar, fuel and salt.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from the village of Qarashen in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works in construction in a neighbouring country.

Susanna and her children are engaged in farming. They breed cows and calves. Livestock breeding is an important source of income for the family. To be able to meet the growing needs of her family, Susanna now wants to enlarge the livestock. To reach that goal she needs a loan of USD 2200 to buy two cows and to be able to gather more milk for cheese production. It will help her greatly to sustain and develop her agribusiness. Susanna and her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will in helping them to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two cows for gathering milk to enlarge cheese production.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Benkelema est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Sanga de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et ont au moins 6enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que,Fruits et Légumes, Habillement et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe.
Fatoumata est un membre du groupe Benkelema,assise2ème de gauche  et à droite, Fruits et légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Fruits et légumes (Bananes youyou)en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkelema comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Fatoumata compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkelema is a group of women from the Sanga district of the city of Koutiala. They know each other well and live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 39 years old and have at least six children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items such as: fruits and vegetables, clothing and miscellaneous products. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third goup loan.

Fatoumata, sitting in the second position from left to right, is a member of the Benkelema group who retails fruits and vegetables. She intends to use her loan to buy fruits and vegetables (youyou bananas) in quantity and quality and retail them as needed to a diverse clientele. She resupplies in Koutiala.

Whereas other members of the Benkelema group expect average profits of 150,000 CFA fancs each during this loan cycle, Fatoumata expects to achieve 160,000 CFA francs. 

In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their business. They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to maintain adequate stock supplies.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et ont au moins 3enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Pièces de pagnes,Fruits et Légumes, Arachides et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe.
Kadia est un membre du groupe Djiguiya,arrêtée au bout et à droite, vendeuse d’Arachides, Fruits et légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de l’Arachide, Fruits et légumes en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 205000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia compte réaliser  220 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala. They know each other well and live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 32 years old and have at least three children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items such as: lengths of pagne fabric (colorful West-African fabric), fruits and vegetables, groundnuts and miscellaneous products. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their seventh goup loan.

Kadia, standing on the far right, is a member of the Djiguiya group who retails groundnuts, fruits and vegetables. She intends to use her loan to buy groundnuts, fruits and vegetables in quantity and quality and retail them as needed to a diverse clientele. She resupplies in Koutiala.

Whereas other members of the Djiguiya group expect average profits of 205,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Fatoumata expects to achieve 220,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their business. They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to maintain adequate stock supplies.

loans.use: buy groundnuts, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana de 46 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación. Actualmente vive con sus dos hijas de edades 13 y 20 años. La menor de las dos estudia y la mayor le ayuda en los oficios del hogar.
Ana tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, ya que con la ayuda de su hija venden sus $ 6 diarios y con los ingresos de la venta alcanzan a cubrir algunos gastos personales y de servicios básicos en el hogar. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar aceite, arroz, azúcar, golosinas y bebidas, para ofrecer estos productos a los clientes que llegan a comprar tortillas y pupusas. 

Su sueño es tener una cafetin grande donde pueda tener mejores productos y muy diversificados, para tener mejores ingresos en su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old, very hard-working and wants to do better in life. She currently lives with her two daughters,20 and 13 years old. Ana's youngest daughter is in school while the eldest helps with the household chores.

Ana has been working selling tortillas and "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) for four years. With the help of her daughter she sells $6 worth every day and, with the income from sales, she is able to cover some personal and household expenses.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy oil, rice, sugar, sweets and drinks to sell to customers who come to buy tortillas and "pupusas".

Ana's dream is to have a big coffee shop where she can offer better and more varied products in order to have a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, sweets and drinks to sell to customers who come to buy tortillas and "pupusas".

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia  vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las  verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina continues to sell vegetables such as onions, tomatoes and squash.  She works in different places and has been successful in the business for several years.  Her dream is to have her own vegetable shop.  The loan she is requesting is to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

Paulina is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 51 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo dependiente económicamente; vive con su hijo y su conyugue en el distrito de Pucará, distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse; en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general. El distrito de Pucará está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Delia se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado porcino y también a la cría de animales menores como son gallinas, patos, entre otros; lo que Delia realiza es la venta de las crías de su ganado, dichas ventas son realizadas en su domicilio y en el puerto de Chiple; dicha actividad la viene realizando hace más de 06 años, Delia cuenta con un corral amplio para dicha actividad y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos.

El destino del crédito es para invertir en su negocio, realizando la compra de animales para criarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos, aumentando y diversificando de esta forma su stock de animales, lo que le permitirá atender a todos los gustos de su público consumidor; generándole de esta manera una mejora en sus ingresos, aumento en sus ganancias y por consecuente en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delia, 51, lives with her common-law husband and a dependent son in the district of Pucará, which is a medium-sized district with a desire to grow.  The local people here are involved in agriculture, mainly growing rice, and also in general commerce.  Pucará is located in Jaén in the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

Delia raises and sells pigs and small animals such as chickens, ducks, etc.  She sells the offspring of her livestock out of her home and in the port of Chiple.  She has been in business for six years and has a large barnyard for her activity.  She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. 

She will use the loan to invest in her business and buy animals to raise and sell.  She wants to diversify her stock of animals in order to meet consumer demand.  This will improve her income and increase her profit which will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy animals to increase and diversify her livestock activity.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia  trabaja en una universidad de El Alto como personal administrativo y quiere un credito para efectuar la refaccion de dos habitaciones que necesita tener en optimo estado para ponerlas en alquiler en su domicilio Virginia vive en El Alto y tiene un hijo, no tiene a quien acudir por eso quiere su ayua
texts.en: Virginia works on the administrative staff of a university in El Alto.  She is requesting a loan to renovate two rooms she has at home so she can rent them.  She lives in El Alto and has a son.  Virginia has no one to turn to, so she is requesting your help.

loans.use: To make renovate two rooms.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia Manuela se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas y también vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y uvas y compara verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Manuela continues selling fruits and vegetables in different places.  She sells bananas, oranges and apples, and also onions, tomatoes and squash.  The borrower has been in business for several years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a fruit and vegetable shop.  The loan she is requesting is to buy oranges, bananas and grapes, as well as vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

Manuela is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy oranges, bananas and grapes, and vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ygnacia

texts.es:
Ygnacia tiene 50 años, es conviviente, conocida en el medio por su labor de crianza y venta de animales menores, tales como pavos, gallinas, conejos, entre otros. Ygnacia vive en casa propia, con su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos de 22, 14 y 06 años; su hijo de 22 trabaja como jornalero agrícola por zona y los otros 02 hijos estudian en colegio de la zona; cónyuge trabaja como agricultor, en su terreno agrícola. Ygnacia cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Ella vive en una comunidad en la cual viven personas respetuosas y trabajadoras, dedicadas básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería; y está ubicada en el distrito Pacanga, en la provincia de Chepe, región de La Libertas, costa norte de Perú.

Ygnacia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como carneros, cerdos, vacas, cuyes, pollos, entre otros, desde hace más de 09 años aproximadamente. Además trabaja vendiendo tallarines y papa aderezada en colegio primario de zona de residencia. Ella necesita del préstamo para compra de abono y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo (el cual es trabajado por su cónyuge), ya que al tener en óptimas condiciones este cultivo le reportara una cosecha aceptable generando mayores y mejores ingresos, aumentando sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ygnacia, 50, is known for her work raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, chickens, rabbits and others.  She lives in her own home with her common-law husband and their three children, ages 22, 14 and 6.  Her 22-year-old son works as a farm day laborer in the area and the other two children attend the local school.  Her husband works as a crop farmer.  Ygnacia has good personal and work references from her neighbors.  She lives in a community of respectful, hard-working people who work basically in agriculture and livestock farming.  The community is in the district of Pacanga in the province of Chepe in the Libertas Region on the northern coast of Peru.

Ygnacia raises and sells animas such as sheep, pigs, cows, guinea pigs, chickens and others.  She has been in business for approximately nine years.  She also works selling noodles and potato salad at a primary school in the area where she lives.  She is in need of a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for her cropland (where her husband works) in order to produce an acceptable harvest to generate more income and improve her profits, thus improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for her cropland.

loans.name: Kadir

texts.es: Kadir se gana la vida realizando estructuras metalicas para construcciones y su esposa es empleada en un restaurant Kadir necesita un credito para  comprar nuevas herramientas pues las que tiene ya no rinden como antes Kadir vive en El Alto, goza de buena salud y no tiene hijos por lo que se recomienda ayudarle
texts.en: Kadir earns a living in construction building metal structures.  His wife works at a restaurant.  Kadir needs a loan to buy new tools to replace the ones that no longer work.  He lives in El Alto and is in good health, but has no children so he needs your support.

loans.use: To buy new tools.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Veronica vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo Veronica vive en la comunidad de Umapusa en una casa de adobe que es propia  y solo tiene luz aunque la vivienda no presenta defectos Veronica es agricultora y quiere un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar su produccionde leche La pareja de Veronica trabaja como taxista en la comunidad pero el dinero no les alcanza por eso Veronica quiere la ayuda de Kiva. La cliente goza de buena salud y su evaluacion de credito es buena
texts.en:
Veronica lives in a common-law relationship and has a son. She lives in the community of Umapusa in an adobe house that she owns. The house only has electricity, but is in a good condition.

Veronica is a farmer and wants a loan to buy a dairy cow. This would enable her to increase her milk production. Veronica's partner works as a taxi driver in the community, but the money is not enough, and this is why Veronica is asking for help from Kiva.

The client enjoys good health and her credit history is good.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to be able to increase her production.

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesús

texts.es:
Mauricio de 29 años de edad,  es un joven panadero que actualmente reside junto a su familia en la ciudad, tiene un hijo.
Él ya lleva más de cuatro años trabajando con la misma panadería  y su jefe elogia su trabajo ya que no importa en qué condiciones este el clima o la hora que sea, él siempre va a salir con su motocicleta a ofrecer el pan.
Mauricio planea expandir su negocio y probar suerte en la venta de ropa y tener esto de la mano con su empleo de panadero y es que en este negocio del pan él ha logrado identificar a los buenos clientes que pagan puntuales y de esta forma se ha decidido por invertir en ropa para vender con la gente que él ya conoce y así mejorar su economía familiar y por eso solicita este crédito, para comprar faldas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos, shorts, etc. Para vender.

Él planea comprar su propia casa donde vivir junto a su familia y ver crecer y superarse a su hijo que actualmente no va a la escuela, porque todavía está muy pequeño y busca expandir sus ingresos mediante la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 29 years old. He is a young baker who currently lives with his family in the city. He has a son. He has worked for more than four years in the same bakery and his boss commends him for his work, because no matter what the weather is like or at which time, he always goes out by motorbike to sell the bread. 

Through selling bread he has identified good clients who pay on time, and therefore he has decided to invest in the purchase of clothing to sell it to the people he already knows, and by this to improve his household income. This is the reason why he is asking for a loan, to buy shirts, trousers, blouses, dresses, shorts, etc. for selling.

He is planning to buy his own house and wants to live there with his family and see his son grow up and get ahead. His son does not yet go to school because he is very small, and Mauricio wants to improve his income by selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, dresses, and shorts for selling.

loans.name: Ladiri Group

texts.fr:
Ladiri est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et ont au moins 3enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Pièces de pagnes,Fruits et Légumes, Friperie, Condiments et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Niagale est un membre du groupe Ladiri,assise2ème de gauche à droite, vendeuse de Pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des Pièces de pagnes en quantité et de plusieurs qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Ladiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Niagale compte réaliser  175 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Ladiri is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala. They know each other well and live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 29 years old and have at least three children.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items such as: lengths of pagne fabric (colorful West-African fabric), fruits and vegetables, used clothing, condiments and miscellaneous products. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their second goup loan.

Niagale, sitting in second position from left to right, is a member of the Ladiri group who sells lengths of pagne fabric (colorful West-African fabric). She intends to use her loan to buy lengths of pagne fabric in quantity and varying qualities and retail them as needed to a diverse clientele. She resupplies at the merket.

Whereas other members of the Ladiri group expect average profits of 160,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Mrs. Niagale expects to achieve 175,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their business. They want to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to maintain adequate stock supplies.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Blanca Odilia

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, los dos mayores trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender y por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Blanca is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her three children. The two older ones work and help her economically. Blanca has worked selling tortillas for 4 years. She has many customers because she is very friendly when she sells her tortillas, and she offers good prices.

She is a asking for a loan to buy quintals of corn, and lime, in order to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn, and lime.

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijas y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, responsable, trabajadora, constante, sacrificada y optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Gloria es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español para el comercio. Su trabajo es la cocina de comida rápida y platos típicos, como; pollo frito, chicharron de pollo y de cerdo, fricasé, etc.
Recientemente se terminó la construcción de un polideportivo frente a su puesto de venta, eso ocasionó que tenga más clientela de lo normal, ella necesita realizar la ampliación de su puesto de venta y también necesita realizar la compra de arroz y fideo por mayor. Su vida la comparte sólo con su esposo, porque sus hijas ya son grandes y se independizaron. 
Es por esos motivos que Gloria solicita un préstamo para al ampliación de su puesto de venta y la compra de arroz y fideo por mayor, para abastecer a sus nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman of 54, married, mother to two children, and her business is food sales. 

She is entrepreneurial, responsible, hardworking, dedicated, and optimistic. She does business in the "16 de julio" area, notable for being a place for commerce of all types.

Gloria has brown skin and is of medium stature, with long dark braided hair. She dresses traditionally (shawl, skirt, and hat), her mother tongue is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish for business. Her work is making quick food and traditional dishes such as fried chicken, chicken "chicharrón" and pork "chicharrón," stew, etc.

Recently the construction of a sports center in front of her food stall was completed, causing her to have more customers than usual. She needs to enlarge her food stall and also needs to buy rice and noodles wholesale. She shares her life only with her spouse, because her daughters are big now and they live by themselves.

These are the reasons that Gloria is requesting a loan to to enlarge her food stall and to buy rice and noodles wholesale, to provide for her new clients.

loans.use: to enlarge her food stall and to buy rice and noodles wholesale, to provide for her new clients

loans.name: Lefdy

texts.en:
Lefdy is a 41 year old woman who is married to Gabriel, a 45 year old man. They are blessed with a son Greyneldi, 17, a student at a Senior High School, grade 3, and a daughter, Luisa, age 3, who does not attend school yet. Lefdy’s husband, Gabriel, is working at Forestry Services. 

To strengthen their family income, Lefdy also has a business of selling cakes and catering. She has been running this business since 2000. She produces various kinds of cakes to be sold to the offices near her house on a daily basis. Also, Lefdy often receives orders for cakes and food catering. 

At the moment, Lefdy received a food catering order for an event. However, the payments are usually made after the catering is delivered to the party who ordered. Lefdy does not have enough money to purchase foodstuffs for the catering. Therefore, she applied for an individual loan in the amount of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be used to purchase the catering foodstuffs and the rest of the money will be used to buy material to make cakes.

loans.use: to purchase the catering foodstuffs and  materials to make cakes

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita resides in Panta-on, Ozamiz City with her family. She has a retail store while her husband runs a motor transportation service to make a living.

She wants to earn a better income from this activity, for she is determined to send her children to school. Her previous loan from GDMPC, used for buying goods, was successfully repaid.  

Her plans to improve her business will be a big help in realizing her ambition of having her children be successful in their future. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
Gilmer tiene 42 años, es conviviente, y muy conocido en el medio, por prestar servicio como maestro constructor. Vive en casa propia, con cónyuge y 03 hijos de los cuales 02 estudian secundaria y uno se prepara para estudiar en el instituto Senati; su cónyuge se dedica a labores de casa. Gilmer cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Es de familia muy unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada habitada por personas amables y respetuosas, dedicadas al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Gilmer se dedica a prestar el servicio como maestro constructor realizando obras de construcción por zona de residencia y alrededores desde hace más de 20 años aproximadamente. Gilmer necesita del préstamo para uso personal, pues desea invertir en techar su cocina y parte de su sala, para darle una mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia ya que se vienen tiempo de lluvias y de esa manera darle mejor calidad de vida a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Gilmer is 42 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage, and is very renowned in the area for his services as a master builder. He lives in his own house with his partner and their three children, two of whom go to secondary school and one is preparing to enroll in a course at Senati (an vocational school). His partner does the household work.

Gilmer has very good personal and work references from his neighbors. The family is very close. They live in a community where the people are friendly and respectful and work in trade, agriculture and cattle-raising. This community is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Gilmar has worked as a master builder doing construction work in the residential area and nearby for approximately 20 years. He needs a loan for personal use, because he wants to build a roof for his kitchen and for a part of his living room. This would increase the safety and comfort of his family. The rainy season is approaching and he wants to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to build a roof for his kitchen and for part of the living room.

loans.name: Violeta Rosa

texts.es:
Violeta Rosa tiene 36 años de edad, es separada y vive con menor hijo, en casa propia. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería; desde aproximadamente más de 10 años. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Violeta Rosa se dedica a la venta de comidas al paso principalmente y a la crianza y venta de animales menores, tales como patos, conejos, pollos, gallinas, pavos, entre otros. Desde hace más de 05 años. Violeta Rosa necesita del préstamo para la compra de carpas y utensilios para la venta de comidas para poder atender en mejores condiciones a su público consumidor, lo que le permitirá captar a un número mayor de clientes, generando así un incremento en sus ventas, un mejora en sus ganancias y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Violeta Rosa is 36 years old, separated, and lives with a young son in her own house. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. She lives in a community that works in trade, agriculture, and livestock; she has lived her for over ten years. This community is located in the Saña district, in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Violeta Rosa works mainly as a street food vendor and also raising and selling small livestock such as ducks, rabbits, chickens, turkeys, and others. She has done this for more than five years. Violeta Rosa needs the loan to buy awnings and cooking utensils for her food stall, so that she can better attend to her customers. This will allow her to get more customers and so to create an increase in sales, an improvement in her profits, and finally, an improvement in her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy awnings and cooking utensils for her food sales so that she can better serve her customers

loans.name: Carlos Amilcar

texts.es:
Carlos de 32 años de edad, es un joven padre de familia que lucha día a día por salir adelante, es un emprendedor que ha logrado montar una panadería que atiende junto a sus familiares. Su esposa trabaja por lo que la mayoría del tiempo él pasa en su casa donde también funciona su panadería, son padres  de dos hijos.

Carlos ya tiene más de cuatro años de experiencia de estar realizando esta labor de panificador y hasta el día de hoy le ha ido muy bien, ya que con esfuerzo ha logrado comprar la maquinaria necesaria para la elaboración del pan.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar harina, huevos, levadura, azúcar, etc. Para continuar elaborando el delicioso pan. 

Él dice que busca llegar a tener una panadería muy fuerte, lo suficiente para poder mantener a sus hijos en compañía de su esposa y así dar un buen porvenir a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old. He is a young father who strives every day to get ahead. He is a businessman who has succeeded in establishing a bakery, where he works with his family. His wife works for most of the time when he is at his house, which is also used as a bakery. They have three children. Carlos has more than 4 years' experience in making bread, and he has always been very successful, because with his efforts he was able to buy the necessary machines for making bread.

He is asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, etc., in order to be able to continue baking his delicious bread. He says that he wants to have a stronger business, in order to be able to keep providing for his family with his wife, and by this to give a good future to his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, etc., in order to continue making his delicious bread.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Judith has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt and water. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items like sugar, rice and all types of flour. It will help Judith generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself and her young siblings. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to become a community worker. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase  items like sugar, rice and all types of flour.

loans.name: Yolanda Esther

texts.es:
Yolanda Esther tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Yolanda Esther se dedica a la venta de juguetes, ropa, adornos, peluches, entre otros; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, pues desea invertir en compra de más mercadería (juguetes, adornos, peluches, ropa, entre otros) para incrementar y diversificar el stock de productos con lo que cuenta en su bazar, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, y poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda Esther is 52 years old and married, with two children. She lives with her family in a rural area that belongs to the Oyotún district, in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Locals work mainly in agriculture and commerce.

Yolanda Esther sells toys, clothes, decorations, and stuffed toys, among other things. She has been doing this, at home, for more than ten years.

Yolanda Esther is requesting a loan to buy more things to sell, such as toys, decorations, stuffed toys and clothes. She wants to have more things and a wider variety to offer to her customers. With this investment, her sales will increase and she will be able to satisfy her customers’ needs, requirements and wishes. This will result in more profits and a higher income, thus better living conditions for her.

loans.use: to buy toys, decorations, clothes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Thadeous

texts.en:
Thadeous is a 42 year old married man with 6 children living in Fort Portal-Uganda. 

He offers welding and house construction services as his main sources of income. He faces the challenge of high costs of production, despite that, he has hopes of expanding his business and offering employment opportunities. 

Thadeous needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mujeres Mazahuas Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde habita el grupo Mujeres Mazahuas es una comunidad de raíces indígenas, lleno de historia, cultura, fiesta y tradición. La gastronomía se caracteriza por sus ricos tamales, pollo, moles rojo y verde, el arroz; el pulque como bebida tradicional que se obtiene del maguey. Con el paso de los años, muchas costumbres se van perdiendo, afortunadamente también hay personas interesadas por rescatar toda esa historia.

El grupo lo conforman cuatro integrantes, personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desde hace algunos años están a cargo de una actividad económica para mejorar su condición de vida. Juana, o Juanita como la gente la conoce, es seria pero también muy responsable. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, está casada con Arturo y a lo largo de 10 años han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales asisten a la escuela. Mientras su esposo trabaja como obrero, en la construcción de casas o en el campo, Juanita tiene un molino de nixtamal. Todas las mañanas se levanta a las 5:00 am para iniciar a dar servicio a las personas de su comunidad. En este lugar, como en muchas otras partes de México, se acostumbra hacer tortillas a mano pero para ello es necesario preparar el nixtamal en un molino como el de Juanita. “A raíz de la buena clientela del molino, decidí iniciar con la venta de abarrotes hace un mes” es así que ahora tiene dos fuentes de ingreso. Juanita está muy agradecida con KIVA y VisionFund México porque gracias a los prestamos ha podido emprender su tienda de abarrotes. Con su nuevo préstamo comprará productos de abarrotes como leche, huevo, pan, azúcar, refresco, productos enlatados que son los artículos que vende con más frecuencia. Con sus ingresos, Juanita tiene la posibilidad de solventar algunos gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus niños y sueña con llegar a tener una gran abarrotera donde pueda ofrecer una gran variedad de mercancía. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo invertirán en sus negocios: Miguel y Claudia invertirán en sus borreguitos y Doña Domitila comprará mas productos de abarrotes.

*La foto se tomó en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio donde habitan los integrantes, Juanita viste una chamarra color café.*
texts.en:
The community where the Mujeres Mazahuas group lives is a community with indigenous roots, full of history, festivals and tradition. The cuisine is characterized by its delicious tamales, chicken, red and green moles, rice, and pulque, a traditional drink made from maguey. As the years go by, many customs are being lost. Fortunately, there are also persons interested in rescuing all of that history. 

The group is made up of four members. They are very hardworking and enterprising people who for several years have had economic activities to improve their living conditions. Juana, or Juanita, as people call her, is serious and also very responsible. She is 30 years old and married to Arturo and over the years has had a family with three children who are in school. While her husband works as a laborer in construction of houses or in the fields, Juanita has a  corn mill. Every morning she gets up at 5:00 am to start her service for people in her community. In this place, like in many other parts of Mexico, people make tortillas by hand, and to do that it is necessary to prepare the corn in a mill like Juanita's. “Because of the good clientele with the mill, I decided to  start selling groceries a month ago”. That is how now she has two sources of income. Juanita is very grateful to KIVA and VisionFund Mexico because thanks to the loans, she has been able to start her grocery store. With the new loan, she will buy grocery products such as milk, eggs, bread, sugar, beverages, and canned products, items that sell the most. With her income, Juanita has the possibility of paying for some household expenses and for her children's education. She dreams of having a great grocery store where she can offer a wide variety of merchandise. 

The other members of the group will invest in her businesses: Miguel and Claudia will invest in their sheep and Domitila will buy more grocery products.

*The photo was taken on the stairs of the kiosk of the town where the members live. Juanita is wearing a brown jacket.*

loans.use: to buy more grocery products.

location.town: Dios Padre, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Colque Orcco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “COLQUE ORCCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefa ella es casada y tiene 39 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Colque Orcco,” located in the Paucartambo district, which belongs to the Paucartambo province, department of Cusco.

Josefa, one of the members, is 39 years old and has three children. She works selling cereals, such as corn, wheat, and quinoa, from 08:00 am until 05:00 pm. Josefa has been doing this for four years and does very well. Her dream is to own an establishment where she can sell her products.

Josefa is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa. She wants to thank those who contribute to her dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

The remaining members work selling animals, cereals, groceries and food.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes Judith

texts.es:
Lourdes Judith tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Lourdes Judith se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, tales como patos, gallinas, pollos, conejos, cuyes, entre otros; desde hace 7 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea invertir en la compra de pavos, gallinas, cerdos, cuyes, para aumentar y diversificar su stock, lo que le va a permitir atender y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. El préstamo le ayudará a incrementar su productividad en la venta de sus animales, reflejándose en un mayor volumen de ventas, mejores ingresos, mayores ganancias y por ende en una mejora de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lourdes Judith is 39 years old. She has two children who depend on her and lives in a house of her own located in the rural area of the Oyotún district, which belongs to the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Locals work mainly in agriculture and commerce.

Lourdes Judith works raising small farm animals, such as ducks, hens, chickens, rabbits and guinea pigs. She has been doing this for seven years in her backyard.

Lourdes Judith is requesting a loan to buy turkeys, hens, pigs and guinea pigs in order to have more and a wider variety of animals in order to satisfy her customers’ needs. This loan will help her to become a more productive saleswoman, which will result in more sales, more profits, a higher income, and the improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy turkeys, hens, pigs and guinea pigs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine. This investment will be very useful because it will help her have more income in her home.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio Walter se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio hace servicio de transporte, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Walter continues to work in the transportation business. He has a transportation service and works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. His dream is to buy a new car. He is asking for the loan to buy tires for his car. 

This member is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est âgée de 31ans. Son mari est menuisier en aluminium et ils ont 03 enfants. L’ainé âgé de 06ans est scolarisé et le dernier a 3ans. Quant à Akouvi, elle est revendeuse de nourriture sous un hangar et revendeuse des articles scolaires. Ses achats se font à Lomé et elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter du riz, des tomates, de l’huile végétale et autre. Elle a 4ans d’ancienneté dans l’activité. Avec le profit, elle veut épargner, ouvrir un bar dans l’avenir et avoir une bonne condition de vie.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 31 years old. Her husband is an aluminum carpenter and they have three children. The 6-year-old eldest is in school and the youngest is three.

As for Akouvi, she retails food and also school supplies from under a shed. She resupplies in Lome and is requesting her third loan to buy rice, tomatoes, vegetable oil and other products. She has four years' experience in the business.

She wants to save the profits she makes, open a bar in the future, and enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 28 year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal-Uganda. He sells chapatis and does farming. He started the business with a vision of earning an income. He is aiming at constructing a better home.

Vincent needs a loan to buy windows and doors for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors for his house construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine, 49, is a mother of three who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for two years.  Her primary income sources are tea, vegetables, bananas, a job salary, and profits from a small-time personal business.

Josphine is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The work women in the area are currently doing on the farm was previously male tasks. They have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labour in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields, and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well of using poor traditional tools.

The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business related expenses. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Josphine replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
