Mathias is a male Ugandan, age 44 years, married to Agnes. They have five children, ages between 21 and 7; only four attend school.

He is a farmer, and he grows coffee as his major source of income, but he also has dealt in produce since 2006.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 to buy produce; being in a peak season, he will be in position to buy cheaply and later sell at a higher margin to make a profit. 

He is determined and dedicated, and appreciates the financial support rendered to him, because he is confident it will take him a long way.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a private entrepreneur from the Sevqar village of the Tavush region. She lives with her husband, and their only son is a farmer in a neighbouring country. Her husband works at the local school as a teacher. Anahit runs a small local grocery store, where she sells different products for everyday demand. She and her husband work hard to be able to earn a living. 

Currently, Anahit's small business needs some investment in order for it to be compatible and function in a sustainable way. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to expand the assortment of goods she sells in her store, to purchase supplies (food supplies, drinks and home supplies) for the market. 

The loan will be a huge support for this hardworking woman, and will help her develop her small business further. Anahit relies on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be very thankful to them for helping her sustain her business.

As this is Anahit's first loan; it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for supplies (food supplies, drinks and home supplies)

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in the Yenoqavan village of the Tavush region. 

She is an experienced farmer, and lives with her big family: a husband, two sons, a daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. The whole family is engaged in breeding livestock of cows, pigs, piglets, calves and hens, as well as in cultivation of grass, plums, apples and pears. Farming is the main source of the family’s income. They currently want to enlarge the livestock a little bit to be able to meet their increasing daily needs. 

A loan of USD 1,100 will be a great support to this hardworking woman, and will enable her to pay for renovation of the farm, purchase an ox and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the farm, purchase an ox, and purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ruben Bautista

texts.es:
Ruben un responsable y trabajador hombre de 53 años de edad que debido a la difícil situación que atraviesa el sector de Sincelejo vio la necesidad de buscar alternativas para asegurar el bienestar de sus dos hijas de 11 y 10 años de edad quienes viven solas con él.

Ruben se dedica a la distribución de carne de cerdo pero es muy limitado por el capital que posee para trabajar y no produce lo que quisiera ya que en resumen no cuenta con los recursos para comprar los cerdos y los granjeros ya no Fían.

Buscando siempre el bienestar de sus hijas que estudien y tengan una adecuada alimentación quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en 4 cerdos con un peso aproximado de 100 kilos, esta inversión le permitirá seguir distribuyendo en el pueblo y que no le lleguen a reemplazar por otro proveedor dejándolo a él y a sus hijas en la calle.
texts.en:
Ruben is a responsible and hardworking 53 year old man who, given the difficult situation in Sincelejo, saw the need to look for an alternative way to ensure his two daughters’, ages 11 and 10, wellbeing.  They live with him.

Ruben supplies pork but its very limited due to the capital he has, so he doesn’t produce what he would like, because he doesn’t have the money to buy pigs and the farmers don’t offer credit.

As he is always looking after his daughters’ wellbeing; feeding them and having them attend school, he is asking for a loan to buy four pigs weighing approximately 100 kg.  This investment will allow him to continue delivering to people so that they won’t switch to another supplier, leaving him and his daughters out in the street.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose de 42 años de edad es un hombre casado padre de 4 hijos en las edades de 1 a 19 años. Desde el año 1985 inició su negocio de venta de queso, aprovechando la experiencia adquirida, viendo a sus familiares que tambien se dedican a este mismo negocio. él ofree queso blando ue cosnumen con pan, bollo, arepas, arroz etc. y queso duro que usan principalmente para rallar y agregar a la masa para hacer buñuelos, arepas, empanadas etc. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito en tiendas y negocios vecinos,  todos los dias trabajando desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde comprandole a credito a proveedores de los pueblos cercanos que le ofrecen precisos competitivos. Su meta mas adelante es tener una quesera generando empleos y mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda, además de lograr estudios de calidad para sus hijos  y que ellos consigan finalmente ser exitosos. En la actualidad José esta aplicando a un credikiva primer financiemitno que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará queso en un mayor volumen, para obtener buenos precios y lograr trasladarselos a su clientela, mejorando así su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is 42 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 1 and 19.  He started his cheese business in 1985, taking advantage of the experience he got selling for relatives who also have this type of business.  He offers white cheese that is eaten with bread, buns, rice, etc., and hard cheese that is mainly used to grate and add to dough to make buñuelos, arepas, empanadas etc. 

He makes his sales for cash and credit to stores and nearby businesses.  He works every day from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm, buying supplies on credit in nearby towns that offer better prices.  His goal is to have a cheese shop in the future, where he can create jobs and improve the living conditions within his home.  He also wants to provide a quality education for his children so they can be successful.

Jose is asking for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so he can buy cheese in quantity so he can get better pricing and pass the savings on to his customers and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Lalo

texts.es:
El socio Lalo se dedica al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio a la ciudad de lima llevando carga, el socio trabaja 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lalo earns a living in the transportation business.  He has a car and provides cargo service to the city of Lima.  He has worked in this business for seven years and it's going very well for him.  His dream is to buy himself a new car.

Lalo's requesting the loan to buy tires for his car.

He's happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Vilma Dinora

texts.es: Vilma de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija y sus padres, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de frutas de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, adicional a eso tambien vende ropa de segunda mano, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos, Vilma esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fruta por mayor( pepino, mango, sandia, melón, piña, papaya, etc.) para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 41, is a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her daughter and her parents.

She has earned a living for three years selling fruit in the streets of various neighborhoods.  She also sells used clothing.  With the profits from her work she's able to pay for some expenses.

Vilma's requesting a loan to be able to buy fruit wholesale (cucumber, mango, watermelon, cantaloupe, pineapple, papaya, etc.) to continue with the job that generates a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 1 años a la elaboración y venta de piñatas, tiene mucha clientela ya establecida que la buscan por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales como: pegamento, papel de colores, papel periódico, alambre, etc. y continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman's face has been pixelated because she's 20 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

She has worked for a year making and selling piñatas.  She has a lot of steady customers who seek her out because of the quality and good prices of her work.  She lives in her own house with her life partner and her child.

She's requesting a loan to buy glue, colored paper, newsprint, wire, and other materials so she can continue with the job that generates a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy glue, colored paper, newsprint, wire, etc.

loans.name: Alcinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chokwé Província de Gaza tem 49 anos de idade, solteira, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 4 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
É proprietária de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 5 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo produtos como Arroz, feijão, amendoim e mais. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alcinda was born in the Chokwé Province of Gaza, is 49 years old, single and responsible for 4 nephews who live in her home.

She has owned a commercial establishment for more than 5 years and she uses the money she makes for household expenses. With this loan she plans to expand her business by buying products such as rice, beans, peanuts and more. This is her 6th loan with Hluvuku.

loans.use: expand her business by buying products such as rice, beans, peanuts and more

loans.name: Heidi Marisela

texts.es:
Heidi de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado. Su esposo es empleado en una empresa de distribución de productos lácteos, desempeñándose como motorista. En la casa solo vive en conjunto con su esposo y sus dos hijos.

Heidi se dedica a los cuidados del hogar, mientras su esposo trabaja todo el día. Sin embargo, para pasar entretenida Heidi se dedica al engorde de cerdos que crece en el patio de su casa, alimentándolos con suero y harinilla y cuando ya tiene el peso suficiente, lo destazan y venden su carne.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cerdos y concentrado para que crezcan y se engorden para su venta.

Heidi sueña con llegar a tener una granja de cerdos grande y de esta manera vender y abastecer toda la región donde habita.
texts.en:
Heidi, 29, has a ninth-grade education.  Her husband is employed as a driver by a company that distributes dairy products.  Just she, her husband, and her two children live in her house.

Heidi spends her time taking care of the household while her husband works all day.  Nevertheless, to keep herself busy, Heidi works fattening pigs on her patio.  She feeds them whey and "harinilla" [rice feed], and when they weigh enough, she butchers them and sells the meat.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy pigs and concentrated feed so they grow and get fat for sale.

Heidi dreams of having a big pig farm so she can sell to and supply the entire region where she lives.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase recycled products.

loans.name: Andrade

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade apenas 1 é que frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha na Sociedade de Águas Namaacha como operador de máquinas a mais de 12 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, pedra e outro que for necessário. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende contrair o matrimónio e iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade, tem como desafio garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior
texts.en:
Andrade was born in the Namaacha Province of Maputo and is 31 years old. He lives with his partner and is the father of 2 children who are both minors - only 1 goes to school - and doesn't support anyone else.

He has worked in the Namaacha Water Company as a machine operator for more than 12 years and the money he makes goes towards household and construction expenses. With this loan he plans to continue the building work on his house by buying construction materials such as sand, cement, stone and other necessary materials. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuu.

In future he plans to be married and start a business selling essential products. His challenge is to guarantee his children's education all the way to college level.

loans.use: ontinue the building work on his house by buying construction material such as sand, cement, stone and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is an experienced agronomist from the village of Dimitrov in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and three daughters (aged 9,8 and 4 years old). To earn a living, Olga is engaged in the cultivation of tomatoes and peppers. Farming is the main source of income for the family. Olga's husband helps her greatly in getting the agricultural produce to the local market. Olga cultivates plants in two greenhouses. As their needs are growing day by day, she needs to enlarge her agricultural business, to meet the daily needs of her family more effectively. The requested loan of USD $3,000 will greatly help Olga to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, fertilizer and deal with plant diseases.
Please help this hard working woman to improve her farm and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her greenhouse, fertilizer and to deal with plant diseases

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an agronomist from Araqsavan village in the Ararat region. She lives there with her husband, mother-in-law and three sons. Susanna and her family are farmers. They own a greenhouse where different vegetables are cultivated. Susanna is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. This requested loan of USD 2100 will help her to renovate the greenhouse, and purchase seeds and fertilizer to fight against diseases. As this is Susanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 
 Susanna will be very grateful if lenders support her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her greenhouse, seeds and fuel for heating

loans.name: Muong Phang 2 Group

texts.en:
Thu is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in a small new Thai traditional house in a remote village. She and her husband mainly work at farming activities and cultivating rice holds a very important role in production, just like many other households in her village. Her husband earns extra income working for a local employer. 

Because of difficult conditions, Thu has tried to diversify her agricultural activities, such as raising fish and chickens and growing vegetables. She requested her second loan from Anh Chi Em, which she will use to buy more fish. She hopes that with the loan and training sessions from Anh Chi Em, she will be able to improve her family's income, buy new furniture for the house, and provide for her child. 

In the picture, Thu is a tall woman first from the right.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 40 year old male Ugandan man married to Juliet and they have 5 children who are aged between 06 and 19.

He is a farmer who grows coffee and maize but he is also a produce dealer since 2006 in Kamuyange.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy corn and beans which he hopes to sell at a profit.

His plans for the future are to buy more land for agriculture and educating his children. Eric's main challenges include crop diseases and weather changes.

He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy corn and beans

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is 34 years old; she is married with 1 child age of 9 who goes to school. She has been farming for 9 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to buy land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Muong Phang 1 Group

texts.en:
Thom is a young Thai woman who lives in a small village with her husband and her two daughters in a Thai traditional house. She's 27 years old and works very hard at agricultural activities and rice cultivation.  This farming is the main income for her family. They also raise pigs, fish and ducks to diversify production. To have additional earnings for the family, Thom's husband works for a local construction company. This is very tough and dangerous work. 

Her first daughter is in grade 2 and the second one is in kindergarten. They are too small and she doesn't want them to work hard, but wants them to concentrate on studying. For that reason, she never stops working to provide a better life for her children. Indeed, she has taken her second loan with Anh Chi Em Program to buy pigs and pig feed after reaping the benefits from the first loan along with the training sessions about pigs. She hopes she could even be more successful with breeding pigs this time so that she would have more cash for other farming investments and afford to buy new furniture for the house as well as provide the best conditions for her family. 

In the picture, Thom is smiling and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food pig feed

loans.name: Progreso 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Progreso 2 está ubicado en una comunidad cañera donde la fuente de empleo principal es el campo y el ingenio donde la caña es procesada para convertirla en melaza y en azúcar. Durante 6 meses, es el periodo de corte de caña, conocido como zafra. Los otros 6 meses son de reparación y mantenimiento de la maquinaria y crecimiento de la caña. al finalizar el periodo de zafra, se organiza un baile en el ingenio, el cual aloja más de 1500 personas que bailan toda la madrugada hasta que los grupos invitados dejan de tocar. 

Los integrantes comentan que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque el obtener un préstamo e invertirlo es una manera de progresar y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias quienes son el motor principal para continuar día con día.

La señora Amalia es una persona muy trabajadora, honrada, hospitalaria, alegre, tiene 4 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad. Doña Amalia se ha dedicado desde hace 4 años a la venta de productos naturistas (desayunos) para favorecer la salud, y debido a su nivel de ventas, hace 3.5 años abrió su primer club de nutrición; hoy en día maneja 5. Comenta además que su vida cambió desde que inició la actividad, pues la empresa proveedora de productos la ha reconocido con varios premios por sus ventas: cenas, menciones y dos viajes a Huatulco (lugar turístico del estado de Oaxaca). De igual manera ha tenido la oportunidad de convivir con miembros del club. De sus recuerdos, tiene fotografías que muestra en uno de sus locales, pues para ella todo esto es respaldo de su experiencia. Su meta ahora es escalar a la siguiente categoría de ventas. 

Para Amalia, su negocio es su vida entera, pues aunque tuvo momentos difíciles al separarse de su esposo, fue justo lo que la impulsó a iniciar una actividad y en la empresa además, tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a su actual pareja quien siempre la apoya. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos como malteadas, proteína, yogurth, té y lo necesario para activar su sexto club nutricional.

Los demás integrantes y sus actividades son:

Teresita-Venta De Abarrotes
Zenaida- Venta De Ropa
Rafaela- Venta De Manualidades
Anayhely- Venta De Chicharrones Y Elotes
Luz Maria-Venta De Antojitos 
Maria-Venta De Tamales Y Chiles Rellenos 
Benedita-Venta de Antojitos


*En la imagen: La señora Amalia viste blusa de manga larga color azul y muestra dos botones blancos con la marca de los productos de nutrición que vende.
texts.en:
The group "Progreso 2" is located in a sugar cane community where the main source of employment is the land and the sugar factory where the cane is processed into molasses and sugar. Six months is the period for cutting cane known as "zafra." The other six months are for repairs, maintenance of the machinery, and the growth of cane. At the end of "zafra," a dance is organized at the factory which holds 1,500 people who dance until the morning when the groups stop playing. 

The members say that the name of the group was chosen because obtaining the loan and investing is a way to progress and offer a better quality of life to their families who are the motive to continue day to day.

Amalia is a hard-working person, honorable, hospitable, and happy. She has four adult children. She has worked four years selling natural products(breakfasts) to boost health, and due to her level of sales, three and a half years ago she opened her own nutrition club. Today, she operates five. She says that in addition to her life's changing since she started the work, her supplier has recognized her with various awards for her sales: dinners, mentions, and two trips to Huatulco(a touristic location in the state of Oaxaca). Likewise, she has been able to live together with members of the club. From her mementos, she has photos that show one of her locations so for her all of this is support for her experience. Her goal now is increase the following category of sales.

For Amalia, her business is her entire life because she's had difficult moments from separating from her husband, it was just what she needed to motivate her to start her activity and the business. She had the opportunity to meet her partner right now who always supports her. With the loan she wants to buy more products like malts, protein, yogurt, tea and what is necessary for her sixth nutritional club.

The rest of the members and their activities are:

Teresita-grocery sales
Zenaida- clothing sales
Rafaela- craft sales
Anayhely- chicarrones and corn sales
Luz Maria-appetizer sales
Maria-tamales and stuffed chiles sales 
Benedita-appetizer sales


In the photo Amalia is wearing a blue, long sleeved blouse with two white buttons with the brand of nutritional products she sells.

loans.use: to buy malts, protein, aloe, yogurt, tea, and what's necessary to start her sixth club.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona que desde joven conoce el trabajo fuerte ya que al no tener muchos recursos económicos en su familia empezó a trabajar como obrero de campo para apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. Ha sacrificado mucho para que su familia hoy viva en mejores condiciones, a la fecha es soltero, pero eso no lo pone triste, porque siente la satisfacción de saber que su familia está muy bien.
Los fuertes deseos que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia hará que Miguel utilice el préstamo para poder hacer mejoras en su casa como terminar el techado de la casa, él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto sentirá mayor tranquilidad y más adelante podrá terminar de construir toda su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is a person who has worked hard since he was young, as his family has limited economic resources. He started to work as a field labourer in order to help his parents with living costs. He has sacrificed a lot to ensure that, today, his family has a better standard of living. To date, he is single, but this does not make him sad because he has the satisfaction of knowing that his family is doing well. 

The strong desire to improve his family's quality of life means that Miguel will use the loan to make improvements to their house, such as finishing the roof. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity and he wants them to know that this loan will give him greater peace of mind and that, in the future, he will be able to finish the construction of the entire house.

loans.use: to finish the roof of his house

loans.name: Muong Phang 3 Group

texts.en:
In a remote village, there is a Thai woman who many villagers know because of her effort in life and positive attitude. Her name is Loi. She's 29 and lives with her husband, along with two daughters; one is at grade 7 and the other is in kindergarten, and they both attend school fully. 

Loi's family is also known by the people as a very happy family even in their difficult situation. She and her husband work very hard at agricultural production, including cultivating rice, vegetables and raising chickens, fish and pigs. Besides this, her husband works extra for a local construction employer to earn more and provide better living conditions for the family. 

Together with the effort of her husband, Loi applied for a loan from Anh Chi Em to buy small fish so that she could expand the fish breeding and increase her income to cover her family's expenditures. 

This is the first time Loi takes out a loan from Anh Chi Em, and she expects to have a significant change for her family, especially when she gets the training lessons from the program. 

In the picture, Loi is wearing a pink shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish to expand her fish-breeding activity

loans.name: Maa Bastaren Group

texts.en:
Maa Bastaren is a Self Help Group of 11 active and poor women entrepreneurs of a rural village called Biripali of Balangir district in Odisha, India. This group was formed in the year 2014 to avail themselves of loans from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their existing businesses. 

Jamuna, a simple and confident lady, hails from a poor family living below the poverty line. She is the one in the group who is standing third from left in the photo with a raised hand. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband.
 
Jamuna has been running a Tiffin (light meals) stall for the last 10 years in her village with the hand-holding support of her husband. Jamuna prepares items like samosas, wada, potato chup, etc. Her stall is very popular due to her good quality items. 

She starts her Tiffin stall at 8 a.m. in the morning and closes at 6 p.m. in the evening. Due to the rural base, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from her Tiffin stall.  With this small income, she is hardly able to manage her household expenses. 

Jamuna has a dream of constructing a house and purchasing a bike, but due to lack of finances, she is not being able to materialize it, so she wants to expand her business with the present loan of 16,000 INR. She plans to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc., to increase the items as well as quantity of Tiffin. 

She hopes this will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she has to replenish her stock frequently from the nearest market, which is 8 kilometers away. Jamuna hopes to save enough to construct a permanent cabin for her Tiffin stall and construct a house of her own to be a prestigious woman of her village.

The other 10 members of the group are also doing various micro enterprises like puffed rice businesses, vegetable cultivation and vending, fruit stalls, tea and Tiffin stalls, general stores, dry food vending, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alapama

texts.en:
Alapama is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Alapama needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Alapama has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Leone needs a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, sandwiches, chairs, tables, a small display fridge and pies. She plans to use her profits to help expand her business and to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Leone has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, sandwiches, chairs, tables, a small display fridge and pies.

loans.name: Sauafa

texts.en:
Sauafa is a 55-year-old widow with eight children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years.

Sauafa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, sprayers, chemicals, crops, boots, a new wheelbarrow and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Sauafa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, sprayers, chemicals, crops, boots, a new wheelbarrow and a machete.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her plantations.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Retailing helped Mary Ann survive for the family. She retails assorted product items of Avon, MSE, and Natasha, and brings in a meager income of 10,000 Philippines pesos per month. 

Mary Ann is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now she has applied for a loan to restock her business of selling dry goods and toiletries. Mary Ann hopes that God will always bless her business and her family.

loans.use: to restock dry goods and toiletries

loans.name: Muong Phang 4 Group

texts.en:
Hoa, 40, lives in a small Thai village that's far from the district center with her husband and her smallest daughter. Her two older daughters are married and live far from her. She's a quite shy woman because she's illiterate, but she's a very hard-working person. 

Hoa and her husband mostly work at agricultural production, such as growing rice and fruit, and raising pigs, ducks, chickens and fish. Like many men in the village, her husband also works extra for a local construction employer to earn more income. 

Together with her husband's effort, Hoa continuously expands her breeding of fish thanks to taking out loans from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is her fourth loan, and she will continue using the loan to buy more fish. 

Hoa dreams that she could afford to send her smallest daughter to a good university so that the girl would have a good job in the future and have a better life than her. 

In the picture, Hoa wears a traditional Thai bag and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more fish for breeding

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mrs. Mila is 58 years old, married and a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through farming. She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. 

Now, she is applying a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional fertilizer for her farm.

Mila deeply wishes to maintain as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for additional fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Puletasi

texts.en:
Puletasi is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Puletasi needs a loan to buy food items including salt, sugar, flour, pies, sandwiches and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Puletasi has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy food items like salt, sugar, flour, pies, sandwiches and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tess

texts.en:
Tess is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tess needs a loan to buy paper plates, cups, snacks, soft drinks, donuts, pies, jars and candy. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Tess has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy paper plates, cups, snacks, soft drinks, donuts, pies, jars and candy

loans.name: Lolofi

texts.en:
Lolofi is a 30-year-old unmarried woman with two children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Lolofi needs a loan to buy crates of drinks, snacks, cakes, pies, chairs and a variety of twisties. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lolofi has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks, snacks, cakes, pies, chairs and a variety of twisties.

loans.name: Okesa

texts.en:
Okesa is 33 years old, married, and has three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Okesa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, new boots, a spade, a new wheelbarrow and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Okesa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, new boots, a spade, a new wheelbarrow and a machete.

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.en:
Vitoria is 37 years old and unmarried with five children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years. 

Vitoria needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, overalls, boots, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, a spade and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Vitoria will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, overalls, boots, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, a spade and crops.

loans.name: Silaumea

texts.en:
Silaumea is 42 years old and unmarried with three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Silaumea needs a loan to buy boots, overalls, crops, a machete, a spade, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Silaumea will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy boots, overalls, crops, a machete, a spade, a wheelbarrow and chemicals.

loans.name: Tovale

texts.en:
Tovale is a 33-year-old divorced woman with six children. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Tovale needs a loan to buy large pots, a new oven, a large frying pan, a strainer, seasonings and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Tovale has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy large pots, a new oven, a large frying pan, a strainer, seasonings and plastic bags

loans.name: Fagasau

texts.en:
Fagasau is 74 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years. 

Fagasau needs a loan to buy a sack of potatoes, bags of rice, salt, flour, sugar and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of potatoes, bags of rice, salt, flour, sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: carlos de 34 años de edad vive en casa propiacon su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus cosechas en os diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para tener un buen cultivo ya que ha empezado a sembrar asi como muestra en la fotografía y asi percibir mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 34-year old man who lives in his own house with his wife and four children. He has worked in agriculture for several years, especially cultivating corn. He sells the product in the various markets near his house. 

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers, plague controls, weed-killers, etc. so that he can have a good harvest. He has already started cultivating, as shown in the picture, and expects to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plague controls, weed-killers, etc.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 35-year-old woman who is married and has two children. 

She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has one year with this business. 

Eseta needs a loan to pay for the overhaul of her taxi's engine and also to buy a new sign indicator. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Eseta joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for the overhaul of her taxi's engine and also to buy a new sign indicator.

loans.name: Suega

texts.en:
Suega is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. 

She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Suega needs a loan to buy foam cups, cordials, sugar, a new cooler, a chest freezer and Chinese candy. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Suega has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, cordials, sugar, a new cooler, a chest freezer and Chinese candy.

loans.name: Faatoga

texts.en:
Faatoga is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Faatoga needs a loan to buy a frying pan, yeast, flour, cooking oil and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faatoga has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, yeast, flour, cooking oil and a new oven.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Es bueno saber que mujeres emprendedoras en la vida sostienen una decisión de poder superarse y que no importa el trabajo que realiza siempre lo realizan con mucho esmero y dedicación tal es el caso de Sonia que cuenta con 6 hijos 2 de ellos ya tienen familias y 1 ya trabaja para ayudar a su mama y los últimos 3 son estudiantes de la comunidad donde ella vive.

La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de comida en su comunidad por los que se dedica a servir a la gente que llegan con ella para disfrutar de la delicias que Sonia realiza con mucho esmero y esfuerzo esta actividad que ella realiza lo aprendió de su madre ya que ella también se dedica a la misma actividad y genera un buen ingreso económica y ganancias impresionantes por lo que vale la pena realizarlo, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante más de 4 años.

El uso que le dará al crédito que ella quiere realizar es para la compra de una refrigeradora para su comedor y otros artículos que ella necesita para bridar un buen servicio a las personas que lleguen a visitarla.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de Sonia es en la compra de un local en su comunidad para instalarse mejor y que tenga más clientela y que le dejen buena ganancia y así tener una buena casa y que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida y que sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
It's good to know that there are women entrepreneurs who decide to get ahead and improve. Regardless of their job, they always work with care and dedication. This is the case for Sonia, who has six children, two of whom already have families, one helps his mother at work and three are still attending school at the community where they live. 

She works selling food to her community, who really enjoy the delicious meals that Sonia makes with care and hard-work. She learned to cook from her mother, who has the same job. She has been in the business for more than 4 years and generates good income and impressive profits. She plans to use the loan to buy a fridge for her dining room as well as some articles to provide her customers with a good service. 

One of Sonia's biggest dreams is to buy a space in her community where she could work and receive customers. She also dreams with having good income and a nice house, and with seeing her children having a better life and becoming professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Erkeaiym

texts.ru: Эркеайым досрочно погасила предыдущий кредит. Она благодарна всем инвесторам Кива, кто помог ей. Кредит Эркеайым использовала по назначению. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,64 ГА, где она ежегодно выращивает клевер. Всю прибыль от бизнеса Эркеайым старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Однако в этом году она решила сделать капитальный ремонт дома, поэтому Эркеайым и обратилась вновь в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS). Эркеайым хочет до конца осени закончить ремонт дома и отпраздновать свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Erkeaiym repaid her previous loan early and is grateful for all the Kiva investors who helped her. She used the loan for its intended purpose and currently has two cows and ten sheep on her farm. She also has a 0.64 hectare plot of land where she grows clover every year. She tries to invest all of her profits in business development. This year, however, she decided to make major repairs on her home. That is why she applied for another loan with Bai-Tushum Bank for 130,000 som (KGS). She wants to finish the repairs by the end of autumn and celebrate her son's wedding.

loans.use: To make some repairs on her house

loans.name: Héctor Romeo

texts.es:
Héctor de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente casado, su pareja se dedica al comercio de ropa, y fruto de la relación tienen 2 niños pequeños los cuales están yendo a la escuela.

Héctor trabaja en un centro deportivo realizando labores de mantenimiento, como el riego de las canchas de futbol y el aseo en general del campus, aquí lleva trabajando 2 años y medio. También maneja el negocio de venta de ropa, el cual administra su esposa, comprando la mercadería en la ciudad y la sale a vender de forma ambulante en distintos caseríos de la región oriental del país.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, vestidos, ropa interior de hombre y mujer. Debido a que existe bastante demanda en esta época.

Héctor sueña con superarse económicamente y formar un hogar sólido en donde pueda gozar de una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Héctor, 25, studied through high school.  He's happily married and has two small children from that relationship who already attend school.  His wife earns a living selling clothing.

Héctor works in a recreation center providing maintenance such as irrigating the soccer fields and general cleaning of the campus.  He has been working there for two-and-a-half years.  He also manages his wife's clothing business, buying the merchandise in the city and selling it as a street vendor in various villages in the eastern part of the country.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, dresses, and women's and men's underwear, because there's a lot of demand this time of year.

Héctor dreams of improving himself economically and having a strong home where he can enjoy an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, dresses, and underwear

loans.name: Simeamativa

texts.en: Simeamativa is a 53-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Simeamativa needs a loan to buy coffee, sugar, a boiler, a case of milk, sandwiches, snacks and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Simeamativa has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, a boiler, a case of milk, sandwiches, snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains. meat, eggs, dairy products, pastries and various products.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 61-year-old widow with nine children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has nine years of experience with this business. Sara needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sara has been a member of SPBD since 2005.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime is 49 years old and married with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Menime needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Menime will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old and married with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Janet needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a spade, a new machete and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Janet will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a spade, a new machete and crops

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa is a 28-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Temukisa needs a loan to buy foam cups, Chinese candy, a large spoon, a cooler, a chest freezer and cordials. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Temukisa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, Chinese candy, a large spoon, a cooler, a chest freezer and cordials

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru: Вере 63 года, вдова, дети взрослые, проживают отдельно. У Веры высшее образование, работает бухгалтером. На данный момент Вера ремонтирует свою квартиру, в целях улучшения жилищных условий. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку энергоэффективных пластиковых окон, также на внутреннюю отделку стен. Вера хочет преобразить и утеплить свою квартиру, что позволит значительно снизить расходы на отопление.
texts.en: Vera is 63 years old and a widow. Her children are grown and live independently. Vera has college education and works as a bookkeeper. At present Vera is renovating her apartment in order to improve her living conditions. She has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 90,000 KGS to buy energy-efficient plastic window and repaint the inside walls. Vera would like to renovate and winterize her apartment, which will allow to decrease her heating  costs significantly.

loans.use: to purchase energy efficient windows and make improvements in her apartment.

loans.name: Taele

texts.en:
Taele is 45 years old and unmarried with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. 

Taele needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a machete, a spade, chemicals, sprayers and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Taele will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a machete, a spade, chemicals, sprayers and crops

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Лутфулло - мужчина 35 лет ,женат,имеет троих детей. Он живёт в сельской местности.Лутфулло имеет собственное  маршрутное такси ,на котором занимается перевозкой пассажиров и багажа.Иногда Фатхулло работает и в ночную смену,чтобы получить доход побольше.Лутфулло усердно работает,чтобы прокормить свою семью и накопить деньги на образование детей. Его маршрутка сломалась и нуждается в починке.Но Лутфулло не имеет нужной суммы на данный момент для ремонта.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Lutfullo is 35 and married with three children. He lives in a rural area and has his own minivan taxi, with which he transports passengers and baggage. Sometimes he works the night shift as well, in order to bring in more income.

Lutfullo works hard to feed his family and save toward his children's education. His vehicle has broken down and needs to be fixed, but he doesn't have enough money at the moment for the repairs. Therefore he has turned to microfinance organization Arvand for financial support. He thanks Arvand in advance for their support and faith in him.

loans.use: to buy auto parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Eliseo es un hombre de 28 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y trabaja como jefe de producción en una fábrica de papel.
Él es inteligente, optimista, paciente, responsable, constante y muy trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la ‘Av Chacaltaya’ que es una zona industrial donde se encuentran fábricas e industrias de todo tipo.
Eliseo es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara por herencia familiar. En su trabajo; él se encarga de coordinar y supervisar las operaciones dentro su empresa para que esta opere de la mejor manera. Sus inicios fueron como obrero cuando se encontraba estudiando la carrera de técnico superior en producción, y con los años lo ascendieron a jefe. Él decidió continuar con sus estudios para poder terminar su carrera e incrementar sus beneficios económicos. Sus padres lo apoyan con la vivienda y parte de su alimentación es por eso que cuenta con tiempo para estudiar. Como parte de sus materiales de estudio, le hace falta una computadora portátil y libros. Su sueño es terminar pronto sus carrera y devolver el apoyo y el cariño que sus padres con mucho esfuerzo le dan.
Es por esos motivos que Eliseo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y libros para terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Eliseo is a single 28 year old man with no children. He works as a production manager in a paper plant. He is intelligent, optimistic, patient, responsible, consistent and very hard-working.He works in ‘Av Chacaltaya’ which is an industrial zone which has industries and factories of all kinds. Eliseo is brown-skinned with short black hair and medium stature. His native tongue is Spanish and he knows Aymara from his family's inheritance.

At his work he is in charge of the coordination and supervision of operations inside the company so that it functions optimally. He started out as a worker while he was studying to be a Senior Technician in Production and with the years has be promoted to be the boss.

He decided to continue his studies to finish his degree and increase his economic benefits. His parents support him with housing and part of his food and because of this he has time to study. He doesn't have the laptop and books which form part of his study materials. His dream is to finish his degree quickly and return the support and love that his parents with much effort have given him. For these reasons Eliseo is requesting a loan to buy a laptop and books to complete his studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and books to finish his studies.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. De 65 años de edad casado con 12 hijos que sustentar y 5 de ellos ya tienen familias apartes y 7 son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que Francisco realiza es el cultivo de cafe para luego venderlas por quintales en el mercado de su comunidad, para poder obtener un ingreso económico par el y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 30 años y sí deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que el le dará el crédito es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos e orgánicos ya que por medio de ello el puede obtener cosechas de cafe de la mejor y así tener mejores ventas en la comunidad donde el la vende. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de Francisco es la siembra de 5 cuerdas de cafe para poder realizar ventas muchas más grandes con las que ahora realiza y tener un ingreso económico para la reparación de su casa.
texts.en:
This land has been blessed by hands that enjoy working and caring for it.  It’s a dignified line of work that men have been doing for years and for life.  Land without the work of the farmers does not provide the fruits that support a whole generation.  At age 65, with 12 children to support; five of them with families and seven in the local school, Francisco raises coffee to sell by the quintal in the local market, in order to obtain an income so he can improve his family’s living conditions.  He has been doing this for 30 years and it provides a good income.

He will use the money from this loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers so he can have a better coffee harvest and sales in the community.  One of Fransisco’s grand aspirations is to be able to make many larger sales and to have an income with which to repair his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José de 61 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente acompañado y vive solo junto con a su pareja que se dedica a los cuidos del hogar. Con su actual pareja no tiene hijos, pero con otras señoras procreo en  total de 7 hijos.

José es un hombre de campo, desde pequeño sus padres le transmitieron el conocimiento de la agricultura, oficio que viene realizando por muchos años. Los cultivos se encuentran a 10 minutos caminando desde su casa y los recorre diariamente para ir a trabajar.

El préstamo será utilizado en la reparación de su vehículo que ya le empieza a dar algunos problemas técnicos. 
José sueña con ver a su comunidad  progresar y en lo personal con ampliar su casita para vivir mejor junto con su compañera de vida
texts.en:
José, 61 years old, is a very hardworking person. He studied up until high school. He is happy in a relationship, living alone with his partner who does the housework. With his current partner he does not have any children but with other women he has had a total of 7 children. 

José is a man of the land. Since he was little, his parents passed on to him their knowledge of agriculture, a trade he has been practicing for many years now. The crops are 10 minutes from his house on foot and he makes the journey daily to work.

The loan will be used to repair his vehicle, which has begun giving him some technical problems. José dreams of seeing his community progress, and in his personal life, of expanding his house to have a better life with his life partner.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle, which has begun giving him some technical problems.

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en: Sikola is 39 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 11 years. Sikola needs a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, fertilizer, crops, boots and overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Sikola will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, fertilizer, crops, boots and overalls.

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en: Fotu is 50 years old and unmarried with 2 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 11 years. Fotu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, boots, a spade, a machete and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Fotu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, boots, a spade, a machete and a crowbar.

loans.name: Uai

texts.en: Uai is 51 years old and married with 9 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 4 years. Uai needs a loan to buy canned items, frozen goods, soft drinks, snacks and a new display fridge. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy canned items, frozen goods, soft drinks, snacks and a new display fridge.

loans.name: Luafitu

texts.en: Luafitu is 42 years old and unmarried with no children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Luafitu needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Luafitu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Miliama

texts.en:
Miliama is 34 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 8 years. Miliama needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, a machete, new gum boots and a spade. 

Miliama has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Miliama will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, a machete, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 29 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. Lina needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Taume

texts.en:
Taume is a 46-year-old woman who is married, with nine children. She has a lawn-mowing business which caters to all her village clients. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Taume needs a loan to buy a pickup truck for transportation, lawn mower parts, petrol, boots, safety glasses, and three new lawn mowers. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Taume joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a pickup truck for transportation, lawn mower parts, petrol, boots, safety glasses, and three new lawn mowers.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en: Saili is a 27-year-old married woman with 1 child. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Saili needs a loan to buy pies, sandwiches, soft drinks, a boiler, coffee, coffee mugs and donuts. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Saili has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy pies, sandwiches, soft drinks, a boiler, coffee, coffee mugs and donuts.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 23-year-old unmarried woman with 3 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Lilian needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lilian has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, chinese candy and foam cups.

loans.name: Leu

texts.en: Leu is a 53-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Leu needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Leu has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda busies herself with her hobby of gardening, a source of both pleasure and income. At the age of 64 and married, she works to provide sufficiently for the family. 

Having availed herself of the opportunity to become a member of Paglaum MPC, Erlinda credits the cooperative for the capital supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Erlinda hopes to become a supplier of vegetables to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 57, married and in Liloy, he runs a store with his wife that primarily supports their family. He never gets tired tending his store everyday. Pablito is a full fledged member of PMPC, and has taken several loans already. He religiously paid his obligations without records of default. 

Now he borrowed another loan to pay for an inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo landed at the right place for his needed capital when he joined PMPC. He knew this would be his last chance to get back on his feet when he went broke after his first business went bad. PMPC to Lorenzo came as a rescue, for lending him money when he needed it the most. 

Now, he availed another loan for the next cropping season. He borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. 

Lorenzo perseveres, and always believes in reaching his goals to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is a farmer from Sibutad. She primarily supports her family through her farming activities. She signed up for her membership with PMPC for  capitalization she needed. Susie feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. 

Susie wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never  tires in her efforts to support her family. 

Recently, Alicia requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. In addition to her project of constructing concrete pig pens, Alicia is considering increasing the number of pigs offered for commercial sale. 

Alicia hopes to someday open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase  bags of animal feed

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar Antonio tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí; él goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cesar Antonio se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores, tales como patos, gallinas, pollos y cuyes, desde hace más de 5 años de antigüedad en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su propio domicilio. Él solicita préstamo para la compra de animales (patos, gallinas, conejos, pavos, entre otros) y alimento de engorde para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, aumentando y diversificando su stock, para poder atender los diferentes gustos de su público consumidor; y de esta manera obtener más ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar Antonio is 42 years old, and is in a relationship. He lives with his wife and two children in a small community in the rural part of the district of Cayaltí. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors. His community is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

Cesar Antonio works raising and selling small animals like ducks, chickens and guinea pigs. He has been in this business for more than 5 years and his business is located at the rear of his house.

He is requesting the loan to buy animals (ducks, chickens, rabbits, turkeys amongst others) and feed to fatten them. In this way he can expand his business increasing and diversifying his stock and satisfy the different tastes of the buying public. He will have more revenue, improve his profits and in the end improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar Enrique tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Cesar Enrique se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, cuenta con una moto lineal la cual le sirve para transportarse y así poder realizar sus labores de la mejor manera; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que esta ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de moto y equipos diversos que utiliza para brindar sus servicios y le sirven para poder desempeñarse en sus labores cotidianas; dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Cesar Enrique is 41 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his family in a rural area in the district of Oyotun, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, north coast of Peru. His community works primarily on agriculture, cattle raising and commerce. 

Cesar Enrique works as a day laborer, using his own tools. He has a motorcycle that is his means of transportation and allows him to carry out his job more efficiently. He has more than 10 years of experience in this business, which is located at his home. He is requesting this loan for the maintenance of his motorcycle and other equipment that he uses to provide his services and to carry out his daily tasks. This investment will allow him to improve the condition of his equipment and tools, which would have a positive impact on his business. He hopes to increase the productivity of his business and thus better tend to the various needs of his customers in the region.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle and other equipment he uses to provide his services and to carry out his daily tasks.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar se gana la vida como profesor rural, una profesion sacrificada por que debe recorrer grandes distancias para ir al trabajo y a su casa. Edgar es casado y quiere un credito para terminar la obra fina de un habitacion que quiere dar en alquiler, de esa manera tendra un ingreso extra que le permita darle mejor vida a su esposa y a sus tres hijos con los que vive en El Alto
texts.en: Edgar makes his living as a rural teacher, a profession that has it's sacrifices as you have to cover large distances to get from work to your house. Edgar is married and wants a loan to complete the finishing work on a room that he wants to rent out. In this way he will have an additional income which will allow him to provide a better life for his wife and three children with whom he lives in El Alto.

loans.use: to complete the finishing touches on a room he wants to rent out.

loans.name: Keneya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KENEYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 58 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kofra Bamana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de vanne.
Les femmes du groupe KENEYA sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente N’DIA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de vanne. Elle compte acheter des vannes sur place. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Massigui à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group KENEYA is composed of married women, who average 58 years of age and six children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Kofra Bamana,, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains and basketry. 

The women of the group KENEYA are on their 23rd solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, N’DIA, the person standing first from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of baskets and the like. She intends to purchase some basketry locally. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Massigui. She plans on making a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase basketry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda lives in Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines with her husband and two children. Her husband has no permanent work. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand & snacks to their neighbors. Leonarda joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her business, in April of 2010. She became a MIGS (member in good standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 14,900 PHP to buy additional raw ingredients for food and snack vending. She hopes that her business will continue and someday she will own a fast food restaurant.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for food and snack vending

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza makes a living through her farming activities. She sells her own produce through her vegetable store, and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access of capital. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. 

Annaliza hopes to sustain her business, and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Atenidora

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Atenidora learned about Paglaum MPC and availed loans for her farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having entrusted her with the money she used in her business. 

Recently, Atenidora requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is 62 years old, married with three children, and lives at Cangmalag, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she raises pigs in their backyard, while her husband is a carpenter. Raising pigs is a good business. Aside from having earnings, she also enjoyed doing it. Felixberta is in her third year with PMPC. 

Now she requests a loan of 4,500PHP to buy additional heads of piglets, animal feed, and vitamins. 

She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of piglets, animal feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her buy and sell business. She has been operating her own buy and sell business for years, and she earns well from this. She also has a variety store, and she sustains all her needs through this. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Edna would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to display and sell in her store. With PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Edna hopes that her business will continue to cover their everyday needs and expenditures. She also wants good health and a happy life for her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana and she has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her businesses. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for eight years and she earns a good living from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income and that is why aside from her variety store, she also manages a tailoring and computer shop business.

To improve sales, Ana would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Ana dreams to have another branch for her computer shop business. She also hopes to be always good looking and fit for work even at her age, and that her children will likewise finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been pig fattening  for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her
family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rene Alexander

texts.es:
