Rene de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, es hombre soltero y vive solo junto con su madre.

Desde pequeño a Rene le ha gustado conducir vehículos y fue ya cuando alcanzó la mayoría de edad que decidió trabajar transportando personas en un taxi, lleva ya 10 años dedicándose a esto y espera seguirlo haciendo por mucho tiempo.


El préstamo será utilizado en la reparación del taxi y el resto será utilizado en la reparación del techo, pues presenta algunas goteras y es necesario repararlo.

Rene sueña con seguir  trabajando en su taxi y un futuro tener su propia empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Rene, 34 years old, is a very hardworking person. He studied up until high school. He is a single man, living alone with his mother.

Since he was little Rene has enjoyed driving vehicles and when he became old enough he decided to work transporting people in a taxi. He has been working at this for 10 years and hopes to continue doing it for a long time.

The loan will be used to repair the taxi. What's left will be used to fix the roof, which has some leaks and is in need of repair.

Rene dreams of continuing to work in his taxi and to have his own transportation business in the future.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and what is left will be used to fix the roof, which has some leaks and is in need of repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires and do maintenance work to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Her name is Annaliza, 30, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, a security guard, and they have four children. The eldest is in college, two are in high school and the other one is already working. She manages her household while operating the business.  She works hard to augment their income to help meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Annaliza operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. 

She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God, and you, in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Annaliza hopes to have a bigger store to grow her business so she could send all her school children to college.  She dreams to give them a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Her name is Priscila, 59, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a farmer, and they have four children. Three are already married, and their youngest is still in high school. She manages her own household while operating the business.  She works hard to augment their income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Priscila operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns income from the farm of vegetables that her husband works on. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business.  She is thanking God, and you, in advance for the financial help that will be given her.
 
Priscila hopes to be able to grow her business and improve her store so she could send her youngest to college. She prays to live long and stay healthy.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 58 years old and married with seven children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loading.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old, married, and a resident of Songculan, Siquijor, Philippines. 

Juliet operates a 'sari-sari' (small grocery) business, with a starting capitalization of PHP 4,000. Juliet applied her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) last February 2013 and had her first loan to start her business. She was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and she enjoys the benefit given by PMPC. 

Now Juliet is applying for PHP 10,000 to restock inventories for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Iniciativa Group

texts.es:
"Iniciativa" es el nombre del grupo conformado por 6 mujeres trabajadoras, responsables y amables. El nombre del grupo hace referencia a la iniciativa de cada una de ellas al emprender su propio negocio.

La localidad donde se encuentra el grupo está rodea por cerros. Muy cerca se puede encontrar una cascada y detrás de la cortina de agua la entrada a una cueva donde hay algunas pinturas rupestres. A este mágico lugar siempre acceden los visitantes en compañía de algún experto y el equipo adecuado. La cueva tiene sólo una salida que lleva justo a la comunidad donde se formó el grupo Iniciativa. 

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:

Marcela-Servicio De Taxi
Eusebia-Venta De Comida
Elodia- Papelería
Josefina-Venta De Comida 
Diana-Venta De Tacos, Refrescos
María-Servicio De Taxi

Elodia está casada con el señor Leonardo quien se dedica al servicio de taxi. Desde hace ya dos años doña Elodia estableció  en casa una papelearía, para ello adecuó un cuarto amplio; además, en el mismo local vende regalos y algunos otros artículos. Elodia comenta que ha notado su negocio crecer poco a poco y a pesar de que sus ventas no son tan significantes, la papelería es rentable. Con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos, hace siete meses Elodia también inició a vender tacos los fines de semana. Sus ganancias las invierte en los gastos de educación de una de sus hijas que aunque ya es mayor de edad aún cuenta con su apoyo. Asimismo compra más insumos para seguir preparando tacos y más artículos para su papelería. 

Elodia quiere invertir su préstamo en hojas de color, alambre, floratec, papel celofán, diurex, unicel, cera, papel florete y hojas para corona pues es lo que más buscan sus clientes de las localidades mas cercanas. La mayoría de los clientes ya se está preparando para crear sus coronas para los festejos de la celebración del Día de Muertos de principios de noviembre. 

*En la imagen: La señora Elodia viste blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
“Initiative” is the name of a group composed of six hard-working, responsible, and likable women. The group name refers to the initiative each one takes to advance her own business.

The locality where the group is based is surrounded with hills. Very near there you will find a cascade and behind the curtain of water, the entrance to a cave containing some cave paintings. Visitors, usually accompanied by an expert and adequate equipment, often access the site. The cave has just one exit and that leads to the community where the Initiative Group was formed.

The group members and their activities are: Marcela (taxi service), Eusebia (selling meals), Elodia (a paper shop), Josefina (selling meals), Diana (selling tacos and soft drinks), and Maria (taxi service).

Elodia is married to Leonardo who drives a taxi. Two years ago, Elodia established a shop in her home that sells paper products. It occupies a large room. In addition, her store sells gifts and some other articles. Elodia says she has seen her business grow little by little and despite the fact that her sales are not so significant, the paper shop is profitable. With the object of increasing her income, seven months ago Elodia also began selling tacos on weekends. Her earnings are invested in the educational expenses of one of her daughters, who, despite the fact that she is now an adult, still depends on her mother's help. Additionally, Elodia wishes to purchase more inputs in order to continue preparing tacos and to supply other articles for her paper shop.

Elodia wants to invest her loan in a variety of colored paper products sought by customers from her locality to make decorations, including crowns, for popular celebrations of the Day of the Dead. The majority of her customers are preparing to create these crowns for festive events celebrating the Day of the Dead at the beginning of November. 

*In the photo, Elodia is sporting a red blouse.

loans.use: buy sheets of colored paper of a variety of types to sell for making decorations such as crowns to celebrate the very popular Day of the Dead in November.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Construyendo el país de la eterna primavera y del desarrollo, Roberto de 55 años de edad casado con 8 hijos 6 de ellos ya tienen familias separadas  y los 2 últimos son excelentes  estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, los hijos de Roberto se han vuelto para el  más grande reto para el ya que tiene que hacer el esfuerzo de luchar por su familia cada día para darles un buen futuro y educación a su hijos.

La actividad principal de el es la albañilería en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender a construir casas de su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 8 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la compra de herramientas de construcción en la albañilería ya que es de importancia para el y sin esas herramientas el no podrá trabajar para seguir construyendo en su comunidad.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de Roberto es ver crecer a su hijo y darle educación para que llegue a ser un profesional y poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Roberto is helping to build the country of eternal spring and development. He is 55 years old, married and has 8 children. 6 of his children already have their own families and the two youngest are excellent students in his community's school. His children have become his biggest challenge, as he has to struggle every day to provide them with an education and a prosperous future.

His main occupation is construction in the community where he lives. When he has a child, he decided to learn to build homes. He has had this occupation for 8 long years of sacrifice, but he has done it with great pride as his work provides an income to satisfy the needs of his family and helps develop the community where he lives. The purpose of the loan is to buy construction tools, as this is of great importance to him. Without those tools, he won't be able to work to continue building his community. One of Roberto's biggest dreams is to see his son grow up and give him an education so that he becomes a professional. He also dreams of starting a construction company to help with his community's future development.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona lives in Ijevan town with her parents, her retired grandmother and her 7-year-old child. 
She is a pharmacist by profession and works at a local pharmacy. Besides her work, she also runs her family farm which includes two piglets, calves and hens as well as an arable land where different types of fruits and vegetables are grown (corn, potatoes, plums, nuts, apples and pears). 
Sona works hard to sustain her family's standard of living and supports her father, who works in construction, to cover daily costs. 
The requested loan of (USD) $1,500 is very important for Sona to enlarge her livestock by two oxen. She will be very grateful if lenders support funding her loan and give her an opportunity to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SÉRIEUX est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de charbons et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe SÉRIEUX sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente N’GNA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte acheter des sacs de mil sur place. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group SÉRIEUX is composed of married women, who average 44 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Warassala,, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiment, charcoal, and general merchandise. 

The women of the group SÉRIEUX are on their 23rd solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, N’GNA, the person standing first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of grains. She intends to purchase sacks of millet locally. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at surrounding market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, 36, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Joseph, a tricycle driver, and has three children, two in high school and one in the elementary Level.  She works hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Sabina operates a variety store and she also operates a tricycle unit.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that the loan and expanded inventory will help boost her income. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Sabina hopes to be able to grow her business and give her family a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Shogher

texts.en:
Shogher lives in Yenoqavan village with her big family which includes her retired parents-in-law, husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 
Shogher's family owns a big and beautiful farm where they raise livestock, including cows, calves, pigs and hens, as well as cultivate wheat, corn, potatoes, plums, apples and pears. 
Shogher's in-laws keep the animals in the mountains. To be able to invest in their farm, Shogher has requested this loan of (USD) $3,000. She asks lenders to support her in purchasing forage for the livestock and also to purchase a car needed for the farm. As this is Shogher's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock and to purchase a car needed for the farm

loans.name: Nori Belen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nori Belen works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Nori Belen is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer and farm supplies for her rice business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Nori Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Geraldine works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending.  Geraldine is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish for her dried fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 52 years old and married with five children, two in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Catalina has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Catalina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 59 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Margarita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Margarita has been farming vegetables for nine years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 65 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Nelly has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains and raising chickens.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Merizol

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Merizol works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Merizol is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her fish business.

Merizol has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Dan has been working as a plumber for more than 30 years. Starting in construction as a young man, he accepted an offer from a neighbor to take some plumbing “service calls” when business in the construction industry slowed down. He quickly found he had a knack for that line of work, so as soon as he was able, Dan decided to open up his own plumbing business.

As he has grown his business to employ three part-time workers, Dan’s plumbing company is part of the small business job engine that drives much of the economic activity in this country. He enjoys the freedom of working for himself, the control he is able to exert over the quality of his work, and the knowledge that his attention to detail results in complete customer satisfaction.

The biggest challenge to his business thus far has been in acquiring capital. Dan will use his Kiva loan money to purchase a much-needed trailer and build a reserve fund in order to cover payroll and operating costs when cash flow is slow.

In the future, Dan hopes to grow his business so that he no longer has to worry about taking out loans to cover working capital. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, there is little doubt that Dan will achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase a much-needed trailer and build a reserve fund in order to cover payroll and operating costs when cash flow is slow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina-coura de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 46 anset ont au moins 6enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que,Fruits et Légumes, Tubercules et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe.
Koniba est un membre du groupe Tièssiri,arrêtée2ème de gauche à droite, vendeuse de Fruits et Légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Fruits et Légumes (Choux Pommes, Goyaves,) en quantité et en qualité au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Tièssiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Koniba compte réaliser  175 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Tièssiri is a group of women from the Medina-coura district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 46 years of age and have at least six children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as fruit & vegetables, tubers, and more. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are now on their 11th group loan. 

Koniba, a member of the group Tièssiri, is standing second from the left in the photo. She is a vendor of fruit & vegetables. She intends to use her loan to purchase quality fruit & vegetables (cabbage, potatoes, guava) in quantity over time. She sells the goods at the retail level to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the market. 

While the other members of the group Tièssiri plan on making an average profit of 165,000 francs CFA each over the course of the cycle, Ms. Koniba plans on making 175,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a private entrepreneur from the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and son. 

Anna runs a small store selling different types of fruits and vegetables. Anna's husband supports her very much in running her small business. To be able to run the business in a more sustainable way, and to become more competitive, Anna needs a loan of $2,000. This will allow her to purchase new stock and supplies of fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of fruits and vegetables for her retail business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre profesional, es  graduado de técnico en contaduría pública, está felizmente casado, su esposa labora junto con él en la oficina contable que tiene en su propia vivienda. Tienen un niño de 12 años de edad.

Pedro posee un negocio familiar, él es el encargado de los trabajos principales y su esposa es su secretaria y fiel compañera. Tienen ya 12 años de tener la oficina, han prosperado y creado fama como profesional. Además es pastor de una iglesia.

El préstamo solicitado es para arreglar el techo de la casa, comprara lamina, clavos, la vez anterior solicito un crédito para reparar el techo, pero hoy nuevamente se le ha dañado por la lluvia. 

Pedro sueña con seguir ejerciendo su profesión e ir creciendo en éste ámbito de modo que pudiese llegar a tener una oficina contable en el centro de la ciudad. También le gustaría seguir predicando el nombre de Dios.
texts.en:
Pedro is a professional who graduated as a Public Accounting technician. He is happily married and his wife works with him in the accounting office that they have in their house. They have a 12 year old son. Pedro runs a family business. He is in charge of the principal work and his wife is his secretary and faithful companion. He has been in this business for 12 years and has prospered and gained a reputation as a professional. He is also a minister of a church.

The loan he is requesting is to repair the roof of his house buying laminated sheeting and nails. His last loan was to repair the roof, but today it is once again damaged by the rains. Pedro dreams of continuing his profession and continue to grow in this field so that be can have an accounting office in the center of the city. He also wants to continue preaching the word of God.

loans.use: to buy laminate sheeting, and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 54 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 4 hijos 3 niñas de 17, 16 y 12 años de edad y un varón de 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos por el mismo apoyándose en su taller de mecánica industrial el cual posee desde hace 10 años y lo que le ha permitido sostener la economía familiar. Tomas siempre busca la manera de darles lo mejor que está en sus manos a sus hijos y es por ello que desea construir dos corredores en su vivienda, por lo que  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina y hierro para construir dos corredores en su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde distraerse y él poder seguir realizando sus trabajos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Tomas, age 54, lives in his own house with his four children.  He has three girls, ages 17, 16, and 12, and an 11 year old boy.  He is a man who, thanks to his effort and tenacity, has managed to get his children ahead by supporting himself with his industrial mechanic’s shop.  He has had the shop for ten years.  It has allowed him to financially support his family.

Tomas is always looking for the way to give his children the best of everything that he can.

Therefore, he wishes to build two hallways in his house.  That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, and iron in order to build two hallways in his house.  He will do this so that the children have a place to entertain themselves, and he will be able to continue doing his work at his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, and iron.

loans.name: Maming

texts.en:
Maming is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc for her general store business.

Maming has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Maming has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Roda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Roda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Roda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is an agronomist from the village of Mrgavet in the Ararat region. She lives with her two sons. Anush is an army officer, but to be able to meet the everyday needs of the family, she is also engaged in cultivation of melon and different types of fruit trees (plum, nut and figs). Her sons help her a lot in selling the agricultural produce in the market. 

As life gets more expensive, the family's everyday costs are also increasing. Anush now needs to improve the greenhouse, where she organizes the cultivation work. A loan of USD 3000 will be a great support to Anush and her family, helping them to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, fertilizer for land cultivation, and to build one more greenhouse. This will give them more opportunities to develop their agricultural business. 

As this is Anush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her greenhouse, fertilizer for land cultivation, and to build one more greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: doors and windows for her household.

loans.name: Maira De Los Santos

texts.es: Maira de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 12 años a la venta de cócteles de conchas y camarones, su negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos los cuales ya trabajan y el ayudan en los gastos del hogar, Maira esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de conchas y camarones por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maira is 44 years old and she has been selling shell and shrimp cocktails since she was 12 years old. Her business has allowed her to support her family. She lives in her own house along with her three children; they all work and support home expenses. 

Maira is requesting a loan to purchase shells and shrimp in bulk since this is the only source of work and it generates sizable profits.

loans.use: to purchase shells and shrimp in bulk.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Ameyo femme de 49ans a en charge 04enfants et pour mari un pasteur. Elle est gérante de pressing et cela depuis 2010. Elle se fait aidée par 02 personnes et désire acheter une machine à laver c'est pour cela Améyo fait sa seconde demande. Elle espère épargner pour ouvrir une seconde boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Ameyo, a 49-year-old woman, has four children to support, and her husband is a pastor. She has been the manager of a laundry business since 2010. She is helped by two persons and wishes to purchase a washing machine. For this reasons, she is making a second loan request. She hopes to save money to open a second shop and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. He worked as a driver, then as a worker at the Kapan combine, but now he is in trading business and at the city’s wholesale market at the rented stall, he sells various things; such as farmers’ boots, slippers, sneakers, and shoes for men, women and children. Azat is not alone in his business since his wife helps him very much when Azat goes to bring new merchandise for his stall. 

Azat has three children; his two sons are married and they live with their families. His daughter is divorced and lives with them with her little child. Azat thinks that his business would be more profitable if he could enlarge his stall’s assortment. 

He is asking for this loan in the amount of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy new merchandise for his stall which will be suited to the season and bring in some more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for his stall

loans.name: Meludgen

texts.en:
Meludgen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Meludgen has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Meludgen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Jaqueiline

texts.en:
Like many small businesses, Jacqueline’s soap making venture started as a hobby. However, as time moved on, it became clear that her craft was much more like a calling, as evidenced by the clamoring of friends and family to commercialize her soap-making operation.

After gathering the necessary equipment, Jacqueline then secured funding and a prime location in the vibrant Ocean Beach community in San Diego, California to open her own retail location. She quickly fell in love with the creativity involved in soap-making, and found a great deal of satisfaction in the idea that selling her natural soaps was akin to spreading her own personal brand of joy throughout the community.

As a young entrepreneur, Jacqueline faced several challenges including writing a business plan, planning inventory purchases and other expenses, and building an active client base using word of mouth and other marketing methods. Not one to be deterred, she soldiered on and now is in a better position than ever to grow her business into a self-sustaining profit engine.

Jacqueline will use her Kiva loan to purchase supplies for the holiday season including inventory, mugs, and other promotional items. She will also use part of her loan to renovate and decorate her shop’s front window. 

With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Jacqueline will help us progress toward a better-smelling world.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the holiday season including inventory, mugs, and other promotional items, as well as to renovate and decorate her shop’s front window.

loans.name: Geghecik

texts.en:
Geghecik is a young agronomist from the village of Abovyan in the Ararat region. She lives with her only daughter who is 27 years old. 

Geghecik runs a farm and is also engaged in dried fruit production. She cultivates tomatoes and grows different types of fruit trees (peach, cherry, fig, nut and apple). 

Things are getting more expensive day by day, and Geghecik needs to enlarge their agricultural business to be able to cover their expenses. That is why Geghecik needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase nut seeds for cultivation. This is her first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF which provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit before, because they have no credit history. 

Geghecik and her daughter will be very thankful to their lenders for their goodwill in helping them to maintain and develop their agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for nut seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Veuve de 45ans, madame Adjowa est mère de 06 enfants. Seul le plus jeune de 16ans est scolarisé. Elle revend en plus de la nourriture(riz et du haricot) des condiments(tomate, détergents...) à la devanture de son domicile et cela depuis 2001. Son second crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises. Le profit lui permettra de contribuer à améliorer la vie de la famille et d'augmenter la taille de l'activité.
texts.en: Ms. Adjowa, a 45-year-old widow, is a mother of six children, of whom only the oldest, aged 16, is in school. Ms. Adjowa has been selling condiments (tomatoes, detergents,…), as well as food (rice and beans), in front of her home since 2001. Her second loan will enable her to stock up on merchandise. The profit will enable her to help improve her family’s living conditions and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and beans and some condiments

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, con ayuda del préstamo anterior ha mantenido su venta de frutas verduras muy surtida para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, obteniendo así más clientes satisfechos y mejores ganancias, actualmente tiene un buen record crediticio, mantiene el mismo núcleo familiar y ha logrado amueblar su hogar dando así a su familia una vida más cómoda.
Con el tiempo las demandas son mayores y cree que debe aumentar el inventario para mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes, por lo que nuevamente solicita capital para comprar anonas, limones, papayas, papas, tomates, manzanas, guineos, etc., seguirá ofreciendo productos frescos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, with the support of a previous loan, has continued selling assorted fruits and vegetables to cover the demand she has from her clients, this had made her clients satisfied and has resulted in greater profits. She currently has a good credit rating, she has the same family and she has managed to furnish her home thus providing a more comfortable life for her family.

With time the demand has increased and she believes she must increase her inventory to maintain the loyalty of her customers; this is why she is requesting once again a loan to purchase anona fruit, lemons, papayas, potatoes, tomatoes, apples, bananas, etc. She will continue offering fresh produce to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase anona fruit, lemons, papayas, potatoes, tomatoes, apples, bananas, etc. She will continue offering fresh produce to her customers, such as yucca, radishes and others.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 42 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Joy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and coffee. Joy has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and coffee.

loans.name: Bububatima

texts.ru: Бубубатима успешно погасила свой предыдущий кредит и использовала его по назначению. Она очень благодарна всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бубубатимы есть 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель и 20 овец. На собственном земельном наделе мерою 3,00 ГА она выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход Бубубатимы составляет 11,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух коров для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Бубубатима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она также хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Bububatima successfully repaid her previous loan and have used it as intended. She is very grateful to everyone who has helped her with the financing. Today, Bububatima' business consists of  2 dairy cows, 1 heifer and 20 sheep. She also grows clover on her own 3.00 hectares of land. Bububatima's monthly income amounts to 11,600 som (KGS). In order to further grow her business, Bububatima requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount and milk volume. Bububatima plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and also wants to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount and milk volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a basic sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Rosa Irma

texts.es:
Rosa de 70 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive sola junto con dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, hace 5 meses su esposo murió y la dejo sola con sus hijos.

Rosa se dedica a los cuidados del hogar, mientras que sus hijos trabajan en el campo, todos los días de sol a sol. Teniendo que recorrer grandes distancias hasta llegar al terreno donde realizaran todas sus actividades agrícolas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar semilla, herbicidas, pesticidas para el cultivo de maíz. 

Rosa Sueña con que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser personas respetadas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 70, did not have the chance to go to school.  She lives alone with her two children, who work in agriculture.  Her husband died five months ago, and he left her alone with their children.

Rose devotes herself to the household chores while her children work in the field.  They do this every day from sunrise to sunset.  They have to travel large distances to get to the land where they do all of their agricultural activities.

The loan will be used to buy seeds, herbicides, and pesticides for the corn crop.

Rosa dreams of her children succeeding and becoming respected people in their community.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicides, and pesticides for the corn crop.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: Nuevo horizonte, es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedora, y coordinado por la señora Adriana, quien tiene la edad de 40 años, casada y propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace dieciséis años, la principal clientela son propietaria de tramos en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tela, entre tela, dacron, cinta de mantequilla, etc., con los créditos en esta institución ha podido cubrir más la demanda que tiene de estos productos. Las otras socias son las señoras, María Concepción quien tiene la edad de 64 años y se dedica a la venta de leña y nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace doce años, y Cándida de 47 años de edad, comerciante de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace doce años.
texts.en:
Nuevo Horizonte is a consolidated group comprising three entrepreneurial women. The group is coordinated by Adriana, who is 40 years old, married, and who owns a tailoring workshop in her residence. She began this business sixteen years ago, her clientele comprises shop owners in the municipality’s market. 
She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric; Dacron fabric, ribbons, etc. The loans have allowed the group to cover the great demand that exists for these products. 
The other partners are Maria Concepcion, who is 64 years old and has been selling firewood and nacatamales in her home for over two years and Candida, who is 47 years old and has been selling fruit at the municipality’s market for over two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as fabric.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru:
Фаризе 39 лет. У нее среднее образование. На протяжении 5 лет Фариза занимается животноводством. Она разводит коров и быков при дворе своего дома. Фариза живет в городе Турсунзаде с мужем, детьми и отцом. Ее муж в настоящий момент находится на заработках в России, как и многие мужчины ее города. Он не нашел в городе хорошо оплачиваемую работу и поэтому вынужден был покинуть семью и работать в чужой стране. 
Фариза справляется с животноводческим бизнесом вместе с отцом, дети тоже помогают после учебы. Сейчас она хотелы бы увеличить доходность бизнеса и для этого ей нужно увеличить поголовье скота. Фариза запрашивает кредит для купли нескольких голов бычков. Ваша поддержка ей очень необходима для улучшения финансового положения семьи.
texts.en:
Fariza is 39 years old. She has a secondary education. Fariza has been involved in animal husbandry for 5 years. She raises cows and bulls in the backyard of her home. Fariza lives in the town of Tursun-zoda with her husband, children and father. Her husband currently works in Russia, just like many men in her town. He could not find well-paid work in the town and was, thus, forced to leave his family and work in a foreign country.

Fariza runs the animal husbandry business together with her father, and the children help as well after school. Now, she wants to increase the business profitability and needs to increase her livestock headcount. Fariza is requesting this loan to buy several bulls. Your support is truly necessary to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy several bulls

loans.name: Valya

texts.en:
Valya is a farmer with 10 years of experience. She lives in the Brnakot village of Syunik region with her husband and 20-year-old son. Her husband is an army officer, and her son helps Valya with daily farming activities.They keep 6 sheep and hens and also cultivate potatoes.

The requested loan of 2,200 USD will help Valya and her farming business to purchase 13 sheep and forage for feeding the livestock. She asks lenders to support her farm and help her to make this investment.

loans.use: to pay for 13 sheep and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 25 años. Ella es una mujer con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y de superarse y es por ello que se esfuerza todos los días trabajando como vendedora de pan, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en los cantones cercanos a su localidad. Blanca en su afán de tener mejores condiciones de vida, ha estado construyendo su vivienda, y actualmente solo le falta instalar puertas y ventanas como se puede observar en la fotografía, y es por ello que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas y ventanas para instalarlas en su vivienda.
texts.en: Blanca is 52 years old and has lived in her own home for 25 years. She is a woman with a desire to improve her quality of life, and be successful, which is why we works hard every day as a bread vendor. She has worked in this business for the past two years in the cantones near her. Blanca, in her desire to have better living conditions, has been building her house, and now she just needs to install doors and windows, as you can see in the photograph. This is why she decided to request a loan through FUSAI, to buy doors and windows to install in her home.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows to install in her home.

loans.name: Thilieta

texts.en: Thieleta is 44 years old. She is married with one kid. Thieleta is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, she has been running a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan through ASKI to buy additional vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an agronomist from Davit Bek village, Syunik region. She lives with her retired parents-in-law, husband, and 13-year-old son. Her husband is a taxi driver and Susanna herself runs their family farm and takes care of the household.

She, as a typical hard working Armenian woman, is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in beekeeping.

The gathered honey and other agricultural products are sold by Susanna's husband in the local markets. This is the important source of income for the family, which is the reason Susanna would like to enlarge it. She asks for this loan of 2,695 USD to purchase seven calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for seven calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 33 years old and married, with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

Erma has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell ready-to-wear.

Erma aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Bendición De Dios Group

texts.es:
SANDRA es integrante del grupo "BENDICION DE DIOS" tiene 23 años y es su segundo credito con FODEMI. SANDRA vive con sus 3 hijos de 5-3 y 1 año. su esposo trabaja en la madera (en la montaña - reforestación y corte de arboles.
SANDRA tiene un local de venta de productos cárnicos desde hace mas de 3 años y con este nuevo credito ella comprará carnes de res pollo chancho y ademas implementara la venta de lacteos y embutidos para ampliar sus servicios y brindar variedad a sus vecinos y clientes. 
esta actividad ha sido de gran ayuda al igual que FODEMI porque gracias a estos prestamos- puede pagar los gastos de salud educacion y alimentacion de su familia. brinda la oportunidad de crecer y organizarse como pequeña comerciante.
ella en un corto tiempo desea tener una tercena mas grande y ofrecer toda clase de productos al por mayor. desea llegar a contratar personas que trabajen en su tercena.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the group Bendicion de Dios, she is 23 years old and this is her second loan with FODEMI. Sandra lives with her 3 children, ages 5, 3 and 1. Her husband works with wood (in the mountain; reforestation and cutting trees). 

Sandra has a business that has been selling meat products for over 3 years and with this new loan she will purchase beef, chicken, pork and she will begin selling dairy products and cold meats to broaden her services and provide a variety of products to her neighbors and clients.
This business has been a lot of help, as well as FODEMI support with loans since she can pay for the health, education and feeding expenses of her family. It also provides her with the opportunity to grow and organize as a small business owner. 

She hopes to have, in the short-term, a bigger butcher shop and to offer all kinds of products in bulk. She wishes to hire people who will work in her butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase meat products, chicken, pork and to sell dairy products and cold meat to bra

loans.name: Cristina Tomasa

texts.es: Cristina tiene 27 años de edad está casada y tiene dos hermosos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, joyas de plata y acero. Su familia ha sido su principal apoyo para salir adelante en su pequeño negocio. Dentro de sus metas próximas está mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y brindarles estudio a sus hijas para que logren tener un mejor futuro. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa entre estos: pantalones de mujer y hombre, ropa interior así como cosméticos. Este crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida así como el crecimiento de su negocio. Su plan futuro es establecer una tienda de ropa variada.
texts.en:
Cristina is 27 years old, married and has two beautiful children. She is a saleswoman, for over five years she has been selling clothes, shoes and silver and steel jewelry. Her family has been her greatest support to move ahead with her small business. Her future goals are to improve the infrastructure of her home and to provide schooling for her children so that they can have a better future. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing, including: men and women jeans, underwear as well as cosmetics. This loan will allow her to improve her living conditions, as well as growth of her business. Her future plans are to establish a varied clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing consisting of: men and women jeans, underwear as well as cosmetic products.

loans.name: Carlos Josué

texts.es:
Carlos  de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado. Está casado y padre de uno hijo.

Carlos trabaja en una hacienda ganadera, realizando labores de limpieza y mantenimiento del lugar, ahí llego cuando tenía la edad de tan solo 11 años, se ha crecido junto con su patrón, al que estima como a un padre. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para iniciar la construcción de una casa en su lugar de origen, y de esta manera ir asegurando un futuro para él y su familia. Debido a que en donde viven actualmente, es propiedad de su patrón.

Carlos sueña con llegar a tener una linda casa, para luego en un futuro irse a vivir junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 22, went to school through the ninth grade.  He is married and has one child.  Carlos works on a cattle ranch.  He does cleaning and maintenance jobs there.  He started there when he was only 11 years old.  He has grown up next to his boss, whom he respects like a father.

The loan that he is requesting is to start building a house in the place he is from.  This way he will be assuring a future for himself and his family.  This is because the place they currently live belongs to his boss.

Carlos dreams of coming to have a lovely house so that in the future he will be living together with his family.

loans.use: to start building a house.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 15 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. María es pequeña comerciante de productos varios como: llaveros, portallaveros, etc. es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. María desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda por lo que  solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, hierro, cemento, arena, etc.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her 15-year-old daughter. She is a very hardworking woman who does everything in her power to give her family better living conditions. 

María is a small businesswoman dealing in various products, including keychains, wall-mounted key holders, etc. This is how she earns her living and puts food on the table. 

María would like to build a perimeter wall around her house, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, reinforcing steel, sand, etc.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, reinforcing steel, sand, etc., to build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Angielyn

texts.en:
Angielyn is 40 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Angielyn works very hard to provide for them.  

Angielyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. to sell.   She has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future Angielyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell for her fish business. Estela has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish. Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is from Harij village in the Shirak region. She lives with her parents, and two brothers. Anna and her mother work in the local bakery. Anna, with the help of her family members, is breeding livestock including cows, pigs, calves and hens. They are also cultivating potatoes and barley. Livestock breeding and plant cultivation are very important sources of income for the family. To be able to continue, Anna needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase seeds for land cultivation (wheat, barley and potatoes) and forage for feeding the livestock. Anna has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Anna was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Anna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for land cultivation (wheat, barley and potatoes) and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Sara  Beatriz

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece Sara con su pequeña hija.

Sara  está solicitando un nuevo crédito,  para comprar galletas, golosinas, bebidas, refrescos, pan, embutidos, etc. para vender en la tienda que tienen en conjunto con su madre ubicada en el centro escolar de la comunidad.

con el crédito anterior compro la refrigeradora y le ha dado muy buenos resultados, las ventas han aumentado y con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar la oferta de productos.

Sara sueña con mantener siempre a su familia unida y de esta manera ir progresando para llegar a establecerse económicamente en la comunidad.
texts.en:
In the photo Sara appears with her young daughter. 

Sara is requesting a new loan to purchase cookies, candy, drinks, refreshments, bread, dry meat, etc. to sell in the store that she owns, along with her mother, located in the school in her community. 

With the previous loan she purchased a refrigerator and this has given her very good results; her sales have increased and this new investment will allow her to improve the selection of products she offers. 

Sara dreams of always having a close-knit family, and of moving forward little by little, and succeeding in establishing herself financially in the community.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, candy, drinks, refreshments, bread, dry meat, etc. to sell in the store that she owns along with her mother.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, concrete blocks, and reinforcing steel to build a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Clara De Los Angeles

texts.es: Clara de 36 años de edad se dedica desde hace 4 años posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de habitación, tambien a la venta de tortas y panes, con los que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar,Clara vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, granos basicos, refrescos, golosinas, huevos sopas, etc. para surtir mas la tienda y a si generar mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Clara is 36 years old and for over 4 years she has owned a small store in her place of residence. She also sells cakes and bread; all of her earnings allow her to resolve her home expenses. Clara lives with her family in her own house.
She is requesting a loan to purchase soups, basic grains, refreshments, candy, eggs, etc. to stock her store and as a result, generate more profits.

loans.use: to purchase soups, basic grains, refreshments, candy, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Melanie is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
Liway is 26 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines.  She has been selling charcoal for 5 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Leway requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Liway aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 61 год, замужем, мать 4 детей, образование среднее, работает охранником в школе. Успешно занимаясь животноводством и полеводством, Бактыгул добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 5 коров, 20 овец. Также она арендует земельный надел мерою 2,30 ГА, где выращивает ячмень и люцерну для скота. Ежемесячный доход Бактыгул составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков и 3 телят для дальнейшей перепродажи. На прибыль от кредита Бактыгул планирует и в дальнейшем увеличивать своё хозяйство. На сегодняшний день Бактыгул строит дом и хочет накопить средства на завершение строительства.
texts.en: Baktygul is 61 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and works as a security guard at a school. Successfully involved in animal husbandry and farming, Baktygul has achieved very good results - she has 5 cows and 20 sheep. She also leases a 2.30 hectare land plot, where she grows barley and alfalfa for livestock. Baktygul's monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Baktygul requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 4 bulls and 3 calves for subsequent resale. Baktygul is planning to use the profit from the loan to continue growing her business. Today, Baktygul is building a house and wants to save money to complete the construction.

loans.use: to buy 4 bulls and 3 calves for subsequent resale in order to grow her business and finish building her house

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda lives with her two children in Mantash village in the Shirak region. Her husband is a labor migrant, he has migrated from another area in Armenia to be able to earn a living for the family.  Seda herself takes care of the children and runs their family farm. It includes a cow, 3 calves and some hens. She also cultivates potatoes and carrots and sells the gathered products in the local market.

To improve her farm, Seda needs some investment.  She asked for a loan of USD 800 to be able to purchase forage to feed the livestock. She will be very grateful for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from Getap village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a construction worker and her elder daughter is a seller at the local market.  Marine herself is a farmer. She keeps a farm which includes a cow, calves and hens and cultivates wheat, barley, potatoes and pears. 

Marine is a very hardworking woman who works hard to sustain her family's living.  The requested loan of USD 1500 will be a big support for her farm, enabling her to purchase seeds (potato, barley, wheat) and forage for feeding the livestock. She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: buy seeds and livestock feed

loans.name: Anya

texts.en:
Anya is from Hovtashen village. She works as an accountant in the village municipality hall. Anya's only son is a migrant worker. Anya, besides her work, also runs a farm. She keeps a livestock of pigs, piglets, cows, calves and sheep.  Anya also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes and sells the gathered harvest locally. 

To enlarge her farm, Anya needs some funds for investing in her farm. Anya plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds (wheat, barley and potato). She relies on lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: buy seeds and livestock feed

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is an experienced farmer from Mets Sepasar village. She lives with her husband. 

To be able to cover daily needs, Hermine is engaged in breeding livestock (cow, pig, and sheep), beekeeping and the cultivation of wheat. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of the family's income. Her husband  assists her greatly in everyday activities related to farming. 

Hermine currently needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustained way. She needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase 3 calves and forage for the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Hermine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Hermine  and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for helping the family to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: buy 3 calves and livestock feed

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina lives in Vanadzor town with her 8-year-old twin daughters. Her husband is a labor migrant in a neighboring country. Irina is a musician by profession. She has groups of children and provides them piano classes from her house. The loan that Irina is requesting is very important for her to purchase a PC needed for classes. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Irina relies on lenders' support and hopes for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a PC needed for providing music classes to her students.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: marta de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años, tiene mucha clientela, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maiz por quintales y cal para seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her life partner and her son. She has earned her living by making and selling tortillas for five years. She has many customers, and her business is located in her house in a high-traffic area. With what she earns, she manages to provide for her family. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn by the quintal [46 kilograms] and lime powder in order to continue with her work, which generates a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy lime powder and quintals of corn.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 27ans, 1enfant et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des fruits, des chaussures, des produits divers et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 2èmeprêt solidaire.AWA, 1èrefemmedeboutdela droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires de chaussure en peau, 5 paires de chaussures en cuir et 20 paires de chaussure en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de18 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are, on average, 27 years old and have one child. They all live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou, one of the areas in San/Segou (in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other from family ties. They work selling clothing, fruits, shoes, condiments, and other various goods.

After having correctly repaid their previous loan, the women of the Benkadi group are now on their second loan.

Awa, who is the first woman standing on the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy ten pairs of shoes made of hides, five pairs of leather shoes, and twenty pairs of plastic shoes. She procures her goods from wholesalers in her area. She makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit.

Awa hopes to earn an average monthly income of 18,000 francs CFA which will be used for costs related to health, food, clothing, and school. She will also reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Gyumri town with her husband, parents-in-law and 5-years-old child. Narine's husband and father-in-law are employed in the private sector. Unfortunately their salaries are so low even for basic costs for the family. 

To sustain her family's living, Narine has been engaged in a clothing sales business for already 4 years. Narine sells clothing supplies from her house and also takes it to nearby villages and sells them there. 

Realizing that the profit from this activity is very important for her family, Narine does her best to maximize profits by acquiring goods that are in high demand. Currently, customer demand is for a new and varied stock, for which she needs a loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Narine highly relies on lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is from Kapan town where she lives with her parents. Her brother is married and lives with his family separately. To assist her parents, Meri has been involved in cosmetics sales for 3 years. She receives orders from locals in the town and organizes the sales of cosmetics from her house. Now, by applying for this loan, Meri asks financial support from Kiva lenders to invest in her business. She plans to purchase cosmetics for reselling to her customers. 

Meri has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Meri hopes for enders' support to her business.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Zartar

texts.en:
Zartar, a cook by profession, has been involved in a clothing sales business.  To be financially secure and ensure a stable income for herself Zartar, started up this business six years ago.   She trades with different type of clothing supplies from her house. 

This requested loan is very important for Zartar to invest in her business. She plans to pay for new stock of clothing for her customers. 

Zartar has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos en edades de 11 y 18 años, tiene casa propia; es una persona que ha buscado la manera de generar ingresos a través de la venta de cosméticos, lociones, cremas y otros productos de revista, su negocio funciona desde hace 15 años, lo realiza con apoyo de su esposo, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, tiene una buena cartera de clientes lo que le da mucha ventaja para mantener su negocio con vida.
El crédito le será de ayuda para comprar lociones, cosméticos, cremas, etc., y una vitrina, mantendrá el inventario bien surtido y la mercadería estará a la vista de sus clientes, de esta manera sus ventas y ganancias serán mayores, el riesgo es la índice de delincuencia a la que se expone.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más amplio, ofrecer empleo a otra persona para que le ayude a vender y darle estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and her two children, ages 11 and 18. She has her own house and is the type of person who has searched for methods to generate income by selling cosmetics, lotions, creams and other magazine products. Her business has been open for over 15 years; she has the support of her husband; she learned through her own initiative and she has a regular supply of clients which is an advantage to maintaining her business afloat. 

The loan will be of great support to purchase lotions, cosmetics, creams, etc. and a cabinet glass, this will allow her to maintain an assorted stock of supplies and the merchandise will be available for all of her clients to see; her sales and profits will increase. The risk is the levels of criminality that she is exposed to. 

Her dreams consist of owning a bigger business, to offer job opportunities to other people so that they can help her sell and to provide economic stability to her family.
