loans.use: to purchase lotions, cosmetics, creams, etc. and a cabinet glass. This will allow her to maintain a stocked inventory and the merchandise will be available for her customers to see.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Vanadzor town with her two little children ages 5 and 1 years old.  She runs a small store where she trades with stationary supplies.  She has been able to run it in sustainable way for over five years, ensuring stable income during the month.  Anahit's husband is a labor migrant working hard to support his family financially. 

Realizing, how important Anahit's business is for her family, she has requested this loan. It will help her to purchase new stock of stationery supplies needed for her store. Anahit has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of stationery supplies needed for her store.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, a music teacher by profession, has been involved in cosmetics sales for 10 years. She sells a large variety of cosmetics from her house and during those 10 years was able to build a good client base.  She now asks for financial support to be able to make an investment on her business. She plans to purchase new stock of cosmetics for her clients. 

Gayane has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cosmetics for her clients.

loans.name: Lernik

texts.en:
Lernik lives in Spitak town with her son and daughter-in-law. Lernik's son works at bank and her daughter-in-law is a hairdresser. To help her family members cover their living costs, Lernik has been involved in a food production business for three years. Specifically, Lernik produces different sweeties and cakes, and then sells them to a local food store. 

The requested loan is very important for this hardworking woman to invest some funds into her business. She needs to purchase some materials and tools for baking sweeties and cakes. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Lernik greatly hopes for the support and goodwill of her lenders.

loans.use: to pay for materials for baking sweeties and cakes

loans.name: Ruby Magdalena

texts.es: Ruby de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 12 y 3 años de edad. Buscando la forma de llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, ella instalo una tienda de productos varios en su hogar, y es gracias a este pequeño negocio que ella ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas sin el apoyo de el padre. Ruby desea reparar la instalación eléctrica en su vivienda e instalarla en dos cuartos, además desea reparar el baño, es por ello que decidió solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre, interruptores tomacorriente y mano de obra para reparar e instalar energía eléctrica y reparar el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ruby is 34 years old. She lives in her own house with her two daughters, who are 12 and 13 years old. Looking for a way to put food on the table every day, she set up a general store in her house. It's thanks to that little business that she has managed to provide for her daughters without the support of their father.

Ruby would like to repair the electrical wiring in her house and install it in two bedrooms. In addition, she would like to repair the bathroom. That's why she decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in wire, switches, electrical outlets, and labor to repair and install electrical wiring and repair the bathroom in her house.

loans.use: to invest in wire, switches, electrical outlets, and labor to repair and install electrical wiring and to repair the bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa Isabel tiene 51 años de edad, vive en casa propia, con su cónyuge y 02 hijos de 15 y 12 años respectivamente, quienes estudian en colegio nacional de la zona; su cónyuge se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola en empresa de la zona. Rosa Isabel es una persona que cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente respetuosa, dedicadas al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubica en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Rosa Isabel se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamburguesas, en la puerta de su casa, desde hace más de 03 años, siendo muy conocida por zona. Ella necesita del préstamo para invertir en compra de ollas, utensilios y otros con los que ofrecerá el servicio de pensión de desayuno, almuerzo y cena, lo que le proporcionará un ingreso adicional a su unidad familiar, para poder mejor su calidad de vida de la misma.
texts.en:
Rosa Isabel is 51 years old, she lives in her own house, with her partner and her two children, ages 15 and 12 and who study in the national school of the area. Her partner is an agricultural worker for businesses located around the area. Rosa Isabel has good personal and job references from her neighbors. Her family is very united. She lives in community with very courteous people; people dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock. The community is located in the district of Lagunas, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the north coast of Peru.

Rosa Isabel has been preparing and selling hamburgers, in her home, for over 3 years; she is well known in the area. She needs the loan to invest in the purchasing of pots, utensils, and other supplies with which she will offer breakfast, lunch and dinner services. This will provide her family with additional income to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in the purchasing of pots, utensils and other supplies to offer breakfast, lunch and dinner services.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam vit avec son conjoint revendeur et leurs 03 enfants de 14,12 et 8ans scolarisés à Lomé. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré la vente des pagnes, des bijoux et ustensiles de cuisine au marché depuis 1997. Manquant de fonds pour acheter plus de marchandises, elle fait son troisième prêt à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille et d'assurer le bien - être de la famille. Enyonam est âgée de 38ans.
texts.en:
Enyonam is 38 years old and lives with her husband and their three children, who are 8, 12, and 14 years old. The children go to school, and the family lives in Lomé.

To support her family's needs, Enyonam has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric], jewelry, and kitchen utensils at the market since 1997. Gaps in her cash flow has led her to seek her third loan with WAGES so that she can buy more stock. 

Profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their well-being.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, jewelry, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Noong Luong 14 Group

texts.en:
Tam is young Thai lady of 24 years, who’s married with a little daughter. They moved out of the husband’s family's house one year ago and started a new life with many difficulties. Tam and her husband mainly work at farm production cultivating rice, vegetables and raising pigs, and chickens, which brings them very low income to cover all of essential living expenses. Therefore, her husband works extra for a local construction employer to earn more, though the job is tough and sometimes dangerous. 

Tam said that she heard a lot about Anh Chi Em's services including providing small loan and training sessions, so she decided to apply for a loan in the Program to develop agricultural production. She also expressed that she was very excited and expected upcoming training lessons as well as technical support from Anh Chi Em's team. This is the first loan that Tam has taken out from Anh Chi Em and she will use the loan to buy small fish. Tam hopes that she will be able to improve her family income considerably through this investment, so she can invest more, as well as buy some furniture for her house and some toys for her child. 

In the picture, Tam wears a yellow shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido soninkoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  13eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadiatou (la 2eme  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains de riz dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 sacs de grains de riz à Ségou chez les stockeurs. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women in the Danaya group all live in traditional families. They are, on average, 43 years old and have three children. They all live in the Sido Soninkoura area of Segou (in the fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other from neighborhood, family, marriage, and business ties in the area. They work selling cereals and clothing or making food.

With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their 13th group loan.

Kadiatou (the second woman seated on the left in the photo) is a merchant who sells much rice in her area and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to buy six sacs of rice in Segou from wholesalers. Sales will be made for cash and often for credit in the market and from her home to a mixed group of customers.

Kadiatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA with this loan. These profits will be used to support her children's needs and also increase her business funds. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, reinforcing steel, and a toilet to build a bathroom in her house

loans.name: Glean

texts.en:
Glean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business directly selling Avon products in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more products from Avon like lipsticks, lotion, body spray, perfume, shoes, etc. to sell for her Avon products business.

Glean has been in this business for seven years. She also earns more income from farming vegetables and sugarcane and raising pigs. Glean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell like lipsticks, lotion, body spray, perfume, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old and married, with two children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, candies, and noodles.

Janet has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Janet aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, candies, and noodles.

loans.name: Agustín Jaime

texts.es:
Agustín solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz que está creciendo. 

Agustín espera el momento en que el mayor de sus hijos cumpla veinte y un años de edad para así obtener la ciudadanía Norteamérica y volver a Estados Unidos a juntarse con sus hijos, también piensa llevarse a su esposa y su hija junto con él.
texts.en:
Agustín is requesting a new loan to buy soil amendments, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to maintain his corn crop, which is growing. 

Agustín is waiting for the moment when the oldest of his children turns 21 years old, so that he can obtain American citizenship and return to the United States to reunite with his children. He is also planning to bring his wife and daughter along with him.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to maintain his corn crop

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives with her mother and brother. She is a painter and works at local school as a teacher. 

Gohar has been painting for many years and sells her paintings in the local gallery. As a talented painter, she also provides individual classes for local children in the town. Next month, Gohar plans to participate in a large exhibition and needs some financial support to be able to purchase the supplies she needs. She has requested this loan to purchase canvas, oil paints and paint brushes.
 
She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Gohar is very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for canvas, oil paints, and paint brushes

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Dème vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Somonodougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de poisson frais dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une grande quantité de poisson frais à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Aminata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 12 500 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in the Dème group all live in traditional families. They are, on average, 37 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Somonodougouni in Ségou (in the fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other through neighborhood, family, marriage, and business ties in the village. They work in small-scale commerce and food preparation.

With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yirwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Aminata (the first woman standing on the left in the photo) is a merchant who sells a lot of fresh fish in the village and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of fresh fish in Ségou. Sales are made for cash and often for credit at the market or from her home to a mixed group of customers.

Aminata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA with this loan. She will use the profits to support her children's needs and also increase her business funds. She wishes to continue collaborating with Soro Yirwaso.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Alba Maritza

texts.es: Alba de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza por sostener la economía del hogar por medio de su trabajo en una empresa cercana a su localidad en la cual presta sus servicios desde hace 14 años. Alba desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y es por ello que desea colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso para colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba, who is 50 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She is a woman who strives to sustain her household finances through her job at a nearby company where she has lent her services for 14 years. 

Alba would like to improve her family's living conditions, so she would like to put a tile floor in her house. That's why she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and floor tiles to put a tile floor in her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and floor tiles to put a tile floor in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, reinforcing steel, wire, and concrete blocks to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Jean Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jean Fe works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Jean Fe is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods like shorts, blouses, slippers, t-shirts, etc. to sell to her customers for her dry goods business.

Jean Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods like shorts, blouses, slippers, t-shirts, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives with her retired mother, son and daughter-in-law. Over five years, Anush has been involved in clothing sales. Specifically she sells clothes, shoes and different household products. The assortment of goods she sells is not that big and needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to be productive. Anush currently needs a loan to buy new items (clothes and shoes) to resell to her customers. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy new items (clothes and shoes) to resell to her customers

loans.name: Hayarpi

texts.en:
Hayarpi is a young business lady from Stepanavan town. She lives there with her father, who is constructor. Hayarpi's mother is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country. Hayarpi's mother sends her stocks of clothing that she sells here in Stepanavan town. Hayarpi is very hardworking and has a very good attitude towards her customers. The requested loan is very important for this young girl to purchase new stocks of clothing and cosmetics for reselling to her customers. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Hayarpi, with good credit history behind her, hopes for the support and trust of her lenders.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Noong Luong 13 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien, 28, is a small but strong-willed woman. She lives in a small village far from the city center with five family members (her husband, her parents-in-law and her two children) in an old Thai traditional house. Her daughter is in sixth grade and her son is in second grade at school. 

Dien and her husband work to cover the family's living expenses, pay for the children's education and to save for when her parents-in-law will be old. To do this, they work very hard at agricultural activities, such as growing rice, vegetable and raising pigs, chickens, ducks and fish. They also raise a buffalo for ploughing. In addition, Dien's husband works for a local employer, which requires him to have a lot of skills and is very tough. 

Dien has always wanted to develop production to increase their earnings, so she has taken out loans from Anh Chi Em Program and participated in plenty of training sessions held by the Program's socio-economic team. This is the fourth time she has received a loan from Anh Chi Em and she said she would use the loan to buy small fish after being successful in a fish-farming project with previous loan. Dien hopes that her effort will be repaid and she would improve significantly her family's income and provide an abundant life for her children. 

In the picture, Dien is the woman with a big smile on her face, standing on the far right.

loans.use: to buy small fish

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат  женщина 40 лет, замужем,мать троих детей. Родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Мамлакат по профессии преподаватель. Её муж - водитель автобуса,совершает поездки в Российскую Федерацию. Работа учителем не приносит Мамлакат достаточно денег,поэтому Мамлакат имеет дополнительный доход:она продаёт женскую и детскую одежду . Мамлакат знает,что в настоящее время без образования не получишь хорошую работу. Она хочет ,чтобы её дети жили в достатке. У Мамлакат есть дочь ,которая в этом году поступила в университет. Бюджетных мест мало,поэтому её дочери пришлось поступить на коммерческой основе. Мамлакат на данный момент не имеет нужной суммы для оплаты обучения,поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Мамлакат заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Mamlakat is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She was born and raised in a rural area. Mamlakat is a teacher by profession. Her husband is a bus driver and makes trips to the Russian Federation. Her work as a teacher does not yield enough money for Mamlakat and this is why she has an additional source of income - she sells women's and children's clothing. Mamlakat knows that at the present time it is impossible to get a good job without an education. She wants her children to live in abundance. Mamlakat has a daughter, who was accepted to a university this year. There were not many available budget seats, and this is why her daughter had to be accepted on a commercial basis and pay for her education. Mamlakat currently does not have the necessary amount to pay for the education and came to MDO Arvand for the financial support. Mamlakat thanks MDO Arvand for the support and trust in advance.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university education

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socios exitosos en sus labores diarios, está coordinado por el señor Roberto de 31 años de edad, acompañado, dedicado a la compra-venta de cosechas, este negocio lo impulso hace ocho años con apoyo financiero de su familia, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate, pues este es uno de los alimentos que más demanda está teniendo en esta temporada, se ha propuesto aumentar los productos que ofrece para seguir mejorando sus ingresos. 
Las otras integrantes son las señoras, Javiera quien tiene la edad de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa interior en su comunidad desde hace dos años, Iris de 21 años de edad comercializa ropa en su comunidad, y María de los Santos de 46 años de edad, quien ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su comunidad desde hace un años
texts.en:
This communal bank consists of four members who are successful in their daily work. It is coordinated by Sr. Roberto, who is 31 years old and has a partner. He buys and sells crops and has run this business for eight years with the financial support of his family.

He is requesting a loan to purchase crops of avocado, since this is one of the items in highest demand in this season. He has proposed increasing the products he sells so he can continue improving his income.

The other members of the group are the Sras. Javier, who is 29 years old and who has been selling underwear in her community for two years, Iris, who is 21 years old and who sells clothing in her community and Maria de los Santos, who is 46 years old and who has been offering her services selling food for the past year.

loans.use: to purchase avocado crops.

loans.name: Jeanita

texts.en:
Jeanita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing/fish-vending business.

Jeanita has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Jeanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel De La Paz

texts.es:
Miguel de 66 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente casado y vive solo junto con su esposa en su casita desde el año 2008. En su matrimonio anterior Miguel tuvo 7 hijos, los cuales ya están grandes y tienen vidas independientes. Con su actual esposa no posee ningún hijo.

Miguel fue empleado, trabajó en varias gasolineras en la ciudad como despachador de servicio, posteriormente consiguió trabajo en la capital donde vivió algunos años. Luego decidió regresar a su tierra de origen y comenzar una nueva vida y vivir de la agricultura.


El préstamo solicitado es para comprar fertilizantes, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, pago de mano de obra para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz.  

El Mayor sueño que Miguel tiene es poder arreglar la casita donde viven, pues está bien deteriorada y quieren que luzca bien.
texts.en:
Miguel is 66 years old. He has a high school education and is happily married. He and his wife have lived alone in their little house since 2008. In his previous marriage, Miguel and seven children, who are already grown and have independent lives. With his current wife, he has no children.

Miguel was employed; he worked in various gas stations in the city as a service dispatcher. Later, he got work in the capital, where he lived for some years. Then, he decided to return to his home turf and start a new life and live off of farming.

The requested loan is to buy fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor to maintain his corn crop.

Miguel's greatest dream is to be able to fix up the house where they live, as it is quite deteriorated and they want it to look nice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, soil amendments, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married mother of three who operates a retail shop at Gangu, a city subub where she resides. She’s a second-time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd who previously took a loan of UGX 2,500,000. She intends to take a new loan of UGX 1,500,000 to purchase stock and boost the business with back to school items. She is assured of sales because parents and children will be buying.

She described herself as hardworking, God-fearing and a family woman. Her future plans include supporting her husband in building a home for the family and taking her children through school.  

She is so grateful to the funders and hopes to borrow more money after this cycle from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: To buy sugar, juices, and scholastic materials

loans.name: Kyambura Bakyara Group

texts.en:
Nuriati is a repeat customer and a member of Kyambura Bakyara Tukwatanise Group. She is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She does yellow-banana and plantain trading. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX only to restock her business.  

She started the business in 2011 for her family's development. She is a selfless and hardworking woman who also does coffee planting to supplement her income. She does the business by the road side, and her clients are travelers to and from the neighbouring towns. She is faced with the challenges of bad weather like rain and passengers who go without paying for their produce. However, through her hard work, she has managed her business and is determined to grow it massively.

She would like to thank UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI) for helping the poor. She hopes that her business profits will enable her to buy a plot on which to build a home for her children.

In the photo, the group members are shown with the UGAFODE staff member in the pink T-shirt (squatting at extreme right).

loans.use: to buy plantain and green bananas to sell

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a married man and a father of three. He owns and operates two motocycles which people hire to move around the traffic of the city. He is a resident of a city suburb where he built a small house for his family.

He's a first time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd and intends to take a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to renovate his home.
He is a hard working, family man. His future plans include putting his children through school and expanding his motorcycle business.  
He is grateful to the funders and wishes to continue borrowing more money from the institution.

Pictured is Asuman and the UGAFODE credit officer(left to right).

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: N. Boljang Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower of the group, Chinkholhing, is a 50-year-old woman pictured with her hand raised. Her husband is a retired pastor and they sustain their family from his pension salary. She weaves traditional wraparounds to supplement their income as her husband's salary is not sufficient for the household needs. Their eldest son with his wife is in a seminary supported by sponsors from the church while their second son is a private tutor at home who earns income to manage his college fees and their third son is a college student supported by his parents. Their daily activities after sunset have so much to do with the irregular power supply in the evening as the area undergoes power cuts frequently. It hampers their activities including weaving by the mother, tutor classes by the second son and other household activities. Their activities become less productive due to the insufficient power supply and they have to bear the consequences and limit their activities under the light from one candle in a room. From time to time, Chinkholhing weaves colourful traditional wraparound skirts to sell to retailers for more profit. After all the household chores are done, she wanted to continue weaving by extending her workday into the evening hours. However, the power supply is very irregular in the area. One has to pay an expensive amount to install prepaid electricity in the house. Hence, after sunset due to insufficient light, she could not continue her income-generating activities.

As luck had its way, they came across WSDS where they can avail a mini solar home lighting system with affordable interest. The family is very happy to avail such a loan from WSDS and expressed their immense gratitude to the lenders. Therefore, with the assistance of her Kiva loan, she wants to buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system, which will light four bulbs for 12 hours a day. This will help her to increase her productivity and allow her business to operate during the night. Chinkholhing believes that a solar home lighting system is an excellent option to give in-house illumination in areas with frequent power cuts. They can now perform their daily activities under the bright light without any difficulty. Likewise, the rest of the group members also need solar home lighting systems for their income-generating activities and family use. Most of them weave different texture and patterns of traditional wraparounds and shawls for income generation.

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es: Urania de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que todos los días sale a ganarse la vida en un taller de costura cercano en el cual elabora prendas de vestir. Urania desea construir la acera  en la entrada de su vivienda  ya que  cuando es tiempo de lluvia se humedece obstaculizando el paso. Por lo anterior, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para construir una acera en su vivienda. En el pasado construyó una pequeña rampa en la entrada de la vivienda la cual le permite dar paso a las aguas lluvias.
texts.en:
Urania, 48 years old, lives in her own house with her life companion and their two children, who are 6 and 11 years old. She is a woman who earns a living every day in a nearby dressmaking shop where she makes clothing.

Urania wants to install a sidewalk at the entrance to her dwelling because, during the rainy season, it still gets so wet that it blocks the way. Consequently she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel and bricks in order to construct a sidewalk at her dwelling. 

In the past, she built a small ramp at the entrance in order to make way for the rain water.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel and bricks to install pavement at her dwelling.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: Yulissa de 22 años de esdad es soltera. Este es el Grupo “Amigas Unidas” esta conformada por 05  mujeres carismáticas y solidarias con proyecciones a crecer cada dia en sus negocios. Yulissa se dedica a la venta de especerias como aji molido, ajos y pimentones. Hace mas de 02 años que se dedica a dicho negocio por lo que tiene planeado poner otro puesto de venta. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de ajis, ajos, rocotos, pimentones y cilantrillos . El grupo “Amigas Unidas” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Yulissa es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa crema. En la parte superior a lado derecho se encuentra Victoria la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yulissa is 22 and is single. This is the “Amigas Unidas” ("Friends United") group, made up of 5 charismatic and solidarity-focussed women, with plans to grow daily in their businesses. Yulissa works selling spices such as Peruvian ground peppers, garlic and bell-peppers. She has been in this business for over 2 years, which is why she is planing to set up another sales stall. This is why she asked for a loan: to buy Peruvian peppers, garlic, rococo peppers, bell-peppers and coriander.

The “Amigas Unidas” group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support. Yulissa is the first on the right in the photo, wearing a cream-coloured sweater. In the top right is Victoria, who was not able to arrive in time for the photo because of her work.

loans.use: to buy Peruvian hot peppers, garlic, rococo peppers, bell-peppers and coriander.

loans.name: Jorema

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jorema works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane. Jorema is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jorema has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josiphene

texts.en:
Josiphene is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like noodles, fabric conditioner, hair conditioner, canned goods, beer, etc. to sell.

Josiphene has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Josiphene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like noodles, fabric conditioner, hair conditioner, canned goods and beer to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been in the pig fattening business for two years and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lotea

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lotea works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables. Lotea is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lotea has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 50 years old and married with two children. Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, juice, soft-drinks, etc. 

Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dúo Sofy Group

texts.es:
Dúo Sofy

Integrado por Lidia originarias de san Martin Jilotepeque. Lidia es propietaria de un salón de belleza y vende productos de belleza.ella está agradecida por recibir el apoyo de Fape y Kiva, ya que esto le ayudara a comprar más producto para surtir más sus negocios y así obtener más ganancias las cuales utilizara para darle estudio a sus hijas. Lidia ha sido bien responsable en sus pagos, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para su negocio(salon de belleza.
texts.en:
Dúo Sofy

Lidia, a native of San Martin Jilotepeque, is a member of this duo. She is the proprietor of a beauty salon and sells beauty products. 

She is grateful to receive support from Fape and Kiva since this will help her to buy more products to better stock her business and thus obtain more income.  She will use her profits to give her daughters an education. 

Lidia has been responsible with her payments. At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Melogene

texts.en:
Melogene is 37 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.
 
Melogene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

Melogene has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and fish vending.

Melogene aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Mercy has been in this business for ten years. Mercy earns more income from farming vegetables.

Mercy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a 20-year-old single young man from Khan Younis. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Taha opened his own business three years ago. It is a chicken farm. It is a good business and earns a good income. Taha would like to expand his farm in the future and improve it.
 
Taha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicks for his farm. He will be able to increase his productivity and improve the family's living conditions. 

Taha appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: reina de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino de repasto y crianza de cerdos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, comercializa en los diferentes mercados, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una novilla para seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Reina is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband who works in agriculture. She works raising cattle and pigs. She has been doing this for 3 years. She sells them at the various markets. She is requesting a loan to by a heifer to continue with her work which generates good profit.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 36 years old and married with two children.

Noeme works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Noeme has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Noeme aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 50 years old and married with three children. Valentina works hard to provide for her family. 

Valentina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell such as rice, feed, noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, eggs, bread, etc.

Valentina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Valentina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as rice, feed, noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-raising business in the Philippines. 

Nilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been in this business for six years. Nilda earns more income from farming vegetables and food vending.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn Del Carmen

texts.es: Evelyn de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que todos los días pone su mayor esfuerzo por sacar adelante a su pequeña hija que es la razón por la que ella presta sus servicios domésticos para sostener la economía de su hogar. Evelyn desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda ya que quiere evitar cualquier riesgo de accidente que un muro de tierra vecino con su vivienda pueda causar, ya que es consiente que puede provocar algún daño sobre todo hacia su pequeña hija es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 24 years old. She lives in her own house with her four-year-old daughter. She is a woman who puts her best effort, every day, into providing for her little daughter. Her daughter is the reason that she lends her services as a housekeeper in order to sustain her household finances. 

Evelyn would like to build a retaining wall at her house because she wants to avoid the accident risk that a neighboring earthen wall could pose to her house. She is aware that it could cause some damage, above all to her little daughter, so that is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and reinforcing steel to build a retaining wall at her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and reinforcing steel to build a retaining wall at her house

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Rosalie has been raising livestock for one year and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Rowena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora works hard to support her family. Rhodora is married and has a native bags business in the Philippines.

Rhodora requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of native bags to sell to her customers. Rhodora has been in this business for 15 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of native bags to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 35 years old and married.  She has five children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Aniceta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Aniceta has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Las Encantadoras Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Las Encantadoras, lo integran tres mujeres laboriosas, una de ella es la coordinadora, la señora María Auxiliadora quien tiene la edad de 51 años, casada y dedicada a la compra-venta de cosecha, así mismo es propietaria de una mini pulpería en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace quince años con esfuerzo mutuo con su esposo, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate y mamón, con el crédito anterior la socia logro vender productos que antes no tenía. Otra de las socias es la señora María Ester de 34 años de edad, comerciante de cosechas de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad, y la señora Sandra quien tiene la edad de 34 años y ofrece el servicio de comida en su domicilio, así mismo elabora Tamales desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The "Las Encantadoras" communal bank consists of three hard-working women. One of them, María Auxiliadora is the coordinator. She is 51 years old, married and works buying and selling produce. She is also the owner of a small store in her house. She started this business equally with her husband 15 years ago. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy avocado and papaya harvests. With her last loan she managed to sell products that she had not had before.

The other members are: María Ester who is 34 years old. She is a vendor of fruit harvests in the municipal market. Sandra is 34 years old and she sells meals from her house and also has been making tamales for four years.

loans.use: to buy avocado and papaya harvests.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with nine children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, candies, etc. to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional  income from farming sugarcane.

Teresita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, and candies to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. Elisa is widowed and has a soft-drinks and beers business in the Philippines.  Elisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more cases of soft-drinks and beers to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for two years now.  Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft-drinks and beers to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 27 years old and married.  She has five children.  She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Felicidad is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Felicidad has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her tailoring business.

Francisca has been in this business for 20 years. Francisca earns additional income from a general store. Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucia works hard to support her family.  She has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and from a general store. Lucia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more Avon products like sandals, shoes, bags, body spray, etc,. to sell to her customers for her direct selling business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products like sandals, shoes, bags, body spray, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Irene se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, menestras, entre otros; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio, Irene solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, pues desea invertir en compra de más mercadería (aceite, arroz, azúcar, entre otros); dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, ya que aumentará y diversificará su stock de productos, para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que en un corto plazo se verá reflejado en una mejora de sus ganancias y por ende de su calidad de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her family in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. People in her community mostly work in agriculture, livestock production, and commerce.

Irene earns her living selling groceries, like rice, sugar, milk, oil, soups, and more. She has more than 10 years of experience in the business, which is located in her house. 

Irene is requesting a loan for working capital, as she would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise (oil, rice, sugar, and more). This investment will serve to increase her sales, as she will expand and diversify her product inventory in order to meet the diverse needs, requirements, and tastes of her local customers. In the short term, this will be reflected in an improvement in her earnings and therefore in her quality of life.

loans.use: to have working capital, as she would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase and diversify her stock

loans.name: Ma. Hazel

texts.en:
Ma. Hazel is 43 years old and married.  She has three children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Hazel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Hazel has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 24-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He lives with his wife and one kid. Yousef opened a workshop for aluminum. He makes windows and doors in different shapes and they are very good quality. Yousef would like to improve his business and expand it in the future

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy raw materials for his aluminum workshop. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to increase his productivity and take more orders.

Yousef appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his aluminum workshop

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 23 year old, married, man from Khanyounis. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. Nidal works as a farmer on the family land where they plant seasonal crops. 

Nidal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare the land for the new season and buy fertilizers. Taking this loan will help Nidal to improve the land and increase its productivity. 

Nidal appears in the photo

loans.use: to prepare the land for the new season and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: Maria de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 40 años aproximadamente,tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos, los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Maria esta solicitando un crédito apara la compra de sopas, golosina, refrescos, granos básicos, etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She has a small shop located in her place of residence. For approximately 40 years, she has had many customers because of her variety of products, her good prices, and her courteous sales manner. 

María is requesting a loan for the purchase of soups, snacks, drinks, staple grains, etc., in order to be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy soups, snacks, drinks, staple grains, etc.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Minda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Minda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 30 years old and five of her children are currently in school.

Analiza has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more Avon products to sell to her customers.

Analiza has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years old and married with four children. Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Elvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 34 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felisa is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Felisa has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Felisa has been in this business for 24 years. Felisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is single and has a rug making business in the Philippines.  Fidela requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, etc., for her business.

Fidela has been in this business for 20 years now.  In the future, Fidela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, etc. for her business

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 34 years old and married.  She has five children. With three children currently in school, Flordelina works very hard to provide for them.
Flordelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Flordelina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, juice, etc.  In the future, Flordelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Adony

texts.es:
Adony de 42 años de edad, no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que su familia era de escasos recursos economicos, y él tenia que trabajar para llevar alimento a su familia. Adony esta acompañado, padre de tres hijos.

 Adony y su compañera de vida se dedican a la agricultura y al cuido de ganado,desde hace mucho tiempo.

El crédito sera utilizado para comprar ganado para el repasto. El sueño de Adony es mejor su calidad de vida, mejorar sus ingresos y asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Adony is 42 years old. He did not have the opportunity to get an education because his family had limited economic resources; he had to work to put food on his family's table. Adony is married and the father of three children.

Adony and his life companion have worked in farming and livestock production for a long time.

The loan will be used to buy cattle to graze. Adony's dream is to improve his quality of life, improve his income, secure the future of his children, and have his own house.

loans.use: to buy cattle to graze

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият жительница города Турсунзаде, ей 59 лет. Она образованная женщина и в течение 10 лет работает преподавателем в средней школе. Параллельно все эти годы Хосият вместе с детьми занимается разведением крупнорогатых скотин. Она закупает скот с местного скотного рынка и после 30-35 дней откорма продает там же по прибыльной цене. Хосият ходит на скотный рынок для купли и продажи скота вместе с сыном. В данный момент в ее скотном дворе имеется два быка. Хосият хочет увеличить их поголовье и для этой цели запрашивает кредит из-за нехватки собственных средств. На сумму кредита она хочет закупить еще одного бычка. Хосият надеется на финансовую помощь.
texts.en: Khosiyat is a 59-year-old resident of the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is educated, and has been working as a schoolteacher for the past 10 years.   All the while, she has also been raising cattle with the help of her children.  Accompanied by her son, she buys her animals from a local cattle market, fattens them for 30-35 days, then resells them there for a profit.  Currently, Khosiyat has two bulls on her farm.  She would like to have more cattle, and is asking for a loan to buy a bull calf to that end.  She is counting on your help.

loans.use: buy a bull calf

loans.name: El Higueron Group

texts.es: Higueron es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socios emprendedores, y está coordinado por la señora Rosa quien tiene la edad de 39 años, casada, comerciante de cerdos en pie, este negocio lo impulso hace tres años con el dinero que le pagaron de su liquidación, y solicita el crédito para la compra de dos cerdos en pie y comida para estos, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la clientela. Otra de las socias es la señora María Eugenia quien tiene la edad de 29 años y es propietaria de unas pulpería en su domicilio desde hace más de un anos, el señor Juan de 47 años de edad quien comercializa carne de cerdo en su domicilio desde hace tres años, y la señora Telma de 34 años de edad, quien comercializa cerdos en pie desde hace ocho años.
texts.en:
"Higueron" is a supportive group made up of four resourceful members. It is coordinated by Señora Rosa, who is 39 years old and married. She deals in live pigs, a business that she started three years ago with the money she was paid when she was laid off. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of two live pigs and feed for them. With the previous loans, she was able to increase her clientele. 

Another of the members is Señora María Eugenia, who is 29 years old and has been the owner of a small neighborhood grocery store in her house for more than one year. Señor Juan is 47 years old, and he has sold pork from his house for three years. Señora Telma is 34 years old, and she has sold live pigs for eight years.

loans.use: to buy live pigs

loans.name: Alexandra Saory

texts.es:
Alexandra es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 19 años y vive en Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, ella cree que le está yendo muy bien gracias a su esfuerzo. También tiene el sueño de convertirse en una excelente profesional,es por ello que está estudiando la carrera de Derecho. Es una persona muy responsable, estudiosa y trabajadora.
Alexandra está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar la matricula de la Universidad, de esta manera continuará con sus clases sin ningún inconveniente. Más adelante Alexandra quiere abrir su propio negocio y crecer profesionalmente para orgullo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is 19 and lives in Guadalupe, Perú with her family.  For the past several years she has worked selling sodas.  She believes that things are going well thanks to her efforts.  She also has the desire to become an excellent professional, which is why she is studying law.  She is a very responsible person, who is also studious and hard-working. 

Alexandra is thankful for the Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to pay tuition for University studies.  In this way she will continue taking classes without problems.  In the future Alexandra wants to open her own business and grow professionally in order to be the pride of her parents.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for her University studies in Law.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his electrical workshop.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is single and has a buy and sell of eggs business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers.

Carmelita has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Catherine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Catherine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Catherine has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.  She has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers for her frozen foods business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jacquelyn is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jacquelyn has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.  Jacquelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jacquelyn would like to save enough money so she cam afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa works hard to support her family. Leliosa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leliosa has been in this business for two years now.  Leliosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife and one small son in a simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in transferring goods using an old rickshaw.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for transferring goods to the local traders. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his business and also his income.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for transferring goods to the local traders.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to sell

loans.name: Kenia Mariela

texts.es: Kenia en una microempresaria emprendedora de 25 años de edad, casada, dedicada a la comercialización de ropa en su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace seis años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, se ha propuesto aumentar la clientela, por tal razón solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como es blusas para niños, camisetas, jeans, talladores, blúmer, bóxer, etc.
texts.en: Kenia is an entrepreneurial micro-business owner who is 25 years old, married, and works selling clothing in her community.  She began this business six years ago with the help of a loan from her husband.  She would like to increase her customer base, which is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise like blouses for children, shirts, jeans, underwear, boxer shorts, bloomers, etc.

loans.use: to buy blouses for children, shirts, jeans, underwear, boxer shorts, bloomers, etc.

loans.name: Effah

texts.en:
Effah is a 23-year-old married woman from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin City. She is a mother of two small sons. Her husband works as an employee with a low income. He also has a small farm for raising sheep. Effah helps her husband on his farm where they make diary products to sell in the village. It is a good business. 

Effah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more sheep for the farm. By taking this loan, Effah will be able to increase their diary productivity and also the dairy sales. 

Effah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Her name is Lilia. She is thankful that she was granted an 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her grocery store. She also owns and operate a jeepney unit. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for another Php 15,000 which she will use to buy groceries items for her general store and jeepney wires as well to maintain her jeepney.  Her source of income comes from her two businesses. She earns around Php  800 a day.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.  This helps them address their daily needs and school needs of her children.

Lilia  hopes to be able to expand soon. She dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is grateful that she was granted a Php 25,000 PHP loan which she used to repair and maintain her room for rent. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily personal and household needs.

She would like now to apply for Php 30,000 which she will use to buy cement, steel, gravel to improve her room for rent. Part of the loan will also be used to buy, fabric, zippers, lining and buttons for her tailoring business. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. Lea aims to give her children the best education possible.

She dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Sergia would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of PHP 25,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She will also use portion of the loan to add up to the capital needed for her canteen business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Joecelle

texts.en:
Joecelle is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old, and all her children are in school.

Joecelle has a business of selling soft drinks in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Joecelle has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 42 years old and married, with two children.

Johna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Johna has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Johna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Arlene

texts.en:
Maria Arlene is a 50-year-old married woman with twelve children, six of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maria Arlene has a firewood selling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of firewood to sell.

Maria Arlene has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 59 years old and married.  She has five children. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like coffee, creamer, sugar, shampoo, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, creamer, sugar, shampoo, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc.  She  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like coffee, creamer, sugar, shampoo, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
