Melinda is 60 years old and single.  Melinda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tusipepa

texts.en: Tusipepa is a 60-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, doing a bingo game to earn a living. She has had four years with this business. Tusipepa needs a loan to buy a bingo machine, bingo papers, bingo sheets, hard card, etc. She will use her profits to extend her business and to save more for unexpected emergencies. Tusipepa joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, bingo papers, bingo sheets, hard card, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for monthly expenses, and to purchase stock and raw materials.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old, and all four of her children are in school.

Laarni has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials such as fabric, needles, scissors, thread, etc. for her business.

In the future, Laarni would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as fabric, needles, scissors, thread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 59-years-old and has thirteen children. Carmelita is widowed and has one child who is still in school.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmelita has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business and secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as sacks of charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Babylyn has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Babylyn would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as sacks of charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Eden works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Eden is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirty years now.

Cristina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de bois de chauffage et charbon, de cosmétique et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Faty  (la 2eme  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  bois de chauffage et de charbon dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 chargement de charrette en bois de chauffage et 15 sacs de charbon à Gara et Dionfrogo. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Faty  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of Benkadi Group all live in nuclear families. They are an average 35 years of age, and have an average of three children each. They all live in the Bagadadji Ségou district (Fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The women are connected through ties of vicinity, kinship, marriage and through their small businesses in the neighborhood. They are merchants of firewood and charcoal, of cosmetics, and prepared foods. In order to improve their businesses, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Ms. Faty (shown in the photo second from the left) is a merchant of firewood and charcoal in her district and surrounding area. She intends to use her loan to purchase six wagon-loads firewood and 15 sacks of charcoal from Gara and Dionfrogo. Ms. Faty sells her merchandise from her home for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

Ms. Faty hopes to earn an average monthly income of 30,000 francs CFA with the help of this loan. She will use her income to pay for the daily needs of her children and to improve her business. She hopes to continue her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Cristina has been in this business for nine years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 46 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, shampoo, noodles, etc. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like candies, snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business.

Eleonor has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from selling rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Ségou coura somonosso de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, d’habillement et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  18eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam (la 2eme  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  grains de riz dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de grains de riz à Niono et Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit dans le marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mariam  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Sabougnouman all live in nuclear families, and they average 38 years of age and two children each, all living in the Ségou Coura Somonosso district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving grains, clothing, and condiments. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 18th solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariam (the woman sitting second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of rice in around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice in Niono and in Ségou. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more spices such as onions, garlic, etc. to sell for her buy-and-sell spices business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices such as onions, garlic, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
A married parent of four children, Edralyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling Tupperware products in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Edralyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her Tupperware business.

Edralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional Tupperware items to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soft-drinks, detergent, soap, canned goods, candies and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Evelyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Radharani Shg Group

texts.en:
The Radharani Self-Help Group is made up of ten members from a small village located in Boudh district of Odisha, India. There are ten enthusiastic ladies in the group. Brundabati is the president of the group. She is 35 years old, married, and has three years of formal education. 

Some years ago, she began a food-selling business that was soon transformed into a restaurant. Due to her hard work and what she has learned from the People's Forum trainings, Brundabati has been very successful. As she was unable to handle the workload in the restaurant by herself, she employed a workforce of two to help her, and her husband also helps her. 

Brundabati, along with her group, is requesting a loan. She will use her portion to purchase essential items for the restaurant, including an additional stove, pots, and dishes. She will have enough to cater big and special events such as birthdays and weddings.

Each of the ladies in the group clearly envisions a future as an empowered woman eliminating poverty. The small loans and educational seminars are an effective pathway to this goal. Thank you, Kiva lenders, for your kindness and generosity in providing capital for these loans. Each of them has their own families to support, and so it is a wonderful “win-win” situation for all of them!

loans.use: to purchase essential items for the restaurant, including an additional stove, pots, and dishes.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkola vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 27 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 11 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou et à Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Aminata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Benkola all live in nuclear families, and they average 27 years of age and three children each, all living in the Médine district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving clothing and condiments and do commerce in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aminata (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in and around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 11 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth in Ségou and in Bamako. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Baarakagni Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Baarakagni vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Nina  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 11 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou et à Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Nina  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Baarakagni all live in nuclear families, and they average 34 years of age and four children each, all living in the Médine district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving clothing and do commerce in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Nina (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in and around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 11 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth in Ségou and in Bamako. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Nina hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Gina Marie

texts.en:
A married parent of three children, Gina Marie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from her general store.

Gina Marie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Gina Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers through her fish vending business.

Joan has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling dried fish.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a 58-year-old married mother of seven children, two of whom are still in school. For nine years now, she has been  buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. 

A borrower of 11 previous loans from NWTF, Justina has requested a new one for PHP 17000 to purchase additional livestock to sell. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Manfredy Gamaliel

texts.es:
Manfredy de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado,  esta acompañado, padre de un hijo. Su compañera de vida estudio hasta bachillerato.

Manfredy trabaja como panificador, trabajo que aprendio debido a la escaces de oportunidades de empleo, lleva dos años dedicandose a esta actividad, y tambien se dedica a la venta de pan de forma ambulante.

El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para comprar una motocicleta para salir a vender pan a partes donde no podia mobilizarse. Con ello estara mejorando sus ingresos, el sueño de Manfredy es salir adelante, ampliar el negocio, mejorar su calidad de vida y asegurar el futuro de su hijo.
texts.en:
Manfredy, 21, went to school up to ninth grade. He lives with his partner and is the father of a son. His life partner studied through high school. 

Manfredy works as a baker. He learned this work due to the shortage of employment opportunities. He has been doing this for two years, and he also sells bread as a street vendor. 

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a motorcycle to go out and sell bread to areas that he can’t get to on foot. This will improve his income. Manfredy's dream is to get ahead, expand the business, improve his quality of life, and secure the future of his son.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to go out and sell bread to areas that he can’t get to on foot

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Sabali vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement,  de restauration, de condiment et de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (la 1ere  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 17 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou et à Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 45 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Sabali all live in nuclear families, and they average 37 years of age and four children each, all living in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving clothing, condiments, fruit & vegetables, and they do commerce in food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman standing first from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in and around the district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 17 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth in Ségou and in Bamako. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often credit at the house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase Wax ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Marsita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marsita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marsita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marsita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary Gene

texts.en:
Mary Gene is 31 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living from a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mary Gene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Gene has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as fish, cooking oil, noodles, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Ma. Isabel has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from videoke machine rental.

Ma. Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fish, cooking oil, noodles, vegetables, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27 year old married man from Deir al-Balah. He is a father of one son and one daughter. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Mohammad would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the stuff they need.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will decrease the electricity expenses for the family.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Piabalo

texts.fr: Mr Piabalo est père de famille. Il a appris la cuisine et l’exerce depuis 03ans dans une boutique. Sa difficulté est la mévente et il sollicite un troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter des produits alimentaires, de la boisson et réaménager l’emplacement pour les clients. Dans l’avenir, il veut seconder son restaurant et assurer une bonne condition de vie à la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Piabalo is the father of a family. He learned how to cook and has been operating for three years in a shop. His problem is a drop in sales, and he is requesting a third loan from WAGES to purchase some food supplies and beverages and to renovate the space for his customers. For the future, he wants to provide backup for his restaurant and to ensure good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy food products and to improve the premises.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 33 year old, married, woman from a village near Jenin city. She is a mother of three sons and one daughter. Iman's husband is a worker in a job where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Iman and her husband would like to improve their family's living conditions and buy all the things the family needs.

Iman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. This will decrease the electricity expenses for the family.

Iman appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 44 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and additional pigs to raise..

Jenny has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, sugar, etc.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, sugar, etc

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melchorita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Melchorita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melchorita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Docus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a married woman, age 39 years, living with her family in a rural area. She has three children, all attending school. She also cares for two of her nephews, whom she pays school fees for in a secondary school near her home. She deals in an agricultural business where she grows coffee, beans, maize and bananas on a plantation.  She started this business in 2007.

She works 6 days a week and 8 hours per day, and started this business to increase the family income and acquired this loan to stock more corn and beans and to also improve the gardens. Her clients are traders from cities and those from villages around her.

Her future hope is to expand her business, and the challenge she faces is too much drought. She describes herself as a hardworking and honest woman who encourages lenders to continue helping business people to enable them expand their businesses and to develop their communities.

loans.use: To buy dry beans and maize for trade

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 44 years old and married.

Monina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, fabric conditioner, diapers, detergent, soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Monina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Monina aspires to save enough to expand her business and provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, fabric conditioner, diapers, detergent, soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, charcoal, sugar, salt, vinegar, groceries, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loads and farming rice.

Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, charcoal, sugar, salt, vinegar, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 52 years old and has eight children. Rita is married and has two children who are still in school.

Rita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Rita has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana works hard to support her family. Rosana is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosana requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en:
Sefulu is a 60 year old, married, woman with 7 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Sefulu has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, chemicals, a wheelbarrow etc. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Sefulu hopes to extpand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, chemicals, a wheelbarrow etc

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 52 years old and married, with ten children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, and chips.

Norlita has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, and chips.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Olivia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Olivia has been farming rice for 31 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more used clothes to sell to customers.

Gina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Gina's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wincita

texts.en:
Wincita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell soft-drinks and beer business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional cases of soft-drinks and beer to sell to her customers for her business.

Wincita has been in this business for 25 years. Wincita earns additional income from food and fish vending.

Wincita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cases of soft-drinks and beer to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur; she has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan funds in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

She has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 49 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Rosalina has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, soap, and shampoo.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fishing.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell, for her fish-vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money with which to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jemma works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from peanut butter retailing. Jemma is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita lives in Oroquieta City with her family. She has one child. Her husband earns a living by fishing. To help him meet the family's financial needs, she operates a general store, a business she has had for more than two years. The store is running well. To offer more goods to her customers, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase more grocery goods. In the future, she wants to expand her business and to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has been operating a general store to make a living. She settled and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, with her family. For years, in running the business, she has earned well to support the needs of her family and has been able to sustain it.

The store is doing well, and she wants more goods to add to her inventory capital. She had a previous loan, which she used for buying grocery goods to sell, and she repaid it successfully. Recently, to add more inventory capital again, she has taken a new loan. She will use the new loan to buy more grocery goods to offer in her retail store. She hopes to improve the business and to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to offer in her retail store.

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en:
Beberly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Beberly is 22 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Beberly has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Beberly requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business.

Beberly has been in this business for 1 year. Beberly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old, married, and has nine children, six of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional pig and feeds for her business.

Rosalie has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig and feeds for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married; she has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for one year, and she also earns income by raising pigs.

Erlinda has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, and soap. Erlinda has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, bread, and soap

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Blesilda has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, coffee, juice, and cereals to sell.

Blesilda has been in this business for four years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, coffee, juice, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta is 64 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dioleta runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, cereals, coffee, sugar, vinegar, salt, cooking oil, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc. 

Dioleta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ethelda

texts.en:
Ethelda is 50 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Ethelda works very hard to provide for them.

Ethelda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ethelda has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a 9714 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home. 

Ethelda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Erlinda has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Erlinda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Flores

texts.en:
Flores works hard to support her family. Flores is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed such as a net and ice box.

Flores has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as a net and ice box

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has three children and she settled in Oroquieta City with her family. Her husband does fishing and she operates a general store in their village to make a living. She has had this type of business for over three years and she had to find capital to offer more goods. 

Mercy borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in order to buy additional grocery goods to sell in her retail store. She wants to have a better living with her family in the future and she dreams of having an expansion to her business in order to have a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 39 years old and single.

Girlie and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Girlie is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,714 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Girlie has been with Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Girlie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn, a 41-year-old mother of two, has been earning a living raising pigs in the Philippines for five years. She earns additional income from operating a general store and  gardening.

Jenilyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is a 64 year old, married, woman with 10 children. She plants and sells vegetables in her community to earn a living. She has 8 years of experience with this business. 

Ida needs a loan to buy a bag of fertilizer, bush knives, rakes, spades and a wheelbarrow. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. Ida has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of fertilizer, bush knives, rakes, spades and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Pacita has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dúo Victoria De San Lorenso Group

texts.es: El dúo Victoria de san Lorenzo está formado por doña Virginia de 38 años de edad  quien posee una panadería en su localidad ya que se dedica a la elaboración de pan y tiene 4 años realizando esta labor con su familia (sus 3 hijos), ella solicita su crédito para comprar una maquina  que amase la masa del pan ya que esto les ayudara a poder disminuir y aprovechar mejor todos los ingredientes para  la mezclar y elaborar el pan, su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran cadena de panaderías y con esto poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos ya que actualmente cuentan con 2 empleados que elaboran el pan y 6 personas que distribuyen el pan en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Virginia, 38 years old, is part of the group Victoria de San Lorenso.  She has a bakery shop in her community.  Virginia has been earning a living by baking bread and carrying out this work for four years with her family (her three children).  She is asking for a loan to buy a machine to process dough for bread.  The machine will help them to make better use of all the ingredients for mixing and making bread.  

Virginia's big dream is to be able to have a chain of bakeries and thus provide her children with a better future.  They currently have two employees who make the bread and six people who distribute it in their community.

loans.use: to buy a machine to process bread dough

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, 33 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

Rosana's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosana has restarted her agriculture business, raising pigs, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosana has taken a PHP 9,714.20 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home. She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Candelaria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Candelaria de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta acompañada, madre de un hijo, su pareja estudio hasta noveno grado y trabaja de motorista.

 Candelaria tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la agricultura, trabajo que realiza junto a su pareja, ademas se dedica a los oficios de su hogar. El crédito sera utilizado en la compra abonos y herbicidas para darle la ultima abonada a la milpa de maiz de verano que sembraron. Los sueños de Candelaria son tener una casa propia y mejorar su calidad de vida, sacar a su hijo adelante y darle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Candelaria, 23 years old, studied through grade six.  She has a life partner, and is mother to a son.  Her partner studied through 9th grade and works as a driver.  Candelaria has been working at farming for five years, work she has done together with her partner.  Besides this she spends time doing the household work. 

The loan will be used to make a last contribution to the summer corn field they have planted.  Candelaria's dreams are to have her own house and improve their quality of life, help her son get ahead and give her a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to make a last contribution to the summer corn field that has been planted

loans.name: Resviminda

texts.en:
Resviminda, 34 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Resviminda and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Resviminda is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,714.20 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. Resviminda plans to recover through her printing business.

With your help, Resviminda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, padre de 6 hijos, esta casado, su esposa estudio hasta quinto grado. Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendio de sus padres desde que era un pequeño, para desplasarse de su hogar al lugar de trabajo, viajan a pie ya que no esta muy retirado. 

Manuel utilizara el crédito para la compra de pesticidas, abonos y para pago de los mosos para la milpa de maíz de verano que junto a su pareja han sembrado. El sueño de Manuel es adquirir un terreno propio para  cultivar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 55 years old and attended school through fifth grade.  He is married and the father of six children.  His wife attended school through fifth grade.  Manuel works as a farmer, which he learned from his parents when he was young.  He travels from his home to where he works on foot since it is not very far.  

Manuel will use this loan to purchase pesticides, fertilizer, and to pay young people for his summer corn field that he planted with his wife.  Manuel's dream is to own his own piece of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, fertilizer, and to pay young people for his summer corn field that he has planted with his wife.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 44 years old, is married and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Janet has run a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She also earns an income from dried fish.

Janet has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Janet has previously borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Guia

texts.en: Ma. Guia, 46 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. Ma. Guia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Ma. Guia has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Ma. Guia would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo es su hombre emprendedor quien tiene la edad de 69 años, casado, dedicado a la agricultura, se ha dedicado a este negocio toda su vida, pues es una herencia de sus padres y solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas mejoradas, saco de urea, pago de alquiler de manzanas de tierras, pago de mozos, etc., cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y nietos, los créditos que le ha brindado la institución le ha ayudado por lo que se siente satisfechos con los logros obtenidos. La institución tiene catorce ciclos que le está financiando y ha demostrado ser una persona honrada, responsable y trabajadora que merece seguir siendo apoyada.
texts.en: Gerardo is an enterprising 69 year old man.  He is married and works as a farmer.  He has done this work all his life since it is an inheritance from his parents.  He is requesting this loan to purchase better seeds and a sack of urea, to pay rent on plots of land, and pay for laborers.  He is counting on the help of his children and grandchildren.  The loans provided by the institution have helped him and he feels satisfied with the achievements he has obtained.  He has received loans from the institution for fourteen cycles and has demonstrated that he is an honorable, responsible, and hardworking person that deserves to continue being supported.

loans.use: to purchase better seeds and a sack of urea, to pay rent for plots of land, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Cristine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell for her general store business like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cristine has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jinemar

texts.en: Jinemar is single and has four siblings. He resides in SND, Lanao del Norte with his family. His parents are farmers and are supporting him with their little income. Jinemar is studying deck watch keeping at (CMTI)  Colegio de moderno y informatico.  He wants to become a seaman in the future and it is his determination to study hard for the family. Recently, he borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 33-years-old and married with five children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Divina has a business buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

She has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money to buy a general store.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Mary May

texts.en:
Mary May is 46 years old and she is married with two children. Mary May works very hard to provide for them.

Mary May's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Mary May has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mary May has taken a PHP 9714.20 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mary May is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Grupo Las Estrellas 4 Group

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 28 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida para poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella se  levanta todos los días para trabajar y solo así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. (Antonia es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)	

Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de maxan en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 5 años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para mantenimiento de maxan para poder cultivar mas maxan en su comunidad, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de maxan produzcan hojas de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Ella se ha convertido en un gran ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se decidieron a emprender juntas a Antonia la siembra de maxan para que ella también tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada en el futuro.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de maxan y ver crecer a sus hermanos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Antonia is 28 years old.  She is an enterprising woman who wants to succeed in life.  She does not let obstacles stop her in life, since she has reached all her goals and dreams.  She gets up every day to work and only has her income to improve her family's living conditions.  Antonia is the first one on the left in the photograph.

She earns money by growing maxan [leaves for wrapping tamales] in the community where she lives.  Her parents taught her this work five years ago.  She sells her products in the market and the area around her community.  This allows her to improve her family's living conditions.  

She will use this loan to maintain her crops so that she can grow more maxan in her community.  It is important to her that her maxan plants produce leaves of the best quality so that she does not lose customers.

She has become a great example in her community, so a group of women decided to join with Antonia to plant maxan so that they will also have adequate living conditions in the future. Her aspirations are to plant more maxan and to see her siblings get a good education and become professionals.

loans.use: to maintain her maxan [leaves for wrapping tamales] crop

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda is 61 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rolinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Rolinda has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita  is a 41-year-old mother of three, and she is settled and living in Oroquieta City with her family. She has been operating a general store in order to make a living. Her previous loan was used for buying rice and corn grits to add to her stock, and it has been repaid successfully. She earns very well from this business and she is planning to improve her offerings. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.
Her plan with her revenue is to use it in addition to her capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing netting.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing netting.

loans.name: Kris Charmaine

texts.en:
Kris Charmaine is 19 years old and married with one kid. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Kris Charmaine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing netting and other equipment.

Kris Charmaine has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing netting and other equipment.

loans.name: Ady

texts.en:
Ady is 27 years old and single.

Ady works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Ady has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ady aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 63 years old and married with six children.

Adelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Adelia has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina has been operating a tailoring business for many long years to make a living. She also sells fabrics and accepts orders for curtains and pillow cases. She earns better income from these activities, and her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She finds ways to improve her business and to offer more to her customers.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy more clothing materials like fabrics and threads in volume. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials like fabrics and threads in volume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, noodles and frozen foods to resell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Teodora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional computer for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teodora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her business.

loans.name: Vengel

texts.en:
As the married mother of six children, Vengel works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Vengel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

Vengel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Daisylyn

texts.en:
Daisylyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Daisylyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Daisylyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Francisca is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Francisca has a vending business in the Philippines; she sells frozen foods and vegetables. Francisca requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods and vegetables to sell.

Francisca has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACHA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magaly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de miel, venta de mantas, venta de faldas, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de papas fritas, venta de golosinas, tienda de barrio, venta de té.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Magaly es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papas fritas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, ya que le ayudaba en su negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ollas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Pacha" will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center. It consists of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Magaly is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are: selling honey, selling blankets, selling skirts, selling food, weaving blankets, selling French fries, selling candies, neighborhood store, and selling tea.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Magaly is one. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a recruiter from the institution. At this time she has a business of selling French fries. She lets it be known that she learned this business from her mother a number of years ago, since she helped her in her family business. Later she decided to launch her independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy pots wholesale, which she will acquire from the vendors in the city of La Paz and then install in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives with her partner and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy pots wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37-years-old and she is married with three children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilyn has been farming corn for 3 years. She also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nomeriana

texts.en:
Nomeriana is 60 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more nipa to sell.

Nomeriana has been in this business for 29 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wilma is 40 years old and she has three children who are in school.

Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Wilma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Josue Zaqueo

texts.es:
Josue de 30 años de edad, en su epoca de niño estudio hasta un tercer grado, dice que siempre quiso estudiar por lo menos hasta un noveno, ya que en ese entonces estudiar un noveno era bastante; pero sus padres no le inculcaban a él el estudio, si no que solo trabajar.

Esta acompañado, tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 5,2,6 años de edad. Él se dedica a la agricultura, su esposa solo se dedica a hacer los oficios de la casa y cuidando los hijos.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos 8 años, él iba a dejarle comida a su padre en la mañana y por la tarde estudiaba, pero viendo la necesidad que sus padres tenian decidio dedicarse de lleno a ayudarle a su padre con la siembra de maiz y frijol. Ahora hace su siembra por si solo para su familia, posee un pequeño terrenito y es ahi donde cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrdaos de maiz y frijol, su esposa cuando puede va ayudarle.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, formula sulfato, herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. 

Sueña con sacar a su familia adelante, darles un buen fururo a ellos, para sus hijos espera que puedan prepararse y ser profecionales y que puedan defenderse ante los demas.
texts.en:
Josue, 30, attended school as a child through the third grade.  He says that he always wanted to study, at least through the 9th grade, because back then to study through the 9th grade was enough.  However, his parents did not emphasize education, but rather work.

Josue has a partner, and he has 3 children aged 2,5, and 6.  He is a farmer, and his wife is a housewife who cares for the children.

Josue has been working in agriculture for 8 years.  He used to leave food for his father in the morning and study in the afternoon, but seeing the needs that his parents had he decided to fully devote himself to helping his father with the corn and bean fields.  Now he has his own crops that he cares for on his own for his family.  He has a small plot of land, and this is where he cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn and beans.  His partner helps him when she can.

Josue is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, sulfate formula, and herbicides for his corn and bean fields.  He dreams of getting ahead with his family and giving them a good future.  He hopes that his children will be able to prepare themselves academically and become professionals, so that they can take care of themselves.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Leocil

texts.en:
Leocil works hard to support her family. Leocil is married and she has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines.

Leocil requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon like deodorant, body spray, lipstick, perfume, etc., to sell to her customers.

Leocil has been in this business for 12 years now.

Leocil would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon like deodorant, body spray, lipstick, perfume, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, cooking oil, cereals, etc. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like shampoo, fabric conditioners, detergent, soap, cooking oil, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ronnie Jun

texts.en:
Ronnie Jun is studying BS Electrical Engineering in the university. He wants to become a licensed engineer and be able to work at a well-known company in the future. He has four siblings who are still studying too.

Ronnie Jun joined Gata Daku MPC and has borrowed a new loan to pay his school tuition fee for the first semester. For him, honesty is the best policy. He wants to become successful in order to have a better living in the future. He always wants his parents to be proud of him.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has an herbal medicine vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Juliana requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more herbal medicine to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Juliana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 32 years old and she has three children. Joy is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Joy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Joy has been raising pigs for five years now, and she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
