Veronica is 46 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Veronica has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 44 years old and married. She has eight children; five of her children are in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for one year now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nyrna

texts.en:
Nyrna is 56 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Nyrna has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Nyrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Deona Ann

texts.en:
Deona Ann is 34 years old, married, and blessed with two children attending school. Despite hardships, she and her husband aimed to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. 

She is engaged in buying and selling fruits, vegetables, meat, and fish within their community, while her husband operates their motorcycle transport business. 

She wants to make her business viable and profitable, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of additional capital of PHP 45,000 to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables, meat, and fish to resell. She believes that she will obtain her loan request to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables, meat, and fish to resell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is married with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Herminia is 48 years old and five of her children are in school.

Herminia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Herminia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Agripina is 49 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Agripina has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Agripina requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

In the future, Agripina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia es una mujer exitosa en su vida laboral, tiene la edad de 61 años, soltera y es propietaria de un taller de costura, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tela como es dacron, satín, encajes, entre telas, hilos, zipper, etc., con el fin de ofrecer un producto de calidad y satisfacer la demanda que tiene por parte de su la clientela.
texts.en: Dionicia is a successful woman in her working life. She is 61 years old, single, and is the proprietor of a sewing workshop. She is applying for the loan for the purchase of fabrics such as Dacron, satin, and lace, among other fabrics, threads, and zippers, with the goal of offering quality products and satisfying the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to buy Dacron, satin, and lace, among other fabrics, threads, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Anilia

texts.en:
Anilia is 42 years old and is married with six children, five of whom are in school.

Anilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling food. Anilia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Anilia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and married; she has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and she also earns income from food vending.

Rowena has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like soap, milk, sugar, and eggs. She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like soap, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Marilou is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for eight years, now.

Marilou requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilou would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jennifer continúa con su negocio de pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella ha sabido aprovechar muy bien sus ingresos ya que ha ahorrado y hasta logro la compra de un vehículo el cual es taxi siendo este un ingreso mas para la familia, Jennifer requiere de otro re préstamo para invertir nuevamente en el negocio para mantener el equilibrio ya que esta es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Jennifer continues with her grocery business located in her home. She has known how to make very good use of her income, since she has saved and even managed to buy a vehicle, which is a taxi that provides one more income for her family. Jennifer needs another loan to invest in her business again in order to maintain the equilibrium, since it is her principal source of income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, canned goods, cereals, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita works hard to support her family. Perlita is married, and she has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan amount to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perlita would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
